title: Party
review: The hotel is in a great location. Centre of the town with plenty of options for eating, shopping and bars. The beach is only minutes away. The room was very spacious and nicely presented. Good size clean bathroom with plenty of towels. The only bad thing I could say is the bed was too hard. Great pillows though. Staff very friendly and helpful.  The residents bar closed a bit too early and it was difficult to get a drink.

title: Friendly place
review: Friendly welcome. Rooms are spacious. Bathroom is clean. Choice at Breakfast is limited. full Irish breakfast is freshly prepared. Breakfast room is outdated. Cushion on coach is ribbed and cold atmosphere.

title: Recommended
review: During 2019 I stayed in Bracken Court a number of times. From weekend stays to 5 nights and I would recommend to anyone. The rooms are warm beds comfortable. The breakfast is excellent served by friendly attentive staff. Its only 25 minutes drive to Dublin Airport.

title: Great venue for an event
review: Bracken Court hosted an event for us this weekend. Staff could not have been more helpful. The function room was clean and well prepared for our needs. Food in the bar and carvery was great and staff friendly and helpful throughout. Would definitely recommend this venue.

title: Outstanding Visit
review: My gal and I spent a week at the Bracken Court. It was excellent. The staff were warm, welcome and extremely helpful. We used Balbriggan as a home base and utilized the train to Dublin and the M1 by car. It was very convenient. I happen to be a very picky eater but I was able to find nice food alternatives. Make sure you sample the fish and chunky chips. We plan on returning to the region in the future and we will definitely keep this hotel in mind when we do.

title: ups and downs
review: stayed bank hol weekend , lovely room 411, only down point but not major was the arch wall in what is a new decorative  wall  on front of building  so we could only see a grey wall  ,so whatever made them put the arch there is a mystery,just ruins the room rest of wall is flat so dosnt obscure windows , dinner in restaurant on sat night was ecellent , with brilliant service could do with a side plate on table , breakfast on sun was awful, its self service with a a guy behind counter dishing out food , it was cold and poor quality, we had dinner on sun night and it was a disaster, the service was terrible, 2 servers on and only 5 tables occupied, when we got there at 7pm the tables were not laid up, we were sat at a table that was partly made up waitress then brought more cutlery…

title: Disappointing
review: Dear drunkengauger,  Many thanks for your recent review of the hotel after the bank holiday weekend. I am very happy that you did enjoy many aspects of your stay and although some experiences were not as good, you have still given us a very good rating so thank you. Regarding the wall issue, I take your point completely! I will speak with our team to investigate the issues that you experienced on the Sunday as this is very unusual so apologies. I do hope that the ups outweighed the downs for you and that you will return to stay with us, we look forward to welcoming you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Perfect for Lunch
review: We stayed in the Bracken bevor a couple of times over from Germany visiting relatives in Balbriggan. This time we were disappointed at how the Standard had dropped and about the bad condition of the premises. The room was very big but facing the main road which was very noisy. The windows were draughty and did not shut any noise out. The carpet had old stains. The hooks for  coats were above the suitcase rack and not practical. The safe out of order. Two hangers in the wardrobe were broken with nails sticking out, one was missing on an empty hook. I reported that but nothing was done about that. The shower tap was jarred and non functional except if one loved to be scalded. All lights in the room were very dim, too much energy saving to be able to see properly. As we did not…

title: Comfortable stay
review: Dear Ulla G,  Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of the hotel after your stay with us, it is very much appreciated. However, I was so disappointed reading through your feedback. As a regular guest that visits the hotel, I am so sorry that you encountered these issues throughout your stay and I can assure you that everything will be addressed with urgency. If you would like to discuss any of these points further, please do feel free to contact me directly at georgina@brackencourt.ie. We are in the middle of a refurbishment plan and I do hope that you will return when visiting family as you have always liked the hotel. I look forward to hearing from you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Hard to Find
review: Popped by for some lunch today. Ordered the chicken and chorizo pasta dish with a side dish of garlic cheese fries.   Didnt take long for the food to come out and  it was a pretty generous serving. Really nice lunch and the establishment seemed like a nice place for a few pints after work.   If in Balbriggan, its definitely a good place to go for lunch.

title: Disappointing
review: Whilst the sheets & the bathroom were very clean the floor tiles were badly cracked, the carpet stained & plaster/paper was peeling off the ceiling. The room smelled of damp but copious amounts of spray was used to try & disguise it. All fixtures & fittings were tatty. Breakfast, which was supposed to start at 7am had no hot food self service. Instead one staff member took individual orders & fed them one by one into the kitchen. She also had to seat everyone & deal with queries. The food was hot & on a hot plate but very slow. Cold selection was minimal & the restaurant smelled of damp. Side plates weren’t all clean and you had to root to get a fresh one. I arrived in the middle of the night for work & it was too late to find alternative accommodation.

title: Very nicely decorated clean comforable
review: Dear CC123456789,  Many thanks for your recent review of the hotel, we love to receive feedback after our guest's departure and proactively ensure that we react to all points raised. I will have our maintenance department address the issues within your room. regarding the breakfast, when we have lower numbers in house, we do opt for table service as we feel the quality will be better. I am so sorry that you encountered these problems during your stay but can assure you that they will be addressed. Many thanks again for your feedback.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Not a 4 star in my eyes
review: This place really is charming.  It looks like the town around it is declining but this hotel itself is wonderful and very comfortable.  The best food is a few exits away but they have secure parking and a wonderful staff and well kept rooms

title: Really enjoyed our short break
review: Dear Fraffle,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review after your recent stay with us, very much appreciated. I am so delighted to hear that you enjoyed all the charms that the hotel has to offer and you explored our town somewhat. I do hope that you will return to us again and we look forward to welcoming you again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Lovely Stay
review: Room was big furniture was old dated and broken lamps full off dust hair band with clumps off hair found down side off sofa bed. Breakfast was a real let down no fried eggs toaster was broken cud goon

title: Good experience
review: Very nice hotel ,5 mins walk to beautiful sea side, right in the heart of town,service is good ,and good size rooms.very clean and food is good too,staff is friendly and helpful,20 me na from Dublin airport.36 km to Dublin city.

title: Family Wedding
review: Dear Qazi84,  Thank you very much for your recent review of the hotel after your stay with us, we love to receive feedback so thank you for taking the time to post. It is so good to hear that you enjoyed your stay so much, I will pass on all of your feedback and comments to the team. We are indeed very accessible to Dublin Airport and city centre whilst also having the charm of our beautiful seaside town, so glad you got the time to explore. We look forward to welcoming you again very soon.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Pub grub
review: My family and I recently stayed for 2 nights for my brother and his wife's wedding this week, it was a beautiful day and a great night. I would first like to say that while it is very easy to nit pick at the quality of anything while staying at a hotel, from the room of the food or whatever other service that may not have been 100%, and I could also do that, better signs for the hotel parking or the handles on the dressers were missing some screws, however in this case I am more than happy to comment of the absolute excellent aspects of our stay at this hotel; The food in both the bar, breakfast and most importantly at the wedding was fabulous. The rooms were lovely and clean and when we asked for additional towels and pillows our request was handled with a smile and quickly.  …

title: Very pleasant stay
review: Dear Sharon,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review after your recent stay with us for the very happy occasion of a family wedding. It is so nice to receive these reviews and I am so delighted that both your stay and the wedding was such a success. Thank you for pointing out the small improvements that we can make, always good to receive all feedback but huge thanks for your wonderful review of our team here at the hotel. we are so proud of each and every one of them and they do make every experience better. I had the pleasure of looking after you all and along with the team, we are grateful and we enjoyed hosting your event. I do hope that we will see you again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: A home from home
review: Meet up with a couple of friends once every couple of weeks to eat/catch up... our choice this time, I was so embarrassed, starters arrived had to ask for bread that was to come with soup, then ask for cutlery. Main courses arrived, mine was wrong, did not want to make a scene, ate anyway. Ordered desserts, half an hour later had to ask for them, they forgot. Then ask again for cutlery, soup spoons were given!!! Get your act together folks has potential, staff need to be trained, manager needs to step up.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Have stayed at the Bracken Court several times and each time was excellent. Staff very friendly and helpful.  Free underground parking. Spotless clean and very spacious rooms. Nice and quiet throughout the stay.

title: Very comfortable beds.
review: Dear PM-25091963,  Thank you very much from all of us here at the hotel for your review as a regular customer. This means so much to us that you have taken the time to post. The housekeeping team will be delighted that you have found the rooms so spotlessly clean each time you stay and indeed most of our rooms are very spacious. Our team here are excellent in their customer service role so thank you again for bringing this to our attention. I do hope that you will continue to stay with us and we very much look forward to welcoming you once again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Feels like home
review: Very comfortable beds. The room and en suite is very clean but dated furniture. Fittings and fixtures missing or broken all around the hotel. Some amazing Art works on the walls. Tv channels selection is awful. Breakfast and evening food poor value and disappointing.  Staff excellent.

title: First night stop over in Ireland
review: Dear c K,  Thank you very kindly for your recent review of the hotel, it is very much appreciated. It is great that you have given our staff an excellent rating and I will pass on your comments to the team. The hotel will be going through some refurbishment over the next year or so and furnishings etc will be upgraded but delighted that you enjoyed some of our artwork. Disappointing to hear that you did not enjoy the food here at the hotel, again I will revert to the chef and the team. I do hope that you will consider returning again ans we look forward to welcoming you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Great Hotel at Affordable Prices
review: We've stayed here five times over two years. The rooms are very comfortable. The location is excellent (near Dublin, yet still a small town feeling). But the outstanding feature is the staff. If it is humanly possible to do something to help you feel welcome and comfortable, they will do it. Yet they are businesslike as well. The prices are incredibly reasonable for what you get (including free parking).

title: Great Staff!
review: We had a lovely family stay in the Bracken Court Hotel. It was a great value base from which to work from as we visited the Zoo and Funtasia which are both 30mins and 15mins drive respectively.  The Hotel itself is a bit dated but it was very clean and comfortable and the Staff in every area we met could not have been more helpful or friendly. A special mention would have to go to the Restaurant Staff though who were so lovely to my two girls asking them about their trip to the Zoo etc. They were given Easter pictures to colour in also which was a nice touch! Balbriggan itself doesnt seem to have much going on but there is a lovely beach only a 3minute walk from the hotel which the kids enjoyed. The train station is also beside the beach so we hopped on for a trip to the next…

title: Old Grand Hotel
review: Dear cc2000,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review after your Easter break, we do love to receive feedback on all our services and providers such as all the places you visited. It looks like you had a busy few days. I was delighted to read that the staff were so welcoming and attentive to all of you, we are very proud of them. I will pass on your kind words. I see you had time to visit our wonderful beach and found that the public transport options are also very convenient. I do hope you will all visit again soon, we look forward to seeing you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: difficult to get to for the first time
review: Old world hotel quite classic. The public areas are rich. The restaurant and bar are a bit dated. Same is true for some of the furnishings. The staff are friendly the rooms are large and the furnishings are quite good. The bed in our room had past it’s prime and should be replaced. The bathroom was a good size and adequate. The breakfast was to say the least excellent. Great variety full Irish delicious breakfast. Overall I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel providing good value for money.

title: Friendly & Welcoming Hotel
review: Dear SkyKing50,  Thank you so much for your review, very much appreciated indeed. It is great to hear that you would recommend us providing value for money, this is very important to us. We do have refurbishment plans in place for some of the items that you have mentioned but, again delighted that all other aspects of your stay were successful, including friendly staff and a great breakfast. I will pass on all this feedback and we look forward to seeing you again soon.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Lovely weekend break
review: Not being from the area this was difficult to get to as far as of where to park.  Once we parked we had to go to the second floor. There is no lift, my mom uses a walker, we were going to have to drop here off at the front ( which there was no space as there were two cars parked there) Luckly we found a parking spot on the first floor, we were able to walk around to the front. Check in was ok. Our room was on the third floor at the very end of a hallway. We did have a "family room" but I would think if you saw someone with a walker you would try to get them  a closer room to the elevator.  We also had some issues with the gulls. There were two seagulls that were very loud out side our window all the time.  Our shower also would back up when showering. It wasn't horrible but…

title: Amazed at the size of the room
review: I was shocked when I opened the door and saw how big my room was. Not sure of all the rooms are this size or not but mine seemed more like a suite. Check in was very easy and the staff were very friendly and exceeded my expectations for customer service. Food was very good and the bar was a great place to hang out in the evening.   The only negative thing I can say about this place is that things seemed a bit run down. Most of the furniture in my room was old and had many scratches and dings. Beds were not the most comfortable I've slept on and could use replacement. However, the sheets were clean as well as the rest of the room.   I would stay here again in the future.

title: Excellent short stay
review: Dear Talks2cops,  Many thanks for taking the time to review the hotel after your recent stay with us, it is very much appreciated. our rooms are extremely diverse in nature and some are indeed extremely big, you were probably here on a night when we were full so you struck gold with the bigger room!! The hotel does have plans for bedroom refurbishment in the future so this will address your only negative but delighted to see that everything else was really positive and that you enjoyed it so much. We look forward to seeing you here again at the hotel.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Couldn't sleep Saturday night with music form bar
review: Good was superb, excellent friendly staff. Big room and great location for a stroll on the beach.we will be back, good free parking facilities too. Watched the rugby in the bar so good sports bar also.

title: How is it a four star hotel???
review: Dear Amc 115,  Thank you very much for your recent review of the hotel, even if your stay was just a short one, it is very much appreciated. I am so delighted to hear that you enjoyed the stay so much. I will certainly pass on all your very positive feedback to all the team here at the hotel. We look forward to welcoming you back in the very near future and thank you again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Weekend away
review: I given an average rating as the noise from the live music entertainment on Saturday night was unacceptable! My room was on the 2nd floor and I couldn't sleep because of the loud music. The music eventually finished at 2.07am!!! The hotel should consider adding sound barriers in the bar. The bar menu was limited and did not offer light bites and regular sandwiched.  On the plus side the hotel was nice, clean and the staff were helpful. The breakfast was nice too. Such a pity about the loud music

title: Laytown races
review: September 2017  Lovely hotel and good value for money. We stayed here so we could go to Laytown races. It was conveniently situated between the races and Dublin City centre.  The hotel was clean and staff were helpful.

title: Vintage comfortable and cosy
review: Dear A5688RFhdhd,  It was very kind of you to take the time to post a review of the hotel after your recent visit, I do hope that you had some luck at the races!! I am delighted to see that our location suited your needs and you could travel without any stress. I will pass your review to the team and we do hope to see you again here at the hotel. Thank you again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Pleasant
review: A cosy warm place very close to the beach. Tasty Irish breakfast, fully equipped and clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff. It has its own garage for guests. Great value for money. I will definitely come back!

title: A Very Pleasant Stay
review: Dear effychiachart80,  Thank you very much for your review of the hotel after your stay with us. I do love the title of your review, "Vintage comfortable and cosy". I really could not sum up the hotel any better so thank you for your summation. I will pass on all your wonderful comments to the chef and all of the team who will be delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay so much. Our friendly and helpful team would love to see you again, we look forward to welcoming you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Terrible from start to finish
review: This old stylish but pleasant hotel is a great place to stay. Off Peak one can get a good deal if one books in advance. The rooms are clean and comfy and the hotel is right in the town centre close to everything including the train station and bus stop if you use public transport.

title: Food For Thought?
review: My wife and I have just returned home after spending a weekend at the Bracken Court. We have travelled and stayed in many hotels throughout Ireland and I can honestly say this was a different experience in many ways. The hotel we found to be nowhere near the level of 4* hotels we have stayed in elsewhere however I will say the staff work extremely hard to make the stay enjoyable.(Thomas excellent service in the bar). Our biggest disappointment was the food, there is no difference between the bar food and the restaurant menu and to call a dish a seafood linguine when you take a bowl of pasta and pour the seafood chowder from the same menu over the top says a lot for the creativity of the chef.  Not acceptable........

title: Fab carvery
review: Dear des p,  Thank you so much for posting a review of the hotel after your recent stay with us. It is through these channels that we can monitor and if necessary review standards and procedures. I am so very sorry to hear that you did not feel the hotel up to 4 star standard and I would have loved the opportunity to speak with you regarding this. I can be contacted at georgina@brackencourt.ie I am however delighted that the staff made you feel very welcome and the service was excellent form Thomas, I will pass him on this feedback, he will appreciate it. I will, of course speak with the chef and the team regarding your comments on the food. We do actually have a separate TDH for the restaurant, again very sorry that you were maybe not shown this. Hopefully, the service provided means that you may return in the future.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Delightful afternoon tea
review: Gorgeous hot and very reasonably priced carvery lunch. Huge choice and lovely staff. Looking forward to a return visit soon. Children and adults catered for. Clean comfortable   restaurant and plenty of underground parking albeit a bit tight

title: Lovely warm place
review: Dear LSHT,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review of our carvery after having lunch with us recently, this is very much appreciated. Our carvery is indeed very popular and we run it 6 days per week so you are welcome back at any time to enjoy another lunch. I am afraid that I can not do anything about the parking but I do look forward to welcoming your party again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Pleasantly surprised
review: After having a wonderful experience here last April for my daughter's birthday we decided to return as a treat with my friend and our children. Last time we were in the restaurant as we were a larger group and it was fabulous and all the children enjoyed it. This time, as it was a smaller group, we were in a cosy little area of the lobby behind the reception. I would highly recommend you choose this area as it is quiet and away from the general hustle and bustle of hotel life, it's more private and discreet. Nothing was too much to ask the staff for ie our drinks were replenished quickly when we were finished. I had requested simple sandwiches which were delicious and devoured. As for the cakes? Wow!! There was a huge variety and so many we had to take some home. There was the…

title: excellent
review: We booked a groupon for this hotel for the wifes birthday and it really didn't disappoint. The food was of a high quality and so was the service, friendly and professional. They also upgraded us to a suite as i'd said it was the wifes birthday which was amazing, had a really nice time here, would definately recommend.

title: Excellent short break
review: Dear alexisdni,  Thank you so very much for taking the time to post a review of the hotel after your recent visit, always good to receive feedback in any form, so thank you. It is fantastic to hear that you enjoyed yourself so much and that you would definitely recommend us! We do try and go that little extra mile for people who are celebrating so glad to see that you were treated to an upgrade. I hope that you will return to us soon and we look forward to welcoming you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Great spot
review: We are just back from a 3 day short break at the Bracken Court Hotel. The customer service they provide is great. They contacted me a few days before leaving home to check all the arrangement and answered all my queries re parking and arrival times.  We arrived very early on the Tuesday morning (11.00) and parked the car in the underground carpark - free by the way. We went into the hotel left our bags in and the heading off to the Train station - 5 minutes  walk away.  A week before arriving  I had purchased online a Visitor 72 hour Leap Card  at a cost of 19.50 euros. This card gave us access to the Train , Dart, Buses and the Luas - hIghly recommended as we were able to visit Dublin each day and also Bray (on the DART).  Our hotel deal included a 3 course meal which we had on…

title: What a gem
review: Dear Tourist59,  Many thanks for your excellent review of the hotel after your mini break with us, very much appreciated. I see that you certainly planned your trip well in advance and were very organised in organising your travel arrangements so you could get around throughout the stay. The public transport is indeed very handy to the hotel and reasonably priced for the fervent traveller who like to get out and about. Delighted that you enjoyed the food and that the staff were helpful. The rooms are indeed spacious and I will of course pass on your comments regarding the TV's. Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again in the future.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Brillant BUT
review: We attended a wedding in Bracken Court. The Hotel is nicely decorated, very good efficient bar service. Car parking was available.  Good prices on drink. The staff at the wedding function could not have been more attentive. Food was served without any delay.  Tasty hot food was plentiful.  Great function. Lovely experience.

title: Excellent stay!
review: We stayed here twice during our trip to Ireland in September. First stay was when we first landed then at the end of our trip. We didn't want to stay right in Dublin so this town by the ocean was perfect! Rooms were comfortable and the breakfasts were to die for. Fish and chips were very tasty as was the Guiness!

title: Great Hotel
review: Dear Tafferdils,  Many thanks for taking the time to post a review of the hotel after your recent stays with us, at the beginning and the end of your trip!! I see you enjoyed all aspects of the hotel, food and beverage, great to see that you enjoyed both. It can be a real change to stay by the ocean as opposed to a big city, very calming and peaceful. If you are travelling to Ireland again, I do hope that you will pay us a visit, we look forward to welcoming you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Afternoon Tea on a busy Saturday afternoon
review: We stayed at the Bracken Court for 3 nights for our daughter's wedding.  Our booking was for a luxury suite, and it was nicely decorated in shades of beige with deep red curtains, chairs and bed coverngs giving a nice touch of colour. Bathroom was particularly large with a shower and large jacuzzi bath.   Breakfast was very good: a good selection on the cold buffet with hot food served by a very pleasant chef.  The room for the ceremony was beautiful, and the function room was even nicer. The meal was one of the nicest we have had, and was served with great style and panache.  The bar was very pleasant, and the many meals we ate there followed the same theme: hot, well presented, generous portion and tasted great. One evening we ordered platters of finger food for our group:…

title: Comfort and convenience
review: Dear Pat,  Thank you so very much for your lovely review after the very happy occasion of your daughter's wedding, I remember it well and it an absolute pleasure to look after you all on the day and right throughout the weekend. It is so great to hear that you enjoyed all the food, on the day and elsewhere in the hotel, the chef will be very pleased to hear it!! We are delighted that the day was such a success, exactly what we like to achieve for all of our very special brides and grooms. We look forward to seeing you again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Two nights at the Bracken Court Hotel
review: Bracken Court Hotel is situated in the town of Balbriggan but has parking. The disabled parking spaces are a bit of a walk away from the hotel entrance. We visited for afternoon tea. Staff kindly accommodated our wish to sit in the foyer. Tea was served in individual willow pattern teapots with matching cups and saucers. Sandwiches were fresh and interesting: salmon on brown scone with caramelised onion, coronation chicken on ciabatta, egg mayonnaise and ham and sun-dried tomato. Scones were bite sized, 1 plain and 1 fruit each, served with strawberry jam, lemon curd and clotted cream. The scones were slightly doughy with plenty of raisins in the fruit scone. The jam and curd were good. We realised the benefit of the size of the scones when it came to the mini treats. They…

title: Wedding
review: We are just back from a 3 day stay in the Bracken Court. I can’t rate it highly enough. Jean done a great job coordinating with me in the months leading up to our wedding, nothing was too much trouble.  The day itself went brilliant, Georgina went above and beyond to make sure we were looked after, and also was brilliant with my daughter. Took her off twice for balloons when she got upset and just made a big fuss of her.  We had absolutely no problems or complaints, from the time I arrived on Thursday till I left on Sunday was just fantastic. All the staff looked after us amazingly well.   Thank you all for making the most important day of our lives go so smoothly.   Christine & David Halpin.

title: keith s
review: Dear Christine & David,  Thank you so much for your lovely review after the very happy event of your wedding day, I do hope you are all keeping well and married life is good! I am so happy reading through your review to see that you had such a successful and wonderful time throughout your stay and of course on the special day. It was an absolute pleasure to look after you all on the day and Jean also sends her regards. Please don't be a stranger now and come and visit us some time soon. We look forward to seeing you, happy new year.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Fabulous stay
review: great place to stay & entertainment was excellent .will certainly stay again good location & lots to do nearby ardgillan castle , bremore castle  balbriggan beach , skerries .hotel is very near train station to belfast or dublin city

title: Return visit
review: Dear northcountycarriages,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review of the hotel after your recent stay with us, very much appreciated. I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay so much and of course that you intend to stay again!! We do try and put entertainment on for most of our busy evenings to enhance the experience so glad that you partook and enjoyed!! Thank you also for mentioning all of our local attractions, we hope to see you again soon and we very much look forward to welcoming you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Surprise trip
review: Family of 4 stayed for 3 nights in this lovely hotel. We had a 2 bedroom suite with loads of space, kids loved having their own room. First class service from when we arrived until we left. Breakfast was first class. Our evening meal was amazing, my husband said his steak was the beat he ever had. Nothing was too much trouble. Close to local amenities and the beach. We definitely hope to return.

title: Balbriggan
review: The Bracken Court is a comfortable 4* hotel, right in the middle of the North CO Dublin town of Balbriggan.  It has to be said that Balbriggan is not a destination town as it is not very attractive, but it is only 20  miles from Dublin,  on a good motorway road, and not far from Dublin Airport. and could be useful for travellers wanting a nearby hotel to the airport.  The hotel,has everything you find in a four star hotel and it does them well.

title: Amazing Value
review: Dear Pips21,  Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of the hotel and of course Balbriggan after your stay with us, it is very much appreciated and welcomed. I am very happy to see that the hotel met your expectations as a four star and that the location was both useful and practical and thank you for pointing out how accessible we are. Balbriggan is a rapidly growing town and in time, there are many plans for the town which aim to improve as a destination, I do hope that you will visit again in the near future.   Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Friendly and Convenient
review: We have stayed in this hotel on several occasions and always found it superb value.  We book 2 nights B&B plus 1 Evening Meal always at the weekend.  The staff are so friendly and welcome us back.  They know us so well now.  There are four of us and we get the same 2 rooms all the time very spacious and bedclothes spotless so white.  The bathroom has a massive walk-in shower which I need.  The bar is always busy and even the locals are friendly.  It’s on the North side which is so handy and a short drive to Swords, Malahide, Howth such lovely scenery.  I would have no hesitation in recommending Bracken Court and can’t wait for my next wee weekend there.

title: Fantastic carvery lunch!!
review: Dear Olive M,  Thank you so much for your recent review of the hotel, very much appreciated. I am glad to see that you are a regular customer who visits us often and that we are maintaining both our standards and welcome for you all, this is exactly why we have so many regulars and love to look after them!! It sounds like you have really settled in with us and even the locals!! We are looking forward to welcoming you on your next visit, thank you again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Cracking staff are what make this hotel !
review: Hotel perfectly suited our group as we needed easy access to Dublin Airport, the seaside and Naul. Spacious rooms - bigger than we expected. Bathroom was large with ample counter space and roomy shower. Great hotel staff - they went above and beyond. Cozy, relaxed bar area. We also appreciated being able to park in the adjacent, secure parking garage.

title: Four star???
review: I was surprised to see this hotel rated as four star. We stayed in a three star hotel in Armagh the previous night at the same price and it was streets ahead in quality. The Bracken needs a face lift. The carpet in the common areas and dining room is dirty and needs replacing. The room was ok but the arm on a chair had fallen out. Didn’t take long to put it back in. Surely staff could do that! The bathroom was nice. The hotel room was quiet and spacious.

title: Staff are lovely
review: Dear RB5655,  Thank you so much for your review of the hotel after your recent stay with us, all comments and feedback are invaluable to us. I am so sorry to hear that you would not rate us as a four star, I can assure you that we go through all the necessary inspections and criteria to maintain our stars. We do however have refurbishment plans for the very near future and I can assure you that the issues you have raised will be addressed within these. Besides the maintenance issues that you have raised, I do hope that you enjoyed your stay and that you would consider returning. Thank you again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Needs better upkeep
review: Just home from a 3 night family break at this hotel and had a lovely time. The staff were all v.friendly & helpful and v.kind to our 2 children nothing seemed too much trouble. Our hotel room was a suite which was better than expected although a bit grubby and tiresome in places we all had a very comfortable sleep. On our last night we splashed out and ordered steaks in the hotel restaurant which were both quite fatty and not done to our taste. We didnt complain as we were hungry and didnt want to make a scene. The village itself is quiet but we spent most of our days out and about (Dublin Zoo,Tayto park, & Funtasia inc in price of hotel around €600.) Balbriggan beach is beautiful and its just around the corner and theres a lovely icecream parlour close by which the kids loved.…

title: Very Comfortable Stay
review: Dear Barbara T,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review of the hotel, very much appreciated. It makes me so happy when I see continuous comments regarding the staff her at the hotel being so attentive to families and children alike, delighted that they went out of their way. I am however so surprised to hear about your steaks, we usually serve up excellent steaks but yes unfortunately sometimes things can go wrong, so sorry. I will pass on all your comments to the housekeeping and maintenance team and assure you that they will be taken seriously. I am also delighted that you had the time to enjoy our beautiful beach and the local ice cream shop, I do hope that you will visit us again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Superb stay
review: Lovely hotel inside the lobby bar and dining areas are really well presented. The rooms are nicely decorated but there are just things that let it down. Don't get me wrong I enjoyed my two night stay but there was silly mistakes and things that made this room look grubby. There was an obvious leak from the room above ours at some point and the ceiling of the bathroom in our room hadn't been painted to cover the stains which took away from the nice bathroom. It was clear it maybe wasn't cleaned very well as there was a lot of hairs on the bathroom wall which I'm sure was a one off mistake as the hair was in a weird place in the bathroom this can be seen in the photos. The handles on the bathroom door were miss matched and not secured on property which was a bit silly. You could…

title: Nice place to stay
review: We stayed here on a overnight to Dublin Airport and the staff upgraded us and treated us very well indeed. The food was excellent and the bar was very comfortable. Great breakfast in the morning and we were very satisfied with our stay. Greta value for the price.

title: Anything less than 5 stars is crazy!
review: Dear DerryEddie,  Many thanks for your recent review of the hotel after your stay with us. It is great to hear that you had such a great time during your stay. Sometimes, in these busy months when we are full, we need to upgrade so you were the lucky ones on this occasion, glad you enjoyed the room. I will pass on your feedback to the chef and his team regarding the food. Our bar is a popular spot all right and can become very comfortable during your stay!! I do hope that you will return in the near future and we look forward to welcoming you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Lovely location
review: Firstly let me start by saying this isn’t your up market five start hotel but it is an amazing hotel. Check in is at 3pm we arrived at 9:30am and although our room wasn’t ready we had our bags taken so we didn’t need to carry them with us all day and receptionist very kindly checked train times to Dublin and showed us where the train station was. 40 minutes on a train to Dublin and only €20 for 2 of us. We came back at night to the hotel and were checked in and showed to our room in no time. Room was massive and lovely as I said it’s not your five star luxury but the rooms are lovely and more than for their purpose. Bar and restaurant always looked busy although because we spent most of our time in Dublin we didn’t use it. Check out at 12pm is a bonus and free parking as well.…

title: Family trip
review: Dear Kris W,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review of the hotel, it is very much appreciated. I was delighted to see that you enjoyed your stay so much albeit alot of your time was spent in Dublin. We are very convenient to Dublin as you have stated and it is a beautiful train journey and very reasonably priced. I am glad that the team here at the hotel were so accommodating and organised your bags and timetables, we are here to help. We are looking forward to welcoming you back to the hotel, next time, you will have to try our bar and restaurant, I can assure you, you will not be disappointed. Thank you again.  Kind Regards,  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Three night Family break ruined due to bed issue
review: Chose this as a good jumping off for Dublin and Northern Ireland.  Lovely by the sea and easy train ride into the city. A bit disappointed in the hotel as we had problems the first night with our shower and toilet.  Asked for someone to look at both while we were gone for the day and, although the toilet noise was fixed, we were unable to use the shower at all during our stay.  Bar was ok but wanted a sweeter, less dry wine and only a couple choices were available.  Breakfast was nice and room adequate.  Would have liked to have more English-speaking television stations but really not there to watch TV.  Folks at the front desk were very welcoming and helped us with directions.  The gentleman there as we left was nice about the shower issue.  It was our wedding anniversary so a…

title: Ms
review: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. He payed 320 euro for these days. We were not satisfied when we opened the room number 401 😱😱 the wallpaper was coming off from the wall, huge stain under the tv on the carpet, the chair was falling apart, dust on the picture on the wall, the sink was blocked, winter duvet on the bed and without ac, courtains are from the last century. At least the bed was clean 😏 the reception guys were nice, and the bar was ok, but if you pay this amount of money you expect a great room and not a bad b&b standard of the room... so if you decide to stay there than please do not expect a 4 stars hotel's standard. I wouldn't recommend this place.

title: Not worth the money
review: Dear Veronika S,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review of the hotel after your two night stay with us, we do appreciate all feedback and comments form our guests. I am so sorry to hear that the room was so disappointing to you, I only wish that you had requested a room move or reported some attention needed as we may have been able to resolve some of the issues but I have taken your report very seriously and will endeavor to have all attended to. At this time, I can only apologise for your disappointment and if you would like to discuss this further, I am at georgina@brackencourt.ie. I would welcome your comments.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Disappointing
review: Shower going from hot to freezing constantly.Carpets filthy.Steak meal in restaurant was not good. Only 2 things on the positive were reception staff were friendly and the bed was comfortable.wont be back,very disappointed

title: Amazing
review: Dear Louise B,  Thank you very much for your recent review of the hotel after your stay with us, much appreciated. I am however so very sorry that you did not enjoy your stay so much. I was so surprised to hear that the steak dinner was not good as we have a solid reputation in the Bracken Grill for steaks so this disappoints me and I will pass your feedback to the chef and his team. I am sorry about the shower temperature and the carpets, we do have refurbishment planned so I do hope that you will possibly return at a later date but thank you again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: The Breakfast Buffet is Amazing!
review: Stayed in this hotel for a weekend away with my partner, were given a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the street which turned out to be very noisy, as the weather was very warm we had to leave the windows open a bit, we could then hear everything from people leaving the bars trying to get lifts and taxis up to 2am then the traffic starting to move at around 6am again. The room needs bit of updating, carpet was bit grubby, paint starting to peel in places, think the shower was the most disappointing kept going from hot to cold just couldn't get it to stay constant, girl at reception said they'd get their maintenance man to look at it, there was a kettle in the room for making tea or coffee but was quarter full of dirty water, had to rinse it out and boil it before use,…

title: Great food
review: Parking in the  garage, friendly reception lovely staff. Grubby lift not a good first impression. Our room was great 401 suite hot tub great shower really comfortable bed. Lively bar, we eat in the restaurant ordered our food waited 45 mins had to for some bread!! Still no food asked why the delay was informed rather order was forgotten. Very apologetic. When our food arrived it was really superb  could fault it ,sticky toffee pudding the best we’ve ever eaten.

title: Nice Hotel
review: Dear Robert & Suzie F,  Many thanks for taking the time to post a review of the hotel after your recent stay with us. I am so very sorry that there was a delay with your food but I have to thanks you for being so patient and understanding and then to rate us high, very much appreciated. I will pass on your kind comments to the chef and of course the rest of the team who looked after you. I will address your comments on the lift but delighted that your room was excellent for you. Look forward to seeing you again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: 4star?????
review: Clean big room, Friendly Staff, Nice Food nothing to special but quite nice.  Town seems dead.  Hotel is complete maze. got lost going to reception twice.  Tons of parking, Massive underground car park with validated parking

title: Lovely hotel
review: Dear LeeSideExplorer,  Thank you so much for your recent review of the hotel, it is very much appreciated. It is great to see that you have given us a four star rating and that your room was spacious and clean, delighted to hear all the staff were friendly and you enjoyed the food. Our parking facilities are certainly an advantage when travelling and as this is complimentary, a big saving!! I do hope that you will return to the hotel at a future date, we look forward to welcoming you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Lovely stay
review: I don't know how this hotel has a 4 star rate. Our room was well tired. Stained carpets and toilet seat hanging off. Bar food poor. A mix up with sauce on chicken wings. Asked for spicy and got bbq. The chef said no they were spicy and took them back and dosed them in chilli. Totally in edible. Breakfast was nice and good atmosphere in bar. I wouldnt return and pay 4 star rates for this hotel as I've stayed in much nicer and cleaner hotels

title: Nice hotel but needs to improve on a few things.
review: I stayed here one night on business. The hotel is nice, if a little shabby, the rooms look quite worn, and could definitely do with a bit of TLC. The reception desk staff were friendly and helpful. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was clean, with a nice powerful shower. Breakfast was a bit of a letdown - very basic for the price, and the breakfast staff seemed uninterested - the only thing I could get my hands on was breakfast cereal, no toast, and the coffee was nearly undrinkable. Overall average - I'd stay here again, but would probably have breakfast elsewhere. Free parking in the underground carpark next door is handy and the free wifi was good.

title: We stayed our last night in Ireland and were pleased with the accomodations.
review: Dear Randwharton,  Thank you so much for your recent review of the hotel, it is very much appreciated. I am delighted to hear that staff were welcoming and that your bedroom was satisfactory, albeit, a bit tired. we do have refurbishment planned so I do hope that you will visit us again. I wish to apologise for your breakfast experience as you should have been looked after and directed to all menu items. I will ensure that this will be looked at, thank you for the feedback and we look forward to seeing you again.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: enjoyable visit
review: The hotel staff was very helpful (thank you Zoe, Janice, and Mary) to rectify a mistake I made.   The rooms were nice and the restaurant was good.   We did learn (expensively) that the hotel is several miles from the airport and cost about 50 Euros by cab. However, the bus system is excellent and a third the cost. Consider taking it.

title: affordable room away from the chaos of Dublin
review: Dear Sean Q,  Many thanks for posting a review of the hotel after your recent visit with us. It is great to hear that your last night in Ireland was spent with us and that you had a great stay. I will pass on your kind comments to the team. I am sorry that you did not learn about the bus service to the airport any earlier and it would have saved you some money but next time you can avail of the bus! We hope that your journey home was comfortable and we look forward to welcoming you here at the hotel again at some stage.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: A bit too hot...
review: Lovely big quiet room at reasonable price, all staff extremely helpful and friendly. breakfast was tasty with a good selection and varied evening menu.  Nice handy location for town centre beach and railway and bus services and all other ameneties

title: Staff are excellent
review: I’ve been staying in this hotel weekdays for work the past 3 weeks and I must admit the staff are   really exceptional. Every one of them from check in, housekeeping, night porter, reception, kitchen staff and management can not do enough for you they really go above and beyond and are a credit to the hotel. Any request I have is taken care of nothing too big or too small. As time goes on and the more I see the more impressed I am with levels of professionalism. I am in no way affiliated or know a single person working here personally this is an honest assessment from my own experiences. Tvs in the rooms could do with an upgrade but we won’t fall out over that and every day when I get in from work housekeeping have done a top job, always spotless. Anyway I don’t usually review…

title: Off The Beaten Path Gem
review: Dear Tjsg81,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review of the hotel while you have been a long term guest of ours, it is very much appreciated. Well, where do I start with the raving review that you have given our staff here at the hotel. Thank you very kindly, they are a huge accolade to the hotel and make us proud every day which makes reviews like this so important to make us all aware that guests appreciate the service afforded to them by the team. I am so delighted that everyone you have met has gone out of their way, it really is our mission to our guests. I will take your feedback regarding the televisions and report so thank you. We look forward to a continued relationship and looking after you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Lovely stay
review: Wonderful, cozy hotel.  Spent 2 nights here.  Clean, neat, and surprisingly quiet.  Large rooms.  The pub and restaurant were fun and the food great.    We met many locals in the pub, and enjoyed their company.   The staff was outstanding and most helpful.  Only one elevator slowed things somewhat, and the parking, like much of Ireland, was tight.  But these did not diminish the experience too much.

title: Pretty good
review: Dear Jim B,  Many thanks for taking the time to post a review of the hotel after your recent visit. It is so great to hear that you had a wonderful time and felt so at home and comfortable here. All comment on our spacious rooms, they are a huge advantage. I see you spent some time with our lovely locals who entertained you!! Delighted to hear that the team here at the hotel were so accommodating and welcoming, they are certainly a team to be very proud of and we look forward to seeing you again soon.   Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Good spot
review: Room nice and comfy. Lots of space. Great choice of breakfast. Entertainment most nights in bar. 101 bus or trains to Dublin are nearby. 101 bus is on route to Dublin airport. Staff very helpful. Much calmer place to stay than central Dublin.

title: Nice stay
review: Stayed here 2 nights in May 2018.  Comfortable stay, room was nice and clean, staff were friendly. Breakfast was good. Short walk to the “beach”. Would stay here again definitely if in the area. Traffic can be bad back into Dublin so plan accordingly. Not a lot of tourist stuff around it.

title: DIRTY HOTEL
review: Dear Adam G,  Many thanks for taking the time to post a review of the hotel after your stay with us.It is great to hear that you enjoyed your stay over the two nights and happy that you would definitely stay again, this is exactly how we like our customers to feel when leaving the property. Apologies re the traffic but sometimes the motorway gets backed up, not too often, thanks god! We look forward to your next visit.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: brilliant
review: Never been to an hotel where they put mattress protectors onto dirty stained mattresses,these mattresses were so badly stained along with the carpet in room 204. We informed the receptionist who said she would pass our remarks onto the management. Breakfast the cups were so badly stained where they had not been washed up properly. All I can say to people is don't go there.

title: Lovely clean hotel
review: Dear alanandcarolweller,  Many thanks for your recent review of the hotel, all feedback is greatly received and indeed appreciated. However, I was so disappointed to hear that your experience was not an enjoyable one, this is very regrettable. I would love the opportunity to discuss this with you directly and in more detail. Would you be so kind and email me directly: georgina@brackencourt,ie.  I look forward to hearing from you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Great hotel
review: stayed with family for two nights,every thing was excellent rooms were spotless,the staff were brilliant and the food was excellent will stay again when the time arises.highly recommend.also just right distance outside the hustle and bustle of Dublin.

title: Average hotel stay
review: My wife and stayed for a couple of nights. Decent hotel well located. Staff were all very helpful even on sat night when the music from the disco was vibrating us off our bed they quickly moved us to a quieter room. Bar music and food is good. Breakfast not so great all precooked buffet but you could tell it was all sitting there for a while.

title: Average to Good
review: Dear Mick L,  Thank you so much for your review of the hotel after your recent stay with us, it is well received and appreciated. I am happy to see that the staff looked after you so well during your stay, they do have quite the reputation at this stage for their customer service!! I am so sorry that you were disturbed by one of our functions, we are quite busy on weekends with events etc. Thank you for your feedback on the food in general, which will be discussed with the chef. I do hope that you visit us gain soon.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Exceptional customer service in a wonderful hotel 40 minutes from Dublin
review: Just back after an Easter break. Paid £126 for 2 nights B&B plus 2 course evening meal. Also had to pay a 50 euro weekend supplement. We varied the dinner and had steak which for the two of us was an additional 10 euro. So the break turned out to cost roughly £180, which wasn't the bargain we thought. However we went into this eyes wide open so not the Hotels fault. We stayed in room 304, which was nice enough, the bed is at the end of its days however with noticeable indents where you sleep, but still comfortable enough. The room was noisy at night with the music from the bar booming up through the fabric of the building, not sure there is ever going to be anything you could do about that and we normally would have been in the bar anyway it just so happens we went to bed early…

title: St Patrick's Day
review: Dear Trevor M,  Many thanks for your recent review of the hotel after your stay with us, it is very much appreciated. Your review is very detailed which is a great help to us that you have given an overall view of the hotel and the facilities. I will speak with maintenance regarding the bed and also chef with your suggestions and feedback. I am however delighted to hear that you would not hesitate to stay again, this is great news and we look forward to welcoming you once more, I will let the breakfast chef know, he will be delighted!!  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Good value stopover
review: This was our second visit and once again the hotel was exceptional.  We visited last year for my dads 80th and enjoyed it so much we went back this year on our own.  From arrival to departure the hotel is wonderful.  From our room choice being granted to the outstanding customer service from every member of staff with a very special mention to cathy who was amazing!  We stayed 3 nights and dined in the restaurant twice and bar the other night, on all occasions the food was perfect and it was great being able to watch the very talented chefs at work as you can actually see them making the food. Hotel is only 40 minutes by Dart into Dublin and the station is just around the corner from the hotel. If you are looking for shopping closer by I would definitely give Swords shopping…

title: Birthday Getaway
review: Me & my Partner went here for are joint birthday. We got a deal via groupon. This was are first time in Balbriggin, and it will not be are last. The hotel was great, the staff were so welcoming & friendly. Big shout out to Ben. Excellent customer service. The food in the resturant is stunning! I got pate for starter it was the best I have ever had. The main course was unreal. Free car parking at the hotel. We had a late checkout till 1pm which is always great after a nights drinking. O'shea's bar just a short few minutes walk from the hotel was great craic the locals really made are night as we did some karaoke "rude not to" lol.. Me & my partner are not the greatest when it comes to directions when we asked the staff member at reception for directions she actually walked with…

title: Early Mother's Day
review: Dear Dee D,  Thank you so very much for your glowing account of your stay here in the hotel and our town! You certainly do seem to have had quite the weekend away, exploring all avenues, delighted you had such a great weekend and more so that you will be returning. The chef and his team will certainly appreciate the feedback on their food, I will ensure that they receive it and as for our staff here at the hotel, yes they are amazing, our biggest accolade, in fact!! we do look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel very soon.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Great stay
review: My Daughter brought me to this hotel for an early Mother's Day afternoon tea and how lovely it was. I am a vegetarian and they made yummy sandwiches to suit me. If your looking for afternoon tea in nice surroundings with help and friendly staff please give here a try 😊

title: Short Break To ireland
review: Dear MaryL,  Many thanks for your recent post after your Mothers Day treat, it is very much appreciated. I am so delighted to hear how much you enjoyed our afternoon tea, it really is becoming extremely popular. Thank you for your recommendation and I will pass on your kind comments to all the staff. We hope to see you again very soon.  Kind Regards,  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Very nice
review: Got a fab Groupon deal for this hotel and thought it was close enough to Dublin for a nice city break. Arrived at the front desk quite early and we were able to check in to our room at 11am which was a great start. We dropped off our bags and headed straight to the train station, which was a 5 minute walk, and in to Dublin city centre. Was about 25 minutes and cost 10euro each return - so handy! The room itself was spacious and the bed was really comfy. Bathroom was huge with a separate shower and bath (although the hot water went from hot/cold with a mind of its own but that's just being picky!). Had dinner in the hotel restaurant on one evening and it was beautiful. We stayed in the bar afterwards for drinks and had a bucket of beer which was a great deal.

title: Fantastic staff
review: Stayed for one night and absolutely loved it, staff were absolutely fantastic, went above and beyond what we could have asked for to ensure we enjoyed our stay. We had a three course meal as part of our stay and the food was lovely, highly recommend the bannoffi pie! Only reason i gave it 4/5 was at about 3:30am a group of drunk teenagers were shouting on the street outside, just the positioning of the hotel meant it was very loud.  Overall I would highly recommend staying here to anyone

title: 1star
review: Dear Domkeel,  Thank you so much for your review of the hotel after your recent stay with us, it is very much appreciated. I am so delighted that the team here really seem to have made your stay so enjoyable and this makes us so proud as we are known amongst all our regulars for our customer service. I will pass on your kind comments to all the team and to chef of course for his lovely food. Thank you for your recommendation and I do hope we will be seeing you here again soon. We look forward to welcoming you.  Kind Regards,  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: short break
review: This hotel clearly suffers from lack of basic investment in quality staff. The issues are numerous but start with the car park. The lack of security for the vehicle with barriers not working was poor. The reception was average but not a welcome that would hearten a weary traveller. The main door in was awkward when carrying bags lack of an electronic or rotating door was indicative of what was to come. The lift was grubby and needed cleaned, the Trouser press and Iron unit did not work and the shower head and the shower tray needed a deep clean. The cracks in the tiled floor were repaired but not by a tradesman of any calibre. The room was spacious and quiet but the TV channels were not tuned which is the simplest thing in the world to do. In summary this hotel needs management…

title: Overnight stay
review: Dear James D,  Many thanks for taking the time to post a review of the after your recent stay with us. All feedback is so important as it is only through these channels that we can constantly monitor and indeed alter any standards and procedures throughout the hotel.  I was however so surprised and saddened to hear that your experience was so disappointing and especially in the area of customer care as we pride ourselves on a solid reputation in this area in particular, as you will see form previous reviews. Hence I really would like the opportunity to discuss this and your other issues in more detail. Please do contact me directly at georgina@brackencourt.ie. I look forward to hearing form you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Very Good Value
review: stayed recently in disabled room and had a really great stay. hotel is in centre of town but rooms at back really quiet. the staff are really lovely and very helpful. enjoyed the bar food and restaurant over the two nights. the menu is limited but beautiful food. very good value for money. lots of locals in bar gave it a friendly atmosphere. the only problem i found was the pillows were really firm wish there was a choice like most hotels but staff did try to get me something softer which was a little better. i wish there was hot chocolate sachets in the rooms as i prefer that at night to tea or coffee. it is an older hotel but well maintained and decorated for all of that. i look forward to returning to this hotel sometime soon as is handy enough to dublin whilst still being a…

title: Brilliant Stay
review: Myself and all my friends from St Andrews Church Choir had our party night here on the 9th December and what a brilliant night we had - the Food was Fabulous, the entertainment was terrific and the staff especially Georgina and Conor were wonderful.  Most of us stayed for the night in excellently appointed rooms with a 5* Breakfast next morning served by the Scottish Chef who is so cheerful and cooks amazingly great poached eggs - Thank You for that. In fact the hotel staff are top quality and made us feel very welcome - Thomas in the bar was excellent Keep up the good work and we’ll see you again soon.

title: Too far from the airport to be on the list of airport hotels!
review: Dear JeanDublin M,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review of the hotel after your stay with us for your annual Christmas Party, you are always very welcome. Once again, I am delighted that you have enjoyed the night and we love to ensure that we all look after you well, we do value our loyal customers. I will pass on all your wonderful feedback to all the team and we look forward to seeing you again really soon. Happy New Year to you all.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Exceptional customer service
review: I was booked into this hotel prior to an early flight. Unfortunately it is almost 21 km from Dublin Airport, and at the time I needed, there would not be a frequent bus service. My rating relates to location, as I cancelled my reservation and stayed elsewhere.

title: Great night out
review: Dear Cathy C,  Thank you for your review of the hotel, although you did not unfortunately use any of our facilities, thank you for your valued opinion of our location. Some of our guests find it very convenient as we do not have the same busy levels and rushed feeling of an airport hotel and we do have an airport service which starts from 5.20am. We also have free car parking which appeals to guests. However I am sorry that you felt we were too far away. We feel that a 15 minute drive is quite acceptable.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Dependable, Welcoming and Professional - A Good All-Rounder
review: I was searching for a place to have a small family gathering after a funeral. I wanted somewhere cosy, inviting and friendly. Georgie (the manager) sat with us to learn about our needs and what our mum would have liked. She did an incredible job of pulling together everything on our wishlist in such a short space of time. The team could not have been more attentive on the day. We had lots of additional requests, there was no problem fullfilling each abd every one.  Thank you Georgie and team. If I could give you 6 stars I would.

title: Good location good food pity about the little things not mended in rooms
review: Very good location  in town near beach.  Can get to airport easily. Has own carpark though you have to walk out through front of carpark to go into hotel. Also rooms a bit jaded as things do not get mended or checked. Shower door did not close properly and water slow to go away in shower so standing in pool. Some Lights did go on. Good that there was separate shower and good size room and clean. Just a pity feels like no one cares about upkeep

title: Fantastic room, food, pub, location
review: Dear Mary M,  Thank you so very much for taking the time to post a review of the hotel after your recent visit. I was delighted to see that you liked our location and our lovely local attractions. We are also very convenient to the airport so it is great to see that this was an advantage throughout your stay. I am however very sorry to ear about the lack of upkeep in your room and I will have all the issues attended to as a matter of urgency. Thank you gain for bringing these issues to our attention and I do hope that you will visit again soon.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: July Wedding in The Bracken Court Hotel
review: The minute we walked in, we were impressed with the updated decor, the friendliness yet business-like greeting of the desk clerks, and the facilities available.  When we got to the room, we were even more impressed with the two-bedroom, 2 bath (one with a shower & jetted tub), kitchen and sitting room.  There is a great restaurant where you can either order a meal from a menu or be served from a cafeteria-like line.  The pub had authentic Irish entertainment as well as a karaoke night.  Great service, drinks, food and atmosphere.  The location is close the the train so you can go just about anywhere from there.  It is walking distance to beaches, a park as well as in a great location in town.  A fantastic place to stay.

title: Surprisingly good venue.
review: Dear treble3,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review of the hotel after your recent visit, it is very much appreciated and only through these channels can we constantly monitor our standards and services. It certainly does look like you had a fantastic stay with us and must have been upgraded to our apartment!! I am delighted to see that you took advantage of all our "in house" services which include dining and entertainment and more importantly, enjoyed all of it. In this case, I do hop that we will be welcoming you back again very soon.  Kind Regards  Georgina konings  Operations Manager

title: Affordable family October break
review: After visiting so many hotels in Dublin for our July wedding our minds were made up as soon as we set foot in The Bracken Court Hotel. The hotel manager/wedding coordinator Conor showed us around the venue. We were having our ceremony as well as our afters in the hotel so the size of the ceremony room was quite important to us. The ceremony room was huge and comfortably sat 150 guests. The reception room is absolutely stunning with it decorated immaculately and exactly to our taste (organised by staff at hotel) there is a large dance floor, bar and stunning lighting throughout. The bride and grooms suite is just stunning and the beds are very cosy!   The staff are one of the friendliest that we have ever come across in any hotel and no request was too large for them, especially…

title: Lovely venue for a wedding...or short break
review: We enjoyed a two day stay at The Bracken Court Hotel for a family wedding, it is a little way out of Dublin but well worth the journey...all staff at the hotel are most welcoming and can't do enough to make your stay enjoyable. The food was exceptional and the service excellent it is in my opinion a first class location for a wedding or a short visit. There is a small beach close by in summer no doubt very nice but in October a little bracing. They have an excellent stocked bar which is open till late should you require further beverages

title: For the price, it's perfect for a layover.
review: Dear Keiths016,  Thank you so much for your review of the hotel after spending some time here for the very happy occasion of a family wedding. The Bracken Court do pride themselves on being an excellent wedding venue, we like to think we are a hidden gem, " a little way out of Dublin, but worth it", thank you. Our team here at the hotel are certainly a huge accolade to the hotel and they make the experience better with their excellent customer care, we are very proud of them. I do hope that if you are visiting this way again that you will come and stay and we look forward to welcoming you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Super Hotel
review: I know this hotel is far from Dublin Airport, all you got to do is travel to this hotel betwen 5hrsAM to 23hrs20PM on Bus 101 to ballbriggan and drop out at community center. If you need assistance and still not sure, do the same as me, give them a call. It cost me 11.75 euros by bus. If you add this on top of the hotel price, it was much cheaper than 240-300USD a night to the closer hotels from airport.  The room is getting a little bit old but still very spacious. For one night , it is not bad at all especially with the bar nearby with a real live singer.  I think that for the price, it's one of the best bet.  It took about 30 mins by bus. Cheers

title: Best Barman and Dining!  Room is palatial!
review: Dear GylbertFD,  Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of the hotel as it is only through these channels that we can properly monitor feedback. You have certainly pointed out many of our advantages as a hotel and our very reasonable rates yet only a short journey form Dublin which is very easily accessible by both rail and bus. I am delighted that you enjoyed the room and of course our lively music in our residents bar so I do hope that you will come back to us so we can welcome you once more.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings   Operations Manager

title: great hotel in the middle of the town, close to the motorcycle races
review: Second visit to this property this time using it to break up a journey from Belfast to Dublin Airport. Pleasant staff throughout the hotel and we were given a good sized room. Great bar too in the hotel serving excellent food. Breakfast was excellent too. Recommend to all.

title: Friendly Staff especially Derek
review: We had two nights here and found it very comfortable and convenient for Dublin. Train station just a few minutes walk away. Breakfast was very goo and the chef Derek is so positive in his attitude. Great value. Free underground parking

title: Very comfortable Hotel.
review: Dear Maxinpompey,  Many thanks for taking the time to post a review of the hotel, it is only through these channels that we can constantly monitor and if necessary implement any changes. It certainly seems that you enjoyed your stay and all was to your satisfaction. Derek certainly has a personality and he will be delighted with your kind words, I will ensure that they are passed on. Please do come and visit again and we look forward to seeing you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Very poor hygiene standards.
review: Only spent one night here whilst attending a wedding in Skerries nearby. I would describe it as a typical medium sized country town hotel which is just what we wanted and great value. Staff were excellent and premises were clean and tidy. We had the carvery lunch and cooked breakfast which were both very good.

title: Comfortable stay
review: Dear John L,  Many thanks for your recent review of the hotel after your short stay with us while attending a wedding elsewhere, it is very much appreciated. I am delighted to hear that we provided just everything that you required and that you enjoyed your stay. Maybe you will visit us again for a longer time, we look forward to welcoming you.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Lovely comfortable Hotel!
review: Spent two nights in this hotel recently. As previous reviewers mentioned the rooms are very dated and tired. This fact alone would not be a major issue but my main cause for concern was the standard of cleanliness overall.  The outside of the main entrance looked as if it had not been cleaned in some time and what looked like vomitus was dried in the corner of the door .  Windows  at the front of the hotel were also dirty.A guest who had cut his leg (don't know where this occurred) was being treated in the lobby. The blood from this was not completely cleaned up and evidence of same was still there when we checked out. Our room looked out onto a service yard which was littered with rubbish and had a general air of neglect. Breakfast was adequate but we did not eat there for our…

title: Nice hotel with a great restaurant
review: We stayed here for two nights and had a great meal in the restaurant both nights, we were disappointed in our room as it smelt of smoke, they did offer to move us but we had unpacked and thought the smell would dissipate, it did not and we had to ask them to give us some air freshener to spray regularly, outside our window was an internal roof which had at least 50 cigarette butts on it, this is supposed to be a non smoking hotel. We stayed in room 220

title: excellent hotel with very friendly and helpful staff
review: Dear Pat D,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review of the hotel after your recent stay with us, it is very much appreciated. It is only through these channels that we can truly monitor our standards and study feedback. It is great to hear that you enjoyed the restaurant on both nights and I am so very sorry about the smell in your room. We are a non smoking hotel but unfortunately sometimes people do not adhere to our rules and regulations and this is the result. I really do hope that your good experience will outweigh this and you will visit us again in the near future.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Yes, time for an update for sure...
review: Very good hotel with a good size room and a lovely breakfast. Staff were very friendly and helpful,especially the head bar man Thomas who helped with planning trips and making us feel welcome.  Train station and bus stop very close as is a lovely beach.

title: Overnight stay
review: Dear cor2015,  Many thanks for your recent review of the hotel after your stay with us. I was delighted to hear how much you enjoyed your stay and how helpful the team were with your travel plans. I will pass on your comments to all the team and of course Thomas! The hotel is indeed in a very good location for travelling being so close to rail and bus stations and yes we have our own beautiful coastline to explore so we are really happy that you enjoyed the stay so much and look forward to seeing you again soon.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Refurb required
review: Happened on here as we were late getting reservations before our trip.  Front end staff were very kind and accommodating.    Brewed coffee was dreadful, so order an Americano, it was very good.  The room facing the back of the Hotel could use some help.  They had changed to 'cheap' lighting to save a few Euros, I get that.  But the Bathroom had no ceiling light and the Shower was DARK and if you drop the soap, I hope you're a tiny person to bend over to pick it up, the shower was TINY.  The bed was ok, which was a life saver, as I tossed and turned all night from the Sea Gulls making whatever noise they're known for - it was incessant and didn't end!!!
