The town itself is a narrow town and is always very busy with our population growing constantly but I am sorry that it was not to your liking. Regarding your experience in the bar and restaurant, I will speak with both respective managers and act accordingly, once again I do apologise. As you will have seen from our previous comments and one of the reasons you stayed with us, this is definitely not the norm and I do hope that in some future business or pleasure capacity, you will have a reason to stay with us and I would like the chance to welcome you back to the hotel. There is also a very strong ongoing project for increasing tourism and facilities in Balbriggan so you may see vast improvement in the future. Thank you once again for your feedback.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: FOOD & SERVICE
review: We were guests at a wedding being held in the Bracken Court Hotel, and staying in the hotel made perfect sense, so we booked two rooms: one for my wife and I, the other for our daughter.  Check in time is normally 3pm, but as the wedding was scheduled for 3.30pm, I had requested that one of the rooms be available a little earlier, to allow the ladies to get ready. Arissa very helpfully arranged this, and was equally helpful when I later collected the keys for the second room.   The room keys are electronic, and need only to be touched against a panel on the door: very convenient when carrying baggage.  The rooms are nicely decorated in beige, light brown, with one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in for some time. The sole gripe is that there is no air conditioning in…

title: Family wedding
review: Beautiful hotel. A bit disappointed some got bigger rooms when we booked for 2 adults and 2 kids and I'm a sister family of the bridal couple. Anyway no harm.  Unfortunately shower was stone cold.  Not even warm. It was fine the day if arrival but not the following. Used my mams and hers was fine?  Staff very nice. Polite and helpful.  Food at wedding was amazing. Nicest I've had in a while. Ps loved the soup rolls.  Would def consider another family trip to visit the zoo etc.

title: Wow
review: Dear Gigi5801,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review for the hotel regarding our facilities and your family wedding. I am so happy that you found the staff so polite and friendly, as you will see from previous posts, they are most definitely our biggest asset here at the hotel. I will also pass on your comments to the Chef regarding the food and especially our signature bread bowls!! Regarding your room size, I am sorry that your room was not as big as others, our hotel has a wide variety of rooms and our allocations are done prior to arrivals, maybe next time you stay with us, you can let us know and we will endeavor to accommodate you in one of our bigger family rooms. I will also investigate the shower in that particular room, apologies.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: Good deal
review: Wow Were do I start  Food fab  Staff even better and great value for money  One off the best family rooms ever  A lot off hotels could learn from here guys  From the moment we arrived we fealt at home  Bar menu could properly have a bit more and the breakfast could also be a bit better put apart from That the rooms and staff are great and great value for money  Would I stay again  Huge YES

title: Lovely Easter Weekend
review: Dear James K,  Thank you so much for your fantastic comments and ratings for our hotel. This is exactly what we strive for here at the hotel and I am delighted that your experience was so positive and that the staff made you feel so at home. Our rooms are very diverse so they can cater for most needs so it is great that you enjoyed the comfort. I shall pass on your comments to the Chef here regarding the bar menu and breakfast, again, we welcome all feedback. As you have said that you would most definitely return, we look forward to seeing you again for another very enjoyable stay.  Kind Regards  Georgina Konings  Operations Manager

title: New venture
review: Went here with grand children for easter, got a good deal, 1 night bed and breakfast(full irish), and i could see other assorted food,got free tickets to dublin zoo also in deal(20 minutes away),all for £98,hotel is very well run with excellent staff, there is a small beach and harbour around back 5 minutes walk,maybe stay longer next time:-)😃

title: First class
review: Beautiful hotel, beautiful staff, we all had a ball..... Would definitely recommend beach just round the corner... Breakfast was first class probably the best... Rooms were cosey and staff made us feel very welcome x

title: Not comfortable at all
review: Dear Michelle965,  Thank you very much for taking the time to post a review of our hotel and your "first class" rating is much appreciated and exactly what we strive for here at the hotel. I am glad to hear that all our staff made you feel very welcome and that our breakfast was greatly received, thank you. Our rooms have been decorated to enhance that "cosy" feeling you have mentioned and we very much look forward to seeing you and your party back at the hotel in the very near future.  Kind Regards Georgina Konings Operations Manager

title: Lovely hotel
review: Stayed here last night.Room was cold..bathroom dirty..bedlinen smelled of cigarette smoke.bed very very uncomfortable.Cost 69 euro for the room.Honestly.I have to say that it was on par with Ronnies bnb in Skerries.Very very poor.Checked out early just so I could go home to sleep.!

title: Exceptional
review: Dear Joe M,  Thank you for posting a review for the hotel. I am so sorry that your experience was so poor and for all the issues that you encountered during your stay. I believe that you may be in touch with one of my colleagues but if you would like to discuss any of these matters directly with myself, please do contact me at georgina@brackencourt.ie  Kind Regards Georgina Konings Operations Manager

title: Loved it
review: Stayed here for one night on a heatons hotel breaks deal including b+b and dinner..was really pleasantly surprised by the hotel.decor is nice and room was spotlessly clean and comfortable.what really makes this hotel excellent is the fabulous staff.they are all so friendly from the bar staff ..waiters and receptionists even to the cleaning staff..really excellent..had dinner in the bracken grill and it was very good..great spicy wings and perfectly cooked steak..waitress was lovely(timi)also had a cheesecake and brownies for dessert which were delicious but unfortunately we were too full to eat them!i have to say that as I work in the same industry I can be difficult to please but this place really is great and will definitely return.

title: Fabulous
review: We were at the Bracken Court Hotel once before and again the weekend past and I can sincerely say this is the best hotel we have visited in a long time and we have been round a lot the food is second to none the staff are brilliant, helpful, friendly and nothing a bother.  The rooms are lovely, beds are comfortable and warm.  Highly recommend and we will be back again

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Recently had an over night stay at this hotel. It was really lovely. From our arrival to check out staff were really friendly and helpful. Will definitely return and would have no hesitation in recommending it.

title: Excellent venue for party
review: Recently held my daughters 21st Birthday party in the Ardgillian Suite, Bracken Court Hotel.  The management, front of house, catering and bar staff at the hotel provided an excellent level of service and went out of their way to ensure that the the night went well.  The food was really lovely, served hot and very well presented. The bedrooms were really comfortable and the bed particularly comfy. Breakfast was self service buffet with the choice of hot and cold options usually on offer. A fab night was enjoyed by all. I would be more than happy to recommend the hotel as an event venue or for night stay. Thanks again to all the staff.

title: Third visit!
review: Stayed here at the end of February on a Treat Ticket deal - 2 nights bed & breakfast, two course meal on one of the nights and a welcome drink!  We have stayed here twice before and each time we have had beautiful food, lovely big room and friendly staff. This time was no different! As the weather was bad, we ate in the hotel both nights - the second night, food was served in the bar as the restaurant is only open at the weekend. Again there was a decent menu to choose from and the food was as good as before (although the mushy peas could be a bit warmer!). Our room was on the third floor and was a great size with a fridge, TV, small table with chairs and a bathroom with both a bath and separate shower. We asked for a quiet room and this is what we got - didn't hear any noise…

title: Ruined week-end
review: I booked this hotel via a Groupon voucher.  When I booked I wanted a double room for Friday and Saturday as it was my husband's birthday.  I was told there was no double room available on Saturday, that the hotel was fully booked but that I could upgrade to a luxury suite for both nights for an extra €100 in total.  As it was a birthday treat I agreed to upgrade. We arrived at the hotel around 7pm, booked in and paid €100 in cash.  We went to the suite and it was freezing (this was February).  We told reception and were told that the radiators were probably turned off, so we turned them all.  The bathroom one was already on and only warm about two inches up the radiator.  We changed and went to the bar to eat and listen to the music and warm up. When we returned at 12.20 am the…

title: Family Celebration
review: Stayed here for 4 nights from 20th Feb 2015.  All staff were very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was of a good standard although I did feel that perhaps one or two of the items could have been from the night before....fresh cream cakes for breakfast one morning!!  The chef was very friendly and happy to cook anything for you.  Bedroom was a good size.  TV could do with more channels and remote was held together with tape.  Housekeeping could do with stepping up a gear as this is supposed to be a 4 star hotel. Sometime teabags were left other times not the same with biscuits.  Cups appear to have been washed in the room as they were always the same two cups slightly different in colour.  They were not properly washed one day but put back on the tray as been cleaned. Came back…

title: Groupon
review: We had a Groupon offer for bed breakfast and dinner. It was a very good deal. The hotel was very nice. The car park was below the hotel and free!!. The rooms were large and the bathrooms were a great size to. Food was lovely! Breakfast was was really nice and plenty of choice. The bar was nice to sit and relax in and all the staff were lovely and helpful.A few minutes walk up the road takes you to the dart and into Dublin. If I want to be picky we had no remote for the TV .Lets face it though it isn't that big a deal to get up and switch the channel over using the button in the TV ;)

title: Nice break
review: We booked Bracken Court as we were going to Ikea, but it was also out anniversary. When we arrived the car park was in a perfect Location(Right under the Hotel). They upgraded us and left a note saying congratulations on our anniversary. The food was fantastic, the service was brilliant, the breakfast was top notch. Only downfall was a constant noise in out room. It seemed like a lift but it was too far away. it must of being the air con. Also the Iron in the room was destroyed(I had to ring room service to get another), the couch was old but all round a very nice stay.

title: Large room and comfy bed
review: We booked a double room which was a lovely with a lobby, large bathroom and queen size comfy bed.  There was plenty of storage in the room and was warm.  We eat in the bar in the evening as we were told that we would have to order a la carte in the restaurant as we had not booked the dinner package. Breakfast was plentiful - self service but with a chef on hand - they even had cream cakes which I have never seen at breakfast before but I managed to resist.  Balgriggan itself did look like it had seen better days but it has a cinema and a really lovely beach and probably looks very different in the summer on a sunny day.  The hotel is about 5-10mins from the M1 motorway and Dublin can be reached by train

title: Lovely place
review: Lovely clean hotel with excellent spacious family room. Great value. Breakfast was fantastic ! Lovely friendly attentive staff. Bed was comfy and was great to have a fridge in the room. We liked balbriggan as a location. Would definitely return

title: Brilliant yet again !
review: My friend and I are just back from a great weekend, the staff are friendly and welcoming and at the same time efficient. Rooms spotless and Breakfasts Perfect !!! sets you up for the day ! we also had a meal in the restaurant on the saturday night, it would be hard to get better service or food anywhere else. located 5 mins walk from the dart you can nip in and out of Dublin with ease and retreat back to the hotel there was live music in the bar on both nights we were there and a good time had by all . located near the beach handy if you need the cobwebs cleared the next day Ideal for couples, families friends on a break covers all categories. will hopefully stay again September. Book and enjoy you will not be dissapointed

title: Can't wait  to go back!!
review: A slightly late christmas night out with friends found us booked into The Bracken Court Hotel for food, drinks and entertainment with The Medium Bernie Stokes. This hotel is very well located right in the center of Balbriggan with its own car park. The staff are super friendly without being intrusive, I left a box behind me in the bar, which the staff  then left at reception for me, this was shortly after I arrived, so can genuinely say we were looked after from the very start. The rooms were lovely, plenty of room and decent sized bathroom. After Bernie's show we headed to the bar as there was music. A great age range in the bar, great craic and the two lads in the band put on a great show (sorry didn't get the bands name) Thomas and Georgina were kept busy behind the bar …

title: Our wedding day with the hotel
review: Where to start at the beginning we just had our wedding just on Saturday the  31st of January 2015 what a brilliant day we have to say from the moment we had contact with Jean the wedding coordinator she has been so helpful making sure everything went smoothly value for money worth every cent spent on the all wrapped up package worth € 5,500 we had been looking around at other hotels in the Dublin area and we were even considering going down the country when I remembered seeing this hotel at the wedding expo in the royal Dublin society in ballsbridge some years ago so decided to Google search the hotel making contact with the hotel and Jean from the first meeting until the wedding day the staff have been so friendly and pleasant from start to finish as well as taking care of the…

title: Excellent service from friendly staff
review: Spent 4 nights there recently.  The staff are polite and friendly and went out of their way to make my stay comfortable.  There is a lovely resturante and a friendly bar that serves food too.  I have special dietry requirements (lactose and gluten free etc) and every night the chief cooked a meal especially for me from items not on the menu.  Prior to booking I had phoned to discuss my requirements and was asked to email a list of food I could eat to the hotel. The chef even steamed my vegetables in bottled mineral water.  I was at a family party and the family menbers who stayed overnight at the hotel were served very generous breakfasts.  They are served up to 11:00am.    I stayed in a room on the 4th floor (411) at the front corner of the building.  It was during the stormy…

title: Fairly good
review: This hotel is centrally located in Balbriggan, the food is excellent, perfectly presented and delicious. The staff are extremely efficient and friendly. The room furnishings were a little tired looking and in need of refurbishment, the room was a good size though. Television had little choice of channel selection, on the other hand the wifi was very good. Price was reasonable.

title: Great food and excellent service
review: I was initially somewhat underwhelmed because the lobby and bedroom were very ordinary for a 4 star hotel. However, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff and the standard of the food more than compensated for this. The breakfast buffet not only had the usually selection of juices and cereals but also homemade smoothies (delicious and very satisfying!!) and a selection of cookies so it catered for all tastes. Dinner was absolutely delicious with good portion sizes. What the restaurant slightly lacked in atmosphere, was more than compensated for by the quality of the food and the friendly, attentive staff. The attitude of the staff was consistently positive from reception to the restaurant to the bar. We had a lovely stay.

title: Great for a quick overnight
review: Stayed there one night before we got into our apt in Balbriggan. Everything was nice. Room was clean and even got some room service which was prompt and tasty. Only bad was the bed was a bit hard for my liking so had bad night sleep. I would stay again if it came up though

title: Hidden Gem
review: Stayed for two nights with two grown-up daughters between Christmas and New Year. A very relaxing stay.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Menu for dinner was not very exciting but the food we got was well presented, nicely cooked and tasty.  A nice hotel for exploring North Co. Dublin and Co. Meath.  It is ideally situated with good bus and rail services for people wishing to visit Dublin for either shopping or attending shows etc.

title: New year's eve
review: Third time here, fantastic night at NYE gala. Food fantastic and plentiful. Casino theme was very enjoyable. Entertainment to bring in new years was also very goo.Love this place and will be back again.

title: gree it exceeded our expectations ,  the staff were so helpful and friendly and made us feel so welcoat staff
review: we stayed here for 3 nights over christmas. it was our second visit to this hotel and i must say this timme.  like our previous stay the room the food  and the staff were all great. the food this time was even better especially the festive menu,  the staff worked so had over the festive period and always had a smile for us. i would definitely stay in this hotel again as they made our christmas very special thanks to you all

title: Very nice stay
review: Stayed for one night as we had a party to go too, the staff were very friendly in all departments. The food in the bar was lovely. We have stayed before and had a bigger room than what we got this time but its was ok. I would stay here again and i would recommend anyone to stay here.

title: Very welcoming stay
review: We mentioned at the time of booking that we would be celebrating a birthday during our stay.  when we arrived to our room there was a bouquet of balloons and a happy birthday sign waiting for us.  The staff both on reception and in the bar were very friendly and helpful.  Our room was very spacious and was spotless.  We would definitely recommend others to stay here.

title: Excellent food!
review: Stayed here as part of a Groupon deal which included a bottle of wine and 2 course meal. Food was delicious and portions very generous. Room was big and bed comfortable. Only downside is that the Wifi was unavailable all weekend.

title: Another excellent stay
review: This is our second time to stay in this Hotel.  It was excellent.  Staff very friendly.  Hotel including bedrooms very clean and comfortable.  Food excellent.  Handy carparking.  I would recommend it for a short break.

title: nice hotel but ....
review: this is a nice hotel. spacious room including a large bathroom. I wonder why the shower is narrow. you can hardly warm up the shower without spilling a lot of water on the floor of the bathroom. breakfast is good. sufficient choice. it is a pitty that the waitress was a little grumpy. all in all good value for money. But,  during my two night stay there was a wedding on both evenings. as a result I could not easy catch my sleep due to loud music. After being asleep I woke up a few hours later as guests of the wedding got to there rooms. this should be managed better by the hotel management. when checking out the receptionist was not able to add te company name on the invoice (this the first time I have experienced this). As a result the hotel expenses are now not tax deductible.…

title: Excellent evening food
review: Stayed for three nights recently. Two nights were on a groupon voucher Voucher included room upgrade and one evening meal. Positive points: Effortless check-in and check out Large, bright room Bathroom and Bedroom very clean Comfortable bed and bedding Friendly, efficient staff -  Neil in restaurant - nothing too much trouble Evening restaurant food very good - we ate in restaurant three nights out of three!  Downside Reception staff not following through when told on 1st night of strange vibrating noise in bedroom, also couldn't get iron to work.  No come back from reception - in fact staff member avoided us and slipped into back office! - (noise continued for the three night stay) Unfortunately breakfast was not of the same high quality of evening food - also chefs on hot pass…

title: Good wedding venue
review: Attended a wedding here at the weekend and stayed overnight.Check in was fast and courteous and the room was of a good size.We were on the 3rd floor so away from any noise.We came down to the bar which was very cold to be told they had no draught beer at all apart from Budweiser which I wouldn't drink if it was free.There was a problem with the system but nobody had a clue when or how it was going to be fixed.Anyway large bottles aren't that bad so we soldiered on.The ceremony was held in a nice room upstairs and the reception room was very nicely decorated and they had draught at this bar.The food was excellent and plenty of it so nobody left hungry.Staff were great very friendly and helpful.So over all a good day was had by all and the bar was fixed by the time we down to the…

title: Date night
review: Myself and my fiance stayed here for our anniversary and were quite happy room was average and could do with some doing up but for the price u cudn complain. Tv was not working but a quick call to reception and it was changed for a new one. We also hate in the bar food was lovely.

title: Fabulous place
review: Only stayed 2 nights but very impressed.  Accommodation - superb.  Staff very helpful and friendly, food excellent.  Had mentioned it was our anniversary and was greeted with a congratulations note, balloons and a glass of bubbly after fantastic meal. Arrived very early from airport - 6 hours before check in - but they prepared the room, gave us free tea and coffee while we waited and checked us in within half an hour.  Can't speak highly enough of the experience.

title: Wedding weekend
review: stayed here with my partner for a friends wedding that was in the hotel for the whole weekend the staff were very friendly rooms were lovely and clean and the food was massive! Would recommend this hotel to anyone an would definitely stay again!

title: Wedding in Bracken Court
review: I would like to say how enjoyable a stay my partner and I had at the Bracken Court. We were part of the wedding party and I could not fault anything....The one thing I would like to comment on is the staff....They are extremely courteous, kind and go out of their way for you...to the extent when wedding meal was happening a particular staff member Arissa made sure the young kids clothes were covered...its touches like this that make you realise how much the staff love their work...We will definitely be returning.

title: Wedding
review: We had our wedding here in August. Would definitely recommend this hotel for your special day. Jean is very helpful in helping u organise everything . Always a phone call away and never makes u feel like your annoying with all your questions. On the day sinead was looking after us and was so helpful and friendly. Even when her shift was finished she came over to tell me and told me who to ask for if any problems should occur after she left. She was a massive help on the day. Guests all complimented the food and the layout of the room . Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the hotel was nearly booked out of the rooms about 3 mths before the wedding. A lot of guests who wanted to stay couldn't and it meant some couldn't come to the wedding because of this. So for anyone…

title: Good Value Hotel
review: My wife & I spent a very enjoyable stay last week. 2 nights B & B with breakfast & 1x 2 course dinner. The hotel is situated about 10 minutes drive from the M1 Belfast to Dublin. It is well appointed and all the staff were very pleasant and helpful. There is free parking in a secure car park  adjoining the hotel. There was a smell of stale smoke in the bedroom when we arrived.When we reported this to reception staff they brought  a dehumidifier and set it up and this seemed to help the situation when it was switched on. We were offered a change of bedroom but did not avail of this offer. The breakfasts were the best we have encountered in a hotel for a long time. There was a very wide choice  and the cooked breakfasts were all hot which is not our usual experience.The chef…

title: Excellent
review: I stayed for one night before travelling into Dublin.  I have special dietry requiremants and was worried about cross contamination.  I emailed ahead and was sent a menu.  The staff were extremely helpful and arranged for food (not on the menu) to be bought in and cooked to my requirements.  The chef even brought it to my table and made sure everything was to my satisfaction.  A mini fridge to be put in my room.    The room was spacious and clean.

title: could be better...............
review: Stayed here on business recently.  First impressions were that it was an upmarket establishment, well appointed and seemingly quite professional staff.  However it soon became apparent that the staff are often unavailable lurking behind the scene laughing and joking when they should be giving service to guests.  The duty Manager had a very unprofessional attitude and joined in the inappropriate frolics with the staff.  Food in the restaurant only mediocre although our waitress from Poland was excellent. Slightly hostile and uncomfortable ambiance in the bar.  My room seemed tired and lack lustre with a fusty mouldy smell emanating from the bathroom.  My cooked breakfast was served cold when notified to the staff it was simply taken away and obviously microwaved hot again. …

title: Great stay
review: I likely would have given 5 stars, but our room smelled of stale smoke.  With that said, room was nicely appointed and the gal at check in was most accommodating.  Had food in the pub ... Was tasty and again, service was good.  Breakfast, which was included in price was also very good.  Consisted of both hot and cold items ... Cereals, fruit, breads, and traditional irish breakfast items in the hot buffet.  The best part as it was 15 minutes from Dublin airport ... Great stopover if you want to be outside but close to Dublin.  Would stay again!

title: Wedding.
review: Enjoying the atmosphere at the Bracken Court Hotel. Our dear friends wedding.  Staff could not be any more professional.  I would like to gave a special thanks to the  Maitre Di Sinead. Who has looked over every aspect of our friends Wedding and had I running like clock work from ceremony to the meal and the afters. My Thanks Eddie Bride.

title: Dave and jessie
review: We had our wedding there on the 27th of September.  I have to say we had a brilliant day. Our family's and all the children had a great time. The staff could not have been more helpful and the day went very well and the food was gorgeous. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short stay or I would recommend having your wedding there.  Dave and jess

title: heavenly hospitality
review: Situated just off the main road, car parking facilities just next to hotel and car park charges paid for by the hotel. On entering the reception desk, we were met by a warm, friendly welcome. Our stay fully explained to us and as we were there on a deal stay we were just looking forward to the break. The hotel oozed a homely, welcoming feel, with such lovely helpful staff. Our room was just lovely, it was cosy, comfortable and spacious for my husband to get around with mobility problems. The lift was just great as we only had a short walk to our room. We went to dine in the restaurant and the atmosphere was just so wonderful as everyone all around seemed to enjoy their meals, of all ages. The table service was just brilliant as we were greeted so warmly and were so very well…

title: Around the corner to the harbour and the beach
review: A nice stay for a conference. Low key, large room for Europe, great bed. Just far enough outside Dublin, short bus from the sirport with train connections (35 min) to Dublin. Reasonable food and bar. Noot classically quaint but enough character to feel like you are living in the village.

title: Balbriggan by the sea
review: Got a great deal here recently..2 nights b&b plus dinner and a welcome drink on arrival. This is a lovely hotel ,perfectly located for our shopping trip to Dublin..Belfast and all surrounding shopping centres like Pavillion Swords and Blanchardstown. Parking was a dream , as they have an on site underground car park AND ITS FREE. Check In was smooth, by a very friendly receptionist,who advised us of mealtimes, parking etc available at hotel . The room was spacious ,beds comfortable  and a spotless bathroom. All the usual things like Television..Iron and Ironing board and tea/coffee making and fridge were provided. Dinner was an excellent 2 courses, with a big emphasis on presentation, and a first for me was the soup was served in a hollowed large bread roll..nice touch. I must…

title: Great Spot!
review: We got a great deal at €139 per couple for 2 night B and B, evening meal, and drink on arrival, at such a low cost you would think it would just be ok! Well it was fantastic, from check in to a lovely room, great food and friendly staff, we could not have asked for more! special mention to Rory for the bottle! Emma on reception, Anna and Ramona in the restaurant at night for fantastic care and attention to all diners! And the lady cooking breakfast! Fantastic staff. Will be recommending and will be returning, thank you for a fantastic weekend.

title: Balbriggan, as a tourist, a place to avoid
review: The pictures of The Bracken Court Hotel give a different impression from reality. As a wedding venue probably OK, as a tourist hotel, best to avoid. Our room was adequate, with a wonderful view of a disused, overgrown Tesco car park. Take note. you are not near the sea and can barely see it. Good parking though right underneath. In my opinion this is a really rough tough place, why I was lured by the picture I do not know. We found a very basic Italian Restaurant a few hundred yards away, but the food was surprisingly good. I am sorry I cannot recommend Balbriggan or the Bracken Court Hotel to anyone.

title: Early check in great service
review: Dear Mick,  I am disappointed to hear that you didn't enjoy your visit to Balbriggan. However I believe if you had explored Balbriggan more, you would have found an array of unique and interesting places and activities.  One of Balbriggan’s most recognisable tourist attractions is our beautiful harbour and lighthouse.   Balbriggan is proud of its coastal heritage and a walk along our shoreline offers, not only enviable coastal beauty, but also a rich maritime history.   Balbriggan still retains an active fishing fleet and our working harbour is a 1 minute short walk from the Hotel.   A visit to the harbour provides many photo opportunities of the lighthouse and the harbour itself. The harbour, built in 1761 is home to numerous fishing vessels. At the end of the harbour is the lighthouse with two commerative plaques in memory of Patrick Hanley who drowned near this spot in 1957 and Baron (George) Hamilton who was the driving force behind the building of the harbour.  The Railway Viaduct and the Lifeboat House are the town’s most famous landmarks.  The Viaduct was completed in 1844 as part of the Dublin to Drogheda line and was officially opened in March the same year. The viaduct is an ideal place for viewing the harbour and on a clear day the Mountains of Mourne are clearly visible.  Situated snugly under an arch of the viaduct, the Lifeboat House had been used to smoke fish before becoming a storehouse for local industry.  Built of rubble stone with dressed limestone surrounds to the openings. It is said that the upper part of the building was intended to provide sleeping quarters for the cox swain who gave up using it because of the noise overhead. It has a fine slate root with a dormer window set into the apex at the front. The original plaques with the date and initials of the station are placed on either side of the main entrance.  The Front Strand is Balbriggan’s main beach. It’s a natural inlet and is ideal for building sand castles, bathing and soaking up the sun. During the summer months a lifeguard is on duty when the appropriate flag is flying. A pleasant walk further up the coast takes you to the Martello tower built in the 1800′s to ward off any invasions by Napoleon. Just below the Martello Tower are the ruins of the Boathouses.  Balbriggan beach is an ideal walking spot.  Rich with history and natural vistas, and with beaches just waiting for sandcastles to be built, there is something here for everyone in the family.  Just outside of town and visible from the coast road is Ardgillan Castle. A lovely location to visit, Ardgillan Castle has miles of park areas, award winning gardens and a charming coffee shop. It also has a play park for the kids and a Holistic Center. Ardgillan is a truly beautiful spot with incredible views of the ocean and is not to be missed!  Ardgillan Castle and Demesne is situated on an elevated coastline between Balbriggan and Skerries. The park consists of 194 acres of rolling open grassland, mixed woodland and gardens, overlooking the Irish Sea with views of Mourne Mountains to the north and Lambay to the south-east. Ardgillan is a sanctuary for many species of animals, mammals and birds for which the wooded areas provide a safe retreat from surrounding agricultural land.  The gardens are in three main parts, the formal Rose Garden, which gives a lovely display during the summer, the Potentilla collection to the West of the castle, and the walled garden to the North West which contains herb, vegetable, fruit, and ornamental sections.  The Victorian Conservatory was originally built in 1880 at Seamount, Malahide, and the home of the Jameson family, who became famous for their whiskey all over the world. It was built by a Scottish glasshouse builder McKenzie & Moncur Engineering, and is reputed to be a replica of a glasshouse built at Balmoral in Scotland, the Scottish home of the British Royal Family. The conservatory was donated to Fingal County Council by the present owner of Seamount, the Treacy family and was re-located to the Ardgillan Rose Garden in the mid-1990s by park staff.  Ardgillan has a playground with over 30 pieces of play equipment to enjoy from cradle swings for the very young to a large climbing space net for older children (under 12).  The park also has a tea room and a holistic centre, so a visit to Ardgillan is a great day out for the entire family. The main car park is located close to the demesne entrance at “Blackhills”, while a second car and coach park, adjacent to the castle is open for castle visitors from Monday to Saturday.  If you are into activities you have come to the right place. A visit to Balbriggan Golf Club offers a healthy day out.  The Golf Club is among the premier parkland courses in Leinster and visitors are always welcome. We have a state-of-the-art Xtreme Sports Adventure Centre five minutes outside of town, which offers outdoor activities for all ages. In the same area, you can try a day of clay pidgeon shooting, fishing or tennis.  The Dublin Falconry facility at Courtlough is a place for young and old alike to enjoy a fabulous day close to nature and our feathered friends. This year, Dublin falconry will be home to thirty Owls, Falcons and Hawks by the end of the breeding season.  The Falconry is run by Trevor Roach who has been involved in Falconry since he was Eight years old and he has flown many species of Hawks, Falcons and Owls. Dublin Falconry is a centre of excellence for the art of Falconry and it always delivers a thrilling and educational visit. Set in the countryside in beautiful surroundings the birds are outstanding. Trevor has an infectious enthusiasm for his craft and it is obviously far more than a day job to him. The show itself is educational and very interesting; everyone gets a chance to interact with the birds, to hold them and to take part in the displays.  Courtlough Fishery is Ireland’s newest Rainbow Trout fishery, working off 4 acres of spring fed lakes in a naturally rural setting and only 5 minutes drive from Balbriggan. They offer fly fishing for fully finned superb quality rainbow trout from 1lb to 15 lb on their 3.5 acre main lake, or bait fishing on their smaller ‘junior’ pond.  Their water is gin clear and provides the added thrill of seeing the fish follow and attack your fly. Their main lake runs to a depth of 20 feet, with an abundance of natural fly and invertebrate life to keep their trout in prime fighting condition. They aim to offer an unbeatable angling experience to all of their visitors, whether they are advanced anglers or absolute novices, with their resident instructor onsite helping to get everyone enjoying the fantastic sport of trout fishing.  For beginners, you need not worry about buying any fishing tackle as they can provide all equipment (rods, reels, safety equipment etc.) that you may require for your day.  Balrothery village in Balbriggan, with it’s gorgeous old church and pretty cottages is a lovely location, and is simply bursting with history and stories from the past! St. Peter’s Church in Balrothery, now deconsecrated and restored as a heritage centre, offers fantastic photo opportunities with it’s gothic arched windows and diamond pattern caments and gothic arched door.  Balrothery is located about 1 km south of the Bracken Court Hotel.  The Balrothery Inn, which was originally a coach house, has since 1656 tended to the needs of the weary traveller, making their way from Dublin to Drogheda. It is a is a traditional family owned pub with so much to offer with its great history, strong local presence and great food, located in the heart of the quaint village. The Balrothery Inn is extremely family friendly and children are most welcome.  From the Balrothery Inn, a short drive up the road will take you to the famous Man O War Pub.  This cottage style pub is a picture to behold, with its thatched roof, whitewashed walls and superb old style comfortable bar, lounge & restaurant.   If you’re looking to escape to a world of tranquillity and well-being, then balbriggan has only the best.  Monica Tolan’s Beauty Salon located directly across from the Bracken Court Hotel, is an award winning salon catering to many celebrity clients in Ireland as well as their local clientele. They are a favourite of many celebrities such as Little Mix. They won Salon of the Year in 2012/2013/2014 and continue to wow with the latest in beauty treatments. Monica Tolan’s offers everything from cosmetic treatments to advance skincare treatments such as Dermalogica Facials and Botox, and they are masters of HD brows!  A visit to the balbriggan tourist office located right beside the Bracken Court Hotel is the ideal place to get all the information necessary to start exploring our rich and diverse heritage. The girls there are only too happy to assist and chat about the many unique offerings in Balbriggan.  After all this the Hotel bar is the ideal spot to rest you’re worn out feet with a pint of the finest Guinness, Balbriggan has to offer. We’re also delighted to have won Leinster Carvery of the Year 2014 in the Great Carvery Awards.  That said I am truly disappointed that you didn’t get a chance to really explore all that Balbriggan has to offer.  If you would like to come back to the Bracken Court in the near future and experience Balbriggan to its fullest then please check out our website for the best rate available.  I look forward to welcoming you back.  Rory Keogh General Manager

title: Good conference hotel
review: We arrived in Ireland at 5:00 am after clearing customs, renting a car and getting out of the airport we were at the Bracken at about 9:00 am. We knew that check in was at 3:00 pm, our plan had been to do some sightseeing before checking in, however we were wore out from our flight and asked for an early checkin the desk understood our problem but did not have a room. We were exhausted and decided to sit in the lobby and wait to see if anything came open. The woman at the desk told us there was a check out and they would hurry the cleaning of the room. The did a yeoman's job of getting us settled.  The room was clean and quiet. Parking is in the building with the hotel making moving bags easy. We ate supper and breakfast in their dinning room and were happy with the service and…

title: Outsanding Customer Service
review: My husband and I stayed for two nights. We pre-paid for the breakfast when we booked the room, and it was worth it. Scrambled eggs, sausages, fruit, pastries, irish bread, juice, yogurt, cold meats, smoothies. It was really good. We had dinner in the Restaurant, bangers and mash, and fish and chips, very very good. Customer service was great, the room was clean and we had two great windows. The beds were comfortable and the room was very spacious.  One night we went down to the hotel bar, there was live music (pretty good singer) a wide selection of beer and drinks, we had a lovely evening. There is a bus that takes you from Dublin airport to Balbriggan. The bus stop was one block away from the hotel The train station was a five minute walk through very peaceful streets, and the…

title: Beautiful, relaxing experience
review: We had to find a hotel for at least one night due to having to drive overnight to Dublin Airport to see our Son off to Australia so started looking round and the Bracken kept popping up, so I contacted the hotel directly to check for availability and was told not only that they could accomodate us but that they would have our room ready at about 10am so we could go to bed after driving overnight. On arrival, we were welcomed and made comfortable and were given our room, 402, within 30 minutes, the room was a dream, large comfortable bed, clean and well presented, as part of our deal we had an evening meal included, I have eaten in a lot of places but this experience is up there with the best, for both quality and value for money. I have nothing negative to say about the hotel or…

title: 2 Star At Best
review: Booked an overnight stay here based on their Website claiming to be a 4 Star Hotel.  Upon arrival the Receptionist demanded immediate payment. This made be a bit suspicious. Most Hotels encourage their Guests to avail of their facilities during their stay in the hope that they will have an even bigger Bill to pay upon departure. I always end up having an Evening Meal & might have 1 or 2 Beverages also.  When I asked if I could pay my Bill in full the next morning upon departure the Receptionist told me that the Card Terminal they had did not allow her to swipe my Card for authorisation and she insisted on charging me there & then. Strange. When i exited the Lift onto the floor where the Rooms were i got a sinking feeling.  The Carpet in the hallway was scruffy looking. The…

title: Good value but rough at the edges
review: Dear dabudgetmix,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review on Tripadvisor. I am surprised to find such a review as there is no record of your complaint when i investigated it with the Team.  Please contact me direct to discuss your concerns raised at rorykeogh@brackencourt.ie  Warmest regards, Rory Keogh

title: thankful for the night
review: stayed for one night prior to a morning flight at the Airport.  The drive to the airport is about 20 minutes by car.  There is an underground carpark next to the hotel but you need to be very careful when parking because parking bays are at strange angles and there are concrete pillars all over the place.  There is no lift/elevator to the ground floor and you must walk back out through the drop barrier to reach the hotel.  Overnight parking is free.  Free wifi is promised in the hotel's advertising literature and this was a big draw for me.  Unfortunately the room I was allocated had no signal.  I went back to the lobby and spoke to the manager who behaved as if I was computer illiterate.  He followed me back to the room and after checking himself asked me to wait whilst a…

title: very nice stay
review: Booked the stay on a Treat Ticket offer, 3 nights B&B & one nights dinner, also include free drink, very good value. Hotel has car-park right next door, which was free to guests. Check in was easy, staff very polite. Our room was on 4th floor, bit of a maze to get there but once we found it, were pleasantly surprised, room had 2 large beds, large bathroom, plenty of cup-board space & tea/coffee facilities, very clean, view was out over the back roof but still plenty of day-light came in. Decided to have our 'free meal' on the first night. Plenty of variety in menu, 2 courses include so plumped for main & desert. Both had fish & chips, large fish with chips in newspaper, it was very good and plenty of it.  Dessert was equally good.   Breakfast was included, cereal, hams,…

title: Group golf trip for 3 nights
review: 35 of us stayed here from 4-8th of Sept. Orgainizing the trip was made very easy by the hotel staff. They had many offers available. We went for the 3night B&B with Dinner and golf. We were given a list of 20 courses to pick from. The hotel arranged our tee times and pick up to suit us. They also orgainized pick up and drop off from the airport as 23 of us flew into Dublin airport and they also arranged a bus to & from the courses every day. I cant say enough about the staff they were all excellent from check in to serving the food to pulling a pint, nothing was a problem. Its nice to see that service with a smile is not dead and gone. The rooms were large and clean. Breakfast was great with a large choice of cooked and cold food. Evening meal was a la carte with a great choice…

title: Outskirts seaside getaway
review: Our family stayed in a luxurious 2 bedroom suite for a very economical price. We found it clean, cozy, and the staff hospitable.  The perks are spacial rooms, a quaint seaside village within walking distance to the beach where you can enjoy a romantic sunset stroll or take the children to build sandcastles, and great cappuccinos in the lobby tavern. On the flip side, the hotels is approximately 20 miles from dublin but there is a bus that runs frequently into the city centre.  Therefore,  you will either need to familiarize with the bus schedule or rent a car.

title: will be back
review: We stayed in the bracken court hotel on the 7th Sept. We had booked a deluxe room dinner and bed and breakfast. Reception area was welcoming and young manon reception was plesant helpful and friendly on arrival in roomi was very dissapointed room wasnt deluxe carpet was badly stained and grubby bed was comfortable and an fair enough size bathroom was very clean though the bath itself was chipped in a few places the view overlooked the back of the hotel so not great at all, room itself was very warm it was almost uncomfortable at times during the night restaurant was lovely waitress staff so helpful and pleasant and food great overall hotel a bit tired but still ok I would go back but I would definitely be requesting a "deluxe"room as booked the staff alone would make me want to…

title: Good hotel great location for exploring dublin
review: We stayed here in July 2014 for three nights. This is a nice hotel very nice staff and great food.  Balbriggan. Is a great location for exploring Dublin City and County.  The train station is a two minute walk from the hotel and there are good bars and restaurants to eat in besides the hotel.  Ardgillan castle is a great place to spend the day and is only a ten minute drive away.  I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

title: Weekend break
review: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in August.Our room was clean however the bathoom had a large crack in the sink and the toilet seat  would have needed to be replaced.The staff in this hotel are very helpful and friendly especially Laura in the bar. The food was lovely  (very big portions).The entertainment was on both nights and we had an enjoyable stay I would recommend this hotel for a short break.

title: Wonderful stay
review: Well I booked this hotel from the today fm breaks and it was the only hotel left for Dublin at the weekend due to the matches going on in Croke Park but we were thrilled with our choice.  When we arrived we were told that we were being upgraded to a suite for no apparent reason and it was fantastic.  On the 5th floor with a massive balcony which curved around the whole suite.  Lovely décor and very spacious.  Dressing gowns and slippers in our bedroom and had a wonderful view with the occasional visitors perching on the balcony. Seagulls resting.  Our bathroom was very big also with a power shower and then a sitting room with couch and large Tv.  Plenty of storage space and it was just like a home from home.  Staff were friendly a smiling and the breakfast was beautiful with…

title: just ok - definitely not 4 star!!!!
review: stayed in this hotel for 3 nights during August. Having read previous reviews we went with an open mind but as soon as we arrived we could see where previous reviews were correct. Leaving thhe car park we went up a stairwell which smelt strongly of Jeyes Fluid. Entering the hotel it was evident that the glass in the doors ad not been cleaned and there was a smell of smoke in the doorway. Check in was pleasant with very friendly receptionists. We were directed to our rooms using the lift which could do with a good cleaning and the carpet to our room was quite grubby. On the plus side our room was clean and airy, the food in the restaurant was very good and the bar was comfortable. However I must agree with a previous reviewer who got a small lass of wine - I got the smallest…

title: Great value holiday
review: We stayed at BCH for 3 nights 18th - 20th August with our 2 boys aged 9 and 4.   We had got a great deal and went with not too high expectations, but I have to say this hotel is a gem!  We got a family room which was clean and well presented.  Beds were very comfortable and our 2 sons fought over what one got to sleep on the sofa bed!  Bath was separate from shower, which was great and the water was always hot.  Breakfasts were fantastic - we were down sharp every morning and the choice available could not be faulted - there was even home made smoothie as a choice of juice on a couple of mornings and it was delish.  We had evening meal included for one evening, and just had to pay for the boys' meals.  They cleared their plates every night and the food was great.  Staff were…

title: Great Family Trip
review: Had a great weekend in the hotel with all the family. Family rooms very generous in size. We ate in the restaurant on Friday night and had a great experience, plenty of choice on the menu for all and they were especially helpful with the kids meals. It did seem very busy but it did not affect us at all. I don't normally write reviews and we will be back.

title: High class hotel
review: I don't usually stay in hotels like this, I'm more a budget traveller but my partner and I stayed here in mid august for three nights to attend a wedding. The first night was amazing. we got it on a deal but was possibly the best room I had ever stayed in. TV, ironing board, shower, bath, huge bed and lots of space. We checked out for a night in between and came back for two more nights. the price was slightly higher and the room was slightly smaller. It had all the same stuff in it though and was very comfortable with everything you needed. I would definitely stay here again due to its proximity to the train station and great location in town centre. The car park was also really handy. The only small downer was the noise on the 2nd floor that came from wedding guests and loud…

title: Amazing wedding weekend 1st August 2014
review: The run up our wedding was made very easy as we were dealing with a very helpful and professional wedding coordinator, Jean Bermingham, no request too big. Thanks very much for that.   To say we had the best day of our lives is an understatement! Everything went so well and all our guests enjoyed every minute of it!  Staff and food were both amazing and everyone was amazed by the bread bowl for the soup 😊  We also have to put a big THANK YOU in here for Sinead for running the day for us. Sinead was there to make the day less stressful for all involved (especially the best man) everyone had lovely words to say about her. Sinead went above and beyond for us even as far as including our 3 year old niece in letting her ring the bell for dinner which she was only delighted with 😊  …

title: Fairly good
review: We stayed here with 2 children. We arrived early, the kids were very tired and our room was not going to be ready for a few hours but the manager moved things around to allow us in almost immediately. The hotel does have family rooms and they seem to be spacious. Beds are comfortable and bathrooms are nice ( most with bathtubs). The furniture is dated and the carpets show lots of foot traffic. Some of the family rooms look out onto a court which is covered. This court comes out onto a large room available for parties and such. So if there is a party, or a wedding reception going on sleeping will become very hard. During the weekend the party room is often booked and people enjoy their celebrations. There is noise downstairs, outside, and even inside the halls.  Downstairs in the…

title: Not a good experience
review: I arrived here with my niece on the 12th August.  We stayed in a twin room. The Bedroom and bathroom were very spacious. But furniture in room was dated. We had no remote in our room. TV didn't work properly and the channels on the TV were stuck didn't work. We requested a new one never got it. As this was a twin room we assumed we'd have 2 of everything, but only one of everything!!! Also window needs a some kind of net curtain, our room was facing out onto street on first floor, next morning when I pulled open curtains i was greeted by a lady passing by the window with a wave!!! no privacy. The food wasn't great. Not a great variety. Menues were stuck together by staple and on a clip board and a very bad description of food on offer. Food presentation was a disaster, while my…

title: fab 2 night stay, would highly recommend
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us at The Bracken Court Hotel. I was disappointed to read of some of the experiences detailed in your review.   I would like to invite you to contact me directly to further investigate some of the issues raised. If you could please provide me with your reservation and stay details, that would be much appreciated.   I will look forward to hearing from you.   Best Regards  Rory Keogh General Manager  Email: rorykeogh@brackencourt.ie

title: Great 3 night stay, good food, comfortable beds
review: To finish of our stay in Ireland we spent three nights in the Bracken Court Hotel. We used the hotel as a place to visit Dublin, which worked out well for us with the local train station being a 4 minute walk (40 mins on train to Dublin Connelly return Adult ticket €10.50). Free parking at the hotel which is in a multi story car park accessed from the front. Hotel staff were pleasant on arrival asking the necessary questions regarding dinner reservations etc but had the room key within minutes. Rooms are well furnished and comfortable. Our ensuite had both a bath and separate shower which was great. We had a three course evening meal included in our stay which we had on the first night. The food was from their set dinner menu but the selection was great. The food portions were…

title: Very Good but a few let downs
review: Hotel great, food even better but wifi no good in rooms or in reception.. Need to improve on this. Also quality of tv channels in some rooms are poor. Beware. I stayed in 317 and no wifi and very limited channels on tv

title: Great room
review: We took a midweek break here for an anniversary and they could not have been nicer. They had a welcome note with balloons attached for us in the room - nice touch. Really good spacious room and bathroom, clean and tidy. TV remote as in a lot of hotels was very dodgy. Very friendly staff and a great breakfast with freshly cooked soft eggs, just the way I like them. We had a meal as part of the deal and what we ordered was really not up to their usual standard. I have stayed here before and had a really good steak. My wife's monk fish and prawn kebab was totally overcooked and really rubbery with not very nice sweet potato strips which were soggy and to be honest - rotten. She was given just plain fish and chips as requested and it wasnt great either. The seafood in my gumbo was…

title: Needs to change their star rating defiantly not a 4 Star!! More like a 2
review: I arrived here with my aunt on the 12th August. We were told 7-10mins from airport infact was good 20mins and cost €35. We stayed in a twin room. The Bedroom and bathroom were very spacious. But- rooms are dated. We had no remote in our room. TV didn't work properly and the channels on the TV were stuck didn't work. We requested a new one never got it. As this was a twin room we assumed we'd have 2 of everything. We only had one bath towel and one hand towel. With only one shampoo and shower gel.  The food wasn't great. Not a great variety. Menues were stuck together by staple and on a clip board. Could only barely read them was like as if they were photocopied too many times. Following morning breakfast was edible. Furniture was torn and looked dirty. Our opinion is this hotel…

title: Terrible Pricing....
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us at The Bracken Court Hotel. I was disappointed to read of some of the experiences detailed in your review.   I would like to invite you to contact me directly to further investigate some of the issues raised. If you could please provide me with your reservation and stay details, that would be much appreciated.   I will look forward to hearing from you.   Best Regards  Rory Keogh General Manager  Email: rorykeogh@brackencourt.ie

title: Excellent Food
review: The other day myself and two of my friends had dinner in this hotel. Everything was delicious, and cooked to perfection. I would highly recommend eating at this hotel for dinner, all the portions were a big decent size, everything was tasty. I can especially recommend ordering the calamari or duck spring rolls for starter and the sea bass for mains. Thanks to the two brilliant chefs on the night Mark and Noel.

title: Disappointing 4 Star hotel
review: I've tried hard to look at the positives with Bracken Court and there are good things with this hotel.  Free car parking, free wifi and friendly staff are all on the plus side.  Receptionist, Lisa Mooney, is a total gem, very friendly and pleasant.  Our room was big with a large bathroom, the room was clean and overlooked the Main Street of Balbriggan.  The bar is welcoming and comfortable to sit in to enjoy a drink.  Despite the good points there are a number of negatives I can't get past.  The windows of the hotel were filthy and did not keep noise out, the decor is tired looking and the breakfast experience was poor.  In the breakfast lounge the seats were torn and frayed, there were no bowls or milk available for cereal and there wasn't enough staff available to cope with…

title: Dude money in circulation in the hotel.!!
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us at The Bracken Court Hotel. I was disappointed to read of some of the experiences detailed in your review.   I would like to invite you to contact me directly to further investigate some of the issues raised. If you could please provide me with your reservation and stay details, that would be much appreciated.   I will look forward to hearing from you.   Best Regards  Rory Keogh General Manager  Email: rorykeogh@brackencourt.ie

title: Very good
review: Myself and my partner arrived for an evening function with his work colleagues, it was a 40th birthday. On arrival Lisa on the reception was helpful and extremely polite. After that it went down hill, we arrived to our room to no water working in the sink!! An iron service that didn't work, a tea and coffee facilities that didn't work! The next morning we checked out and discovered we were giving fake money in our chance at the function in the hotel. We returned to the hotel to tell them , where they admitted that there was numerous fake notes in circulation in the hotel an that no they would no change them for us! I am disgusted with the hotel and would advise others to not stay. If you decide to I would check your  money!

title: Good value
review: Had 2 nights on an offer but this did not matter ...all staff where first class from reception to bar to restaurant , especially Timmy who was most attentive. Would recommend to anyone. Car parking handy too underneath hotel . Dublin close as is Malahide

title: Good value two night stay
review: Just back from 2 nights grabone deal meal and free drink in bar included. The food was very good a bit slow between courses but staff very friendly and helpful. Good selection of food in bar and restaurant. Service in the bar was good and the staff again we couldnt fault. All the staff are friendly and do a really good job. Our room was spacious and very clean and comfortable. The train station is only a 5 minute walk away so we travelled into Dublin on the train the service into Dublin is handy and regular.. We enjoyed our stay at Bracken Court and would definitely return. Thanks to good food and friendly staff

title: Great value, very friendly
review: We arrived on 21st july, reception staff were lovely and anything we asked to for we got. We ate at the restaurant many nites and our meals were amazing the seafood was delicious and the mains of beef and duck were cooked to perfection.  The waiting staff were more than helpful on one occasion where we left after mains as our son was tired and they brought our dessert and coffee's to our room stright away.  The housekeeping staff are excellent couldn't help enough especially Amanda she helped us alot.  I definitely would stay again the beach is 5min walk and there is an adventure park 10 min drive away. We enjoyed our stay and will return l.

title: Needs Some Improvement
review: We stayed here recently. The car park is located beside the hotel,however it is very smelly-due to rubbish bins, and there is no safe walkway out of the carpark-you have to walk down past the car barriers to get in and out-no footpath. Reception is friendly-though very noisy from the bar and stinks of smoke. The Lift is very dirty-as are the carpets. Room was large-though had dirty carpet and what looked a blood stain in room 409. We had a meal in the Bracken Restauraunt, server was friendly and took orders promptly , she provided a bread plate as we had to wait on our meal and the bread was stale and unedible. Food was ok although  the dessert spoons were filthy and we had to have them replaced. Prices are expensive and there is no vegetarian options on the menu. As we ate we…

title: terrible service in bar area
review: Hotel just ok. Not 4 star.  Needs a refurb.  Main issue is poor bar staff, so inefficient.  Slow at taking orders.  No customer service.  Dont eat here. Sorry didnt take staff names in question. Better hotels in area.

title: Excellent!
review: Dear guest,  Thank you for taking the time to review your experience of the hotel on your recent stay and for providing us with this feedback. I was disappointed to hear of your experience and I apologise for any inconvenience caused. I would like to investigate this matter further and trace back the issue. I would urge you to contact me at your earliest convenience. My email is rorykeogh@brackencourt.ie  I look forward to speaking with you and I hope to have the opportunity to restore your faith in The Bracken Court Hotel.  Kind regards,  Rory Keogh General Manager

title: Not a 4 star
review: Hotel definitely not of a 4 star quality. Public areas lifts etc could do with a make over. Windows not very clean, carpets in corridor quite dirty. Family rooms very spacious again could do with a make over. Stains on walls, carpets, chips in sink and on toilet seat.  Beds comfortable.  Good selection for breakfast.  Service in bar awful. Had to ask for menus, no drinks order taken and in end waited so long for food order had to leave and go elsewhere.  Would stay again if got a cheap deal, definitely wouldnt pay much to stay.  Pillo ashbourne nicer hotel with family offers or castleknock hotel lovely.

title: Amazing staff and great experience
review: Dear terryBrookeborough,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us at the Bracken Court Hotel.  I apologize for the issue you had during your stay and will be addressing them with our House Keeping manager immediately.  This is certainly not the level or standard of service or product that we set out to offer our guest and it is very obvious we did not meet our usual standards during your stay.  I do hope to welcome you back to the Hotel in the very near future.  Kind regards,  Rory Keogh General Manager

title: In need of some attention to detail
review: We had our wedding here on the 5th of July and the whole experience from start to finish was amazing. Firstly I have to mention Jean who coordinated the wedding, she couldn't have done more for us, nothing was a problem and she was a pleasure to deal with. On the day itself the food was delicious and Sinead ensured everything ran perfectly. I would highly recommend the hotel as a wedding venue. Thank you for making our day so special.

title: our wedding
review: Hi I just wanted to complete a review on our recent trip to the hotel, there where four of us who stayed for two nights including dinner bed and breakfast. We chose the hotel upon two other couples recommendations and where  looking forward to our trip, below is an honest review of our short break.  Arrived Sunday after lunch to find the car park cluttered with beer cans and bottles and when we found a safe place to park we discovered we were parked below a really bad leak in the roof of the car park causing a drip of what we hope was water falling on our car, we re-located and got parked eventually.    We headed up to the hotel to see if we could check in , all be it we were early to check in, we planned to leave our luggage and either eat in the hotel or go for a walk around…

title: Great Family Break Away
review: We stayed in the Bracken Court for the weekend of July 4th, 2014 and have to say had a great time.  We are a family of 5 and were given the 2 bedroom apartment which was fantastic, great space for the kids.  Best thing about this hotel was the staff, especially Emma at check in, she couldnt have been nicer and was so helpful.  We booked the funtasia package which was a great deal.  Dinner in the restaurant was great, food delicious and plenty of it.  The girl who served us was lovely and very infomative abou the the menu.  All in all, a lovely hotel, lovely atmosphere, will defenitely return.

title: Negatives over-ride the positives!
review: THE POSITIVES:   Friendly staff, beautiful location, gorgeous food, spacious rooms THE NEGATIVES: Noisy, noisy, noisy!!  Wedding party on 2 nights in a row when we stayed here.  You expect a certain amount of noise obviously and I love a good party, but this noise was unbelievable.  Our room sounded like the disco was right next door and the walls were vibrating.  The rooms are not sound proof.  We could also hear our "neighbours" talking at the top of their voices and hanging out of the windows.  To top it off, a boiler or fan sounded on and off all night which also kept us awake.  We were that fed up with no sleep on the 1st night that we were tempted to check out without staying the 2nd night.  Now I wish we had - 2 nights with no sleep = not good.  Oh did I mention it was…

title: My sister wedding
review: Well it was my sister wedding was on Friday what a great day we had  ...but when we got too the hotel we had too wait awhile as only one girl on the desk..she never told us if we had breakfast the the next day or not but I rang down and we did....wedding was great meal was lovely and well done too Sinead lee u ran the hole meal she did a great job then we had the night time was great fun ...but when we got up too go down for breakfast they were not so nice too me or my friend ....then we came home but my sister and her husband stayed on too enjoy them selfs they taught till the girl on the front deskrd told my sister she gave her the wrong flower and could she get then back but my sister paid for them for my mam and his mam then they went too charge her for the room they already…

title: brill
review: My husband & myself had a lovely stay at the brackencourt. We had a living social voucher which was really good value. We had a lovely dinner & welcome drinks which was included in the price. The breakfast each morning was lovely.  The rooms were spacious and very clean. A great hotel, we eill be back.

title: Excellent hotel. All staff very friendly and helpful.
review: Stayed here for the first time at the weekend in June.  Had a great time. From reception to bar staff to breakfast staff excellent very welcoming and friendly nothing was a bother. We Have booked now again for another weekend with friends and then another weekend with family. Worth a stay! Excellent location dart 5mins away!

title: Nice stay
review: Boyfriend booked this as a surprise :)  The room was spacious and clean with freeview tv, fresh towels etc.   When i first arrived i was starving and got burgers from the buffet which were rock hard and potatoes were too crispy and lumpy. It was then drenched in peppercorn sauce with no bun (weird).  Anyway the breakfast and room service made up for it gorgeous! And very big portions!  Location wise Balbriggan is a lovely wee town not much nightlife but the beach is only 10 min walk away and we were only there visiting family.

title: 0600 am fire alarm wake up call
review: We also were awaken by an early morning fire alarm and then our booked wake up call didn't happen. Having said that the car park is convenient, our room was spacious and oldy worldy although the hall light didn't work, inconvenient as it was located near the wardrobe, luggage rack, iron and full length mirror. We were attending a wedding reception at the hotel, which was lovely. The roof top balcony was fabulous especially as the weather was beautiful, and the dinner was good. The kids were entertained by face painting, songs and games early on, although their meals didn't arrive until after the entree ( although we asked for these to come first ). There was also microphone issues in the speeches. I was quite concerned over staff hours though as the lady who checked us in late,…

title: Good Value
review: We stayed for two nights at this hotel and found the room large, the king size bed comfortable and  the food at the bar tasty and filling. The pay as you go breakfast was good value compared to eating at a cafe. The checkin was quick and professional. We could park our hire car within the hotel's car park which was good for security reasons. Overall we found the mid week room only price of 59 Euro good value.  The only picky points were the room itself which showed its age and the room could do with a good clean as parts were dusty.

title: First impressions didn't last
review: I was really looking forward to something special as it was quite expensive to stay.  Rooms were very spacious but general atmosphere was not friendly. That coupled with a fire alarm going off in the small hours meant not a great experience.  Not even an apology when I mentioned the fire alarm next morning.

title: wonderful stay -great hotel
review: Dear Cathrynol,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review regarding your stay with us at the Bracken Court Hotel.  I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed our spacious bedrooms. I am surprised to hear you did not find the atmosphere friendly. This is something we take great pride in and is something that continually gets praised for in previous reviews.  I do apologize for the Fire Alarm, this was caused by a guest smoking in their room, as you know this was beyond our control and was immediately rectified.  Once again thank you for your review and I look forward to welcoming you back in the very near future.  Rory Keogh General Manager

title: Excellent
review: Had a great weekend at our cousins wedding the June weekend hotel was amazing staff were incredible they did a great job with helping our granda whom fell ill over the weekend get medical help thank you so so much will be back for sure :) :) ***** 5 star from me

title: great hotel
review: the staff where great.very helpfull.the room was brill.large,clean,the bed was so comfy.the breakfast was lovely.lot`s of choice hot or cold.fruit,lot`s to do.the beach ,just around the corner.will be back again.

title: a most enjoyable two nights
review: This hotel is centrally located in Balbriggan yet it was quiet and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and most accomodating. The Evening meal was sumptous and unusual in its layout with the two breakfasts, each having a great selection of continental and Irish.

title: Very pleasantly surprised
review: My husband and I attended a friend's wedding on Friday last in the Bracken Court Hotel and we also stayed overnight.  I used to live in Balbriggan and walked past this hotel almost daily without having ever entered! At check-in we were warmly and efficiently greeted.  Our bedroom was very spacious indeed (though we would have preferred a bigger bed) and was very clean.  The bathroom was a good size and spotless. The ceremony room and the function room were both beautifully decorated and lit.  The meal at the wedding reception was excellent with top-notch service.

title: Wonderful .. loved this hotel
review: I went to this hotel as a deal and therefore was not expecting much but what a surprise.  I LOVED IT..room was lovely, staff great and WHAT A MEAL on sat night.  Excellent value and no rush to get you out of the room on Sunday morning.  Thank you for a lovely treat.

title: Pleasantly surprised !!
review: Stayed here for one night with two friends. It was our friends birthday which I'd mentioned in the booking and they left balloons and a note to say happy birthday in the room:-) nice touch. Food was amazing, entertainment was a good laugh and beds were comfy! What more could you want

title: Fantastic Stay in Bracken Court
review: Just returned from a lovely 2 night stay in the Bracken Court.  There were two adults and two children in our group and we stayed in a family room.  Check in was very easy and the room was fantastic.  A spacious room with one double and two single beds and a sitting area.  Ate dinner in the hotel on the first night and it was delicious.  Steaks were cooked to perfection and everything was beautifully presented.  Good children's menu and generous portion size so everyone was happy!    Breakfast on the first morning was brilliant.  Selection of cereals, fruits and nuts, cold meats, pastries, juices and hot breakfast cooked to order and served quickly with toast.  Also chocolate cookies and gingerbread which the children loved.  Second morning not so impressed.  We were a bit later…

title: Our wedding
review: We held our wedding at this hotel in January 2014 and cannot thank the staff enough for everything they did for us from start to finish, Jean was our wedding co-ordinator in the hotel, absolutely professional, Lenka and Lydia looked after us on the day and once again-outstanding!!! The staff are excellent! The hotel itself is set in the middle of balbriggan town with great free parking underneath the hotel, we had two function rooms for our wedding and the whole top floor of the hotel was reserved for us, the bar is a great meeting and greeting area with a lovely restaurant set at the back, the bedrooms are fabulous, if you are  thinking of having your wedding here I would highly recommend it. Thanks to all the staff who made our day the super day that it was. Kiera & Chris.

title: 2 night stay
review: Stayed here for 2 night's with the hubby had a great time .Hotel is really nice and comfy and clean.The food was to die for and the bar was good.There was a fella playing a guitar in the bar and i have to say he was amazing really enjoyed listening to him sing.The staff were lovely and friendly.The only thing was the heat in the room we had to turn off the rads it was so warm and we had to leave the window open all night so the noise from the road was annoying but it i would stay again loved it :)

title: Great Staff!
review: I have just spent four nights at this hotel. Checking in was problematic as there was a duplicate booking. The female receptionist was very rude and objectionable, shouting over us that it was our fault and that she had 'emailed confirmation'. I'm still awaiting this email... However, the rest of our stay was really good. The staff were extremely helpful, and couldn't do enough for us..particularly Ramona in the dining room. The food is plentiful and tasty. The rooms are clean and beds very comfortable. I stayed at the front of the hotel on the second floor. Traffic noise was a problem, and my request to change rooms was dealt with very graciously, despite a wedding the night before and a wedding coming in that day.Overall experience very good. Parking available in the…

title: "Superb, friendly & welcoming hotel!"
review: We booked through LivingSocial Voucher for a 50th birthday treat. Didn't know what to expect and was a bit apprehensive since none of us all 6 ladies been to Ireland before. We didn't want to disappoint the birthday celebrant either. Well, we were pleasantly surprised how amazing, lovely, friendly and welcoming this hotel was.
