Very clean and spacious bedrooms with very comfortable beds. Food was great and the staff were very helpful and were always smiling, which made our stay more enjoyable.  Thank you to all the staff at The Bracken Court Hotel. We all had such a lovely time during our stay. Will highly recommend to anyone. Keep up the good work and more power to you!

title: Really enjoyable stay!
review: Booked through LivingSocial and was unsure what to expect, but we were extremely pleasantly surprised! The hotel is around a 2min walk from a very nice beach and it has a friendly, welcoming vibe.  The room was perfect and very spacious.  The high point by far though was the staff, they were very attentive, friendly, helpful and created a relaxing and enjoyable atmosphere! They should all be commended! Our waitress at dinner went out of her way to provide a wine to my tasting and I really appreciated that.  The breakfast was lovely too.  The only downside was the heating which isn't individually controlled and my boyfriend found it very warm at night.  Overall lovely stay, will definitely be back!

title: Excellent Hotel
review: We stayed here on a LivingSocial voucher in February. Check-in was hassle-free; the receptionist was friendly and efficient. Our room was ready on arrival, and we went straight up. The room was right opposite the door to our corridor, which normally I dread (light sleeper). However, this didn't bother me over our two night stay.  The room itself was nicely decorated and the bed was comfy. We had a WiFi connection, and the TV worked perfectly. One little niggle was that the hot water in the shower took a little while to get warm, which worried me. The good news is that once it heated up it stayed at a constant temperature, and there was no shortage of it. The water pressure was good too. Be warned, the hotel doors do not fully close under their own steam. We accidentally spent a…

title: Great value for money
review: We stayed here for the Wales-Ireland rugby international in February as Dublin hotels were too expensive. Although Balbriggan is a pretty unremarkable seaside town the Bracken Court provided us with a comfortable base for the weekend. It does some great deals; we paid just 173 euros for a double room for 3 nights. The food was very good and there was live entertainment on Friday and Saturday nights. The bar is lively and charges reasonable prices comparable with local pubs. We'd certainly stay here again.

title: First Class Service (5*)
review: We got this deal on LivingSocial at a very good price so I decided to upgrade as it was for my husbands birthday. WOW!! Hands down the nicest hotel room we have ever been in. We had a suite which was an extra €100 but Oh so worth every penny. They also had some balloons placed in the room for his birthday, this was a nice touch and surprise.  The bathroom was amazing and HUGE!!!!! There was also a separate living room with flat screen TV. The king bed was in the middle of the room against a fake wall, very stylish!  We had our meal, which was part of our deal, on the Saturday night, it was delish. They were very busy but gave us a complementary sorbet between our starter and main course while we waited.  The staff all over the hotel were so friendly and helpful, they couldn't do…

title: Unbelievable!
review: My husband and I stayed here for four nights on a short break. We found the hotel on Expedia and got a brilliant rate. (£120 total.) The hotel is also in the perfect spot. Train station is just up the road with a regular service into Dublin and back, very very close to the beaches and the harbour (I was told grey seals like to hang out there, but didn't get to see any.) Supervalu is just up the street if you want to pick up some snacks, and the Coffee Pot cafe nearby makes pretty good coffee.  We arrived early for check in, but the fellow at the desk radioed housekeeping and got us into a room straight away. Our room was on the third floor, dead center of the front of the hotel. Had a nice view up and down the main street outside. The bed was comfy, bathroom very big and clean,…

title: Weekenders 2014
review: Just back from an overnight stay at the Bracken Court with 3 friends and we had a great time. Great carparking facilities. The staff were so friendly, the food amazing and the general atmosphere of the hotel ideal. There was entertainment on in the bar that evening. We had great craic. Another excellent livingsocial deal. Planning another trip in a few months time

title: Fabulous Hotel & Staff
review: We all thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Bracken Court from 21.03.14-23.03.14.     I wanted to say that all the staff were very helpful & friendly.      Check in was an easy process and the girl who booked us in was covering for the main receptionist, she was very bright & helpful :)    Rooms were clean, fresh, bright & warm :) Lovely (POWER) shower! Rooms were together as requested & in a nice quiet part which was lovely :)    The 3 Course dinner we received on the Friday evening was perfect, the food was second to none & plentiful :)  Our waiters were very attentive & worked hard to make sure that the 6 of us were looked after & catered for.  We had forgotten our drinks vouchers upon check in but I got them from Reception easily :)    Breakfast was the same, we were catered for…

title: EXCELLENT
review: We went here for 1 night dinner bed and breakfast and it was brilliant. Arrived around noon, after phoning to check if we could park the car and go for a walk before the 3pm check-in and the lady on reception said she would make sure the room was ready if we wanted to check-in straight away. Dinner was very good value for money and the staff where very friendly and efficient, Room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice of cereals, fruit, yogurts juices, cold meats, cheese, croissants and a decent cooked breakfast. Very good value and would definitely  recommend this hotel , we booked through the hotel website

title: Def worth a try
review: We went for a weekend on a groupon voucher. Upgraded to the suite and it was totally worth it. Room was super spacious and the jacuzzi bath was incredible. Staff were great and always helpful. Locals were amazing and super friendly! Live entertainment was fantastic!!! Really the only thing that let it down a bit was the food. Hit and miss and there aren't many alternatives to eat to eat somewhere else. Overall an enjoyable stay!

title: Perfect pre-airport stay
review: We booked a dinner B&B package on the hotel's own website & would definitely recommend it.  Secure free parking, friendly reception & a lovely spacious room set the scene for a great stay, followed by a very good dinner in the hotel restaurant.  Breakfast was equally good & efficient checkout - absolutely nothing we could fault. It was then a 20 minute ish drive to the airport for our flight. I'd definitely stay there again.

title: Great week-end
review: We went for a weekend with another couple. The food was excellent, the staff very helpful and friendly, good entertainment boths night in bar.  The rooms were very good, clean and comfortable. I will definately  go again

title: Fab weekend
review: We stayed with Living Social voucher.  Excellent weekend, hotel impressive, lovely spacious room, bar with friendly atmosphere, food was yummy, live band add to the experience.  The bar was packed.  Breakfast is gorgeous, with plenty of choice.  Staff friendly, walks along pier, beach or pathways above beach.  Excellent weekend would definitely recommend Hotel.

title: So close but far enough
review: This hotel is so close to Dublin a €5 train ride yet far enough away to be crowd free.  The town has suffered from the motorway took traffic out of it, however in time this will be a great benefit.  The Bracken Court is a good sized hotel offering large really warm rooms almost as warm as the welcome with excellent food served by friendly helpful staff.  Parking is safe and secure under the building. There was live music in the bar area until 11:30ish. So no late night revellers. We enjoyed a few drinks in the bar and turned in for a great nights sleep.  Breakfast was a full Irish and checkout was quick and efficient.

title: excellent value
review: Stayed here on a Living Social offer , excellent value for money , staff excellent , food fantastic,  rooms spotless and everything working , would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as it is well situated for train travel to Dublin and as previously everything about the place is A1. R Murray

title: A must....definitley recommened
review: Myself and my partner stayed here for the wedding fair on sunday 23rd feb. from the very beginning we found the staff so helpfull and friendly. Gragham on reception was fantastic and gave us the lovely room 311. We will be returning to the bracken court in july for our wedding. so excited...we are delighted with our choice of venue. as far as the wedding fair went i would highly recommend amazing cakes and keepsake candles....beautiful products and great value. I also forgot my phone charger so had to return the following day to pick it up....one of the staff members, lovely girl (sorry cant remember her name!) Showed me around the bridal suite we will be staying in for our wedding. I had a good chat with her and found her so helpfull. I would definitley recommend this hotel to…

title: Great weekend
review: We are just back from weekend break which we got through Living Social. It was really good value. The food was beautiful and plenty of it. We enjoyed food so much on the first night that we had our dinner there the second night. Rooms were of a good standard and bed was very comfortable. The train station is just around the corner. Would definitely go back again.

title: Party spot
review: Stayed here for 50th birthday bash, I have to say all the staff were very very nice with good old irish charm (I like the fact that they have hired nearly all local people), rooms were clean and well equipped, comfy beds, great shower. Party venue was very nice, medium sized room but big enough for the 160 guests. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Absolutely top class
review: Dear pkav1,  Thank you very much for your kind review of the Bracken Court Hotel. We were delighted to host your party.  We hope to see you back again in the near future.  Warmest regards,  Rory Keogh General Manager

title: first time at this hotel but hopefully not the last
review: We just returned today from a 2 nite stay at the Bracken Court.  From the moment we checked in to when we left we couldn't have asked for more.  Food was second to none,  staff were extremely helpful and friendly, with plenty of staff so no hanging around waiting for anything. We had a huge family room, we all slept well, beds are very comfortable and cosy and plenty of heat given the time of year.  We will definitely return again in the very near future.

title: Brilliant stay! Would definitely return!
review: We booked our stay here over february 17th for mine and my boyfriends 2 year anniversary using a livingsocial deal and it was definitely great value for money! We thought it would be nice to get away and looked into this hotel which had brilliant reviews and sounded great.  When we arrived, the woman at reception was so welcoming and friendly it instantly put our stay off to a great start! The room was beautiful and spacious and even though we were overlooking the road outside, we barely heard a single car pass by. The staff had even went the extra mile to put some balloons in our room with a note wishing us a happy anniversary - was a very lovely extra touch and greatly appreciated. The bathroom was large and modern. Everything was very clean and homely. Free wifi throughout…

title: Great service for parties
review: Dear Cousy4  Thank you for taking the time to review the Bracken Court Hotel. I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay. I look forward to welcoming you back in the near future. Please make sure to check our website for the best deals.  Warmest regards  Rory Keogh General Manager

title: Bracken court hotel
review: We've had Christmas Staff Party held in the hotel's bar (as requested). Everything was organized well and staff was just heavenly! It was the greatest party to attend and I am happy to recommend this place. Thank you!

title: Great little hotel, a great stay, no complaints whatsoever!
review: Dear MorikoHimawari,  Thank you for your kind words. I am delighted that you enjoyed our Christmas Party nights. Please keep an eye on our website for all upcoming events and party night. I hope to see you in the Bracken Court Hotel in the very near future.  Warmest regards,  Rory Keogh General Manager

title: Lovely hotel for our 2 night stay
review: Arrived on 28th jan 2014 at 10.30am after travelling on the 101 bus from the airport, even though check-in wasnt until 3pm the nice girl on the desk said she would try & get our room for about 1.30pm, went for a walk round Balbriggan & then a coffee in the restaurant & at 11.30 we were told our room was ready. Had lunch in the restaurant, it wasnt exactly a restaurant meal, but was nice all the same, were not fussy but guess some might think sliding a tray down a rail was like a back st cafe! Room itself was great, our kids booked it for a xmas present & the 57 euro they paid for 2 nights compared well to the price on the bedroom door of 300 euros per night. only minus points we had was a strange man in our room as we slept, a phone call from reception couldnt apologise enough &…

title: Good hotel - not sure if four star?
review: Dear david w,  Thank you for taking the time to review the Bracken Court Hotel. I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay. I look forward to welcoming you back in the near future. Please make sure to check our website for the best deals.  Warmest regards  Rory Keogh General Manager

title: must do better
review: Stayed here recently in a suite for two nights.  Mixed impressions.  Let's start with the good. The food is very good here, ate in the hotel restaurant both nights and while it's not fine dining it's very good quality food in a bistro type atmosphere. As some other reviewer mentioned recently, the chicken wings starter is to die for!! The location is good with free underground parking adjacent to hotel. Nice bar, good atmosphere in it at night and the staff were very good, friendly and attentive. Special mention to the waiting staff.  However, the hotel could badly do with a good clean up, there always seemed to me to be small bits of dirt and rubbish on the floors. Suite carpet was also grubby. There was a plastic potted plant in the room and it was just filthy.  Also our room…

title: Simply Brilliant!
review: had a meal here with my three kids last Saturday night got there at 6.30, place not too busy, upon ordering we were told they were very busy and it might take a while to get served!!!! was told the wait would be 20 minutes, 45 minutes later with three hungry kids food finally arrived, my chicken curry was cold and was just gloopy sauce on lumps of breast meat that was cooked separately to the sauce my daughter asked for smoked bacon on her Pizza but there was none to be found, we queried this with a snooty waitress who told us it must be under the cheese????? what bad customer care we left half the food behind us but no one seemed to care nor did anyone ask us was everything ok Normally I would have gone ballistic with this level of service but did not bother as staff were…

title: Fantastic three night stay
review: We arrived on 23rd January for a three night stay. The hotel staff were fantastic, our room was outstanding, and the food prepared by Colin Farell was absolutely first class, so good that we asked to meet him to compliment him. Try the seafood chowder, unmissable! Can't wait to return!

title: 3 night stay Bracken Court
review: My partner and I stayed here from 19th January 2014 and was a lovely stay. good base for exploring and had its own car park under the hotel that was secure and free to all guests. rooms very clean and spatious, the staff were friendly and informative, there is Wifi throughout the hotel however on our side of the hotel it was not working so we had ro go into the lobby to use. we would stay here again if in the area

title: Excellent
review: I live in the UK but as I am Balbriggan girl born and reared;  I decided to have my wedding here in August 2013. The management, staff, venue, food and service were all excllent. Many of our friends were staying in the hotel all weekend and we ate in it many times and each time the food was fantastic. A great experience which we will never forget!

title: Great Venue For Ringing In The New Year
review: Myself ,Partner, and Three other couples have attended the New Year's Eve Banquet in the Bracken Court for the last 4 Years and intend returning again this year if we are all alive and kicking. We check in about 4 pm and use the room to relax and get ready for the champagne reception @ 7 pm. then its into the Banquet suite about 8 pm. The tables are well laid out with plenty of room between them. The variety of food on offer was unbelievable. As its a banquet you help yourself and your encouraged by the management team to go up as much as you like.Starter's, Mains, Deserts, Cheese Board, all excellent, Tea & Coffee is served to you by the friendliest waiting staff who continuously walk around the tables making sure everyone is O.K. When everyone's finished the tables are cleared…

title: Wonderful Hospitality
review: Stayed for 3 nights over New Year with 3 other couples. First impressions are that the decor is a bit tired but everywhere scrupulously clean and well ordered. Very friendly helpful staff. Our room was large, comfortable and had everything you would expect. The food at this hotel is amazing, from breakfast through sandwiches to dinner. All freshly made, imaginative and very tasty. One of our party had negotiated an extremely good deal so definitely value for money. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Easy access to Dublin via train or taxi and easy to get to, from the airport.

title: enjoyable
review: stayed at the bracken court for two days new years eve and the next day had a great day food lovely and staff lovely rooms great size very clean rooms i had my grandson with me who enjoyed the dancing on new years eve and bar staff were very kind to him will definitely return to this hotel

title: hot wing heaven
review: been a couple of times now with the family good clean friendly hotel good size family room very comfortable really good nights sleep was had by all. But here is where the bracken gets it really right the breakfast is super well cooked. fresh served with a smile and a bit of friendly conversation and banter, but it gets better we had dinner this is where the bracken goes stellar OMG the hot wings are to die for to be honest they were the reason for my second visit and the steak cooked to perfection tender and juicy and then on my second visit I discover bracken fries if you don.t go for a overnight stay do yourself a favour and book in for something to eat.

title: Lovely weekend stay
review: My husband and I went to Bracken Court on a Groupon deal and found it extremely good value for money. The staff were very welcoming particularly the reception staff.  We had a lovely meal on Friday evening and breakfast on both mornings was great the chef added to the fun with his cheery banter!We found the rooms very well decorated and comfortable.  The only downside was the nightclub music outside our window if I had known I would have asked for a room on the other side of the hotel, but it did not ruin our stay and we will definately return.

title: Just fab
review: Just home after a great weekend in this hotel. We went on a groupon deal but upgraded the room when booking, if you can do this I would recommend it. The other half spent half his time in the jacuzzi bath. The food the hotel was amazing, the staff bent over backwards, and if you are there over the weekend and fancy a boogie, get to Home nightclub. The weekend was just great and we will be back. Many thanks Leigh & Scott

title: Excellent great value,  frills
review: We stayed one night in the Bracken Court Hotel. It was clean, comfortable and convenient to Dublin's northside. Great chef, provided lovely breakfast and evening meal for us.This hotel features in Lidl breaks worth checking out. . Great selection of shops in pavilions shopping centre close by.

title: Outstanding hotel - very homely
review: Myself and my partner stayed again in this hotel last weekend - and it was brilliant - right from arriving to leaving - Underground safe carpark for free and then into reception were we got checked in no problem.  We were on the 2nd floor room 211 and it was really nice warm and clean - as we are both smokers this room suited us as it was a smoking room and i have to say you did not feel that you were down graded because you were a smoker - room was up to high standard.  Each morning leaving for Breakfast which was different time each morning we come back and the room had been cleaned.  We stayed for 3 nights and ate in the the hotel on 2 nights - food was amazing and the chicken wings are just second to none - lovely.  Train to Dublin just around the corner and only €5 euro…

title: Value for Money
review: Stayed for just one night, the rooms are well worth the price we paid. Only had dealings with the Reception staff but they were very nice. Free car parking and easy to find. Very central and the restaurant and bar food looked lovely, we didn't try it as it was very very busy.

title: best birthday ever.
review: I had a SPECIAL birthday here last 13 Nov. It was a great success   due to the staff there. I cannot praise them enough. My guests were highly impressed by the Ardgillen suite, food, service, decor and bedrooms.Jean and Helga , the event managers are extremely efficient and accessible . Lenka from the Czech republic is an amazing girl.The waitresses were fantastic. They prompted me and paid great attention to every detail.Please frequent this hotel , you won't be disappointed.The suites are fabulous.Near airport, rail and bus links and lovely beach .Fingal is scenic and home to castles and has a beautiful coastline. Congratulations to all and especially the manager, Rory. All comes from the top and he has a very happy staff.

title: Customer service is outstanding, compensates for some shortfalls
review: Second time around and I really must commend the staff for their care and attention. This is a busy, popular hotel and in some ways, perhaps a victim of it's own success, and you can't begrudge them their business in these difficult times. On a special deal, we enjoyed a two night stay at a really good rate. Our room was spacious, clean and warm, as warm as the welcome we received on check in. A minor problem with delays in getting to our table for dinner was well handled, with a free bottle of wine. The restaurant was buzzing and staff were run off their feet but the food was still first class. Not getting to sit down to eat until 9.45pm wasn't too much of a problem after all. The real problem came with the noise of revellers that was raucous and very annoying as it was ear…

title: Good Stay but don't forget anything
review: First time in Ireland and our first stay was in Balbriggan, a bit outside of Dublin, about a 45 minute train ride, but well worth it if you are new to driving on the left and don't want to pay outrageously for parking in the city. First things first though, we couldn't get our phones to work, even though we both had international calling plans, if it weren't for Graham at the front desk and his manager, we probably would have been "disconnected" for a while. Due to their diligence and assistance with our cell phones and allowing us to trouble shoot the situation in the back office, we were connected the next morning. Good thing because we were to visit Ireland for three weeks thereafter. Anyway, upon leaving the hotel and moving from Bed and Breakfast to Bed and Breakfast, we…

title: Excellent value for money
review: Got a discounted room for myself and my son for the night as we had an early appointment in Beaumont Hospital the next morning.  We were pleasantly surprised with the size of the room.  It was massive!  Beds were comfortable, staff were friendly.  Only downsides were the carpet was a bit dirty looking, the food wasn't terrific in the bar, shower pressure wasn't great and it was a little cold in the room.    I would stay there again though as it was amazing value and handy for the hospital.

title: Overcharged
review: I stayed in the hotel for two nights during the bank holiday weekend of October (27th-29th). Overall the hotel was a nice experience and it was a good break away for the weekend. However, there was a problem with paying. At first when I checked in I paid the full price with my credit card. It was on check out when I thanked the receptionist I was informed that there was a mistake on my check in and that I was undercharged. So as I had disposed of my receipt upon check in I took her word for it, confirmed with the receptionist that I was undercharged, and agreed to pay the outstanding amount by credit card again.   Later the following week I noticed that in fact I had paid the full amount on arrival and was charged extra upon check out. I phoned the Bracken Court hotel (1st Nov)…

title: Good stay
review: We stayed Friday and Saturday 8/9th November.  We were welcomed at reception by a friendly receptionist.  The rooms were clean although some of the carpets were marked.  The food in the restaurant was excellent and we also ate in the bar on the Saturday night and this was also good. I have to say the cleaning staff were really friendly as well.  Breakfast was good but watch the hot plates  - yip they are hot.

title: "Great Stay"
review: Recently spent 3 nights at the hotel as part of a larger group (most of whom only spend 2 nights).  Welcome was fantastic and the staff were all too willing to help.  Rooms were very clean, however the carpets throughout appeared a little "tired".  Restaurant served good food and large helpings.    I would certainly recommend this hotel.  Although a little way to the north, there is a direct train service into Dublin City Centre, albeit not very frequent.

title: Outstanding welcome
review: We were a travelling in a  group of 52 including 22 U15s boys. The hotel were fantastic in how they accommodated for the boys and adults. Very curtious and attentive staff and the rooms were spacious and clean. Food was fine and reasonably priced.

title: Best Value In Years
review: Got an excellent rate at late notice via Booking.com We had not stayed there before & at the rate we got was not expecting much.....how wrong I was.... it was an excellent large room..very clean...good wifi.... lovely linens.....excellent reception staff - very friendly & welcoming...restaurant was closed but had very good bar food...underground car park & not too far from main Dublin - Belfast motorway. We were very pleased & would recommend it to anyone.

title: Nice hotel
review: My wife and i stayed here  for 3nights in october and i must say it was a chill out time  for us the evening  meal was fit for a king  the staff are very good hotel is a good place to stay if your going to dublin the train is a five minute walk. And free parklng on site

title: Great staff
review: Initially we were given a room directly above the reception desk, facing the main road. Very noisy when the window was open. Thankfully they were able to accommodate us with a room at the rear. Perfect peace. The room was spacious, the bathroom had a a bath & separate shower. Both were spotless. Dinner was delicious  but breakfast was a bit hit & miss. Overall good value, good location & great staff.

title: Very pleasant and enjoyable
review: Just had a 2 night stay at bracken Court. Although some carpets are starting to show signs of wear, overall this is a very clean , comfortable and friendly hotel . All staff were very pleasant and helpful, breakfast was of a high standard, and meals in the bar and restaurant were delicious.Bedrooms are spacious,  have large comfortable beds , and the bathrooms were immaculate. The hotel is central in Balbriggan , and is easily located. Car parking is on site , secure , and is free to residents. I think this is a very good value for money hotel, and hope to return again

title: Comfortable Hotel
review: We stayed 2 nights in September 2013 at this hotel on a Groupon deal which included B&B and 1 Evening Dinner.  The dinner was beautiful - don't eat much beforehand as the portions are enormous!  The bedroom itself was clean and comfortable with the bathroom having a separate shower and bath.  At breakfast, my husband asked if porridge was served, the chef made some fresh especially for him which my husband said tasted excellent. The staff are friendly, polite and very helpful.The only downside was the hotel had a boiler problem on the morning we were leaving which resulted in no hot water for showers.  All in all a lovely, warm and comfortable hotel with excellent food and staff.

title: Excellent venue for a wedding
review: This hotel is fabntastic for wedding venues, we have only attended on last weekend and have nothing bu praise to say about the venue, service and overall experience.  The hotel offers fuill wedding package (civil ceremony, dinner and party) for a very reasonable charge and the service was second to none. The party room had its own bar, live band and a DJ after. The decor is very luxurious and the facilities were spotless and very chic.  Would highly recommend.

title: Great Room! Shame about the Food
review: The room and staff were very good. However some of the food was just awful. I had a coleslaw side with my main meal and it really tasted awful (off putting for the entire meal) I did ask the waitress was this supposed to taste like that? But unfortunately I never did get a reply. The entire main was not of good standard in general The desert was tasteless also and tasted shop bought so we weren't impressed with this either. Some food was very good tho like the spicy chicken wing starter! Amazing! Also we got bar food the previous day and it was very nice also. The room was one of the best I have stayed in! Luxurious and just so comfortable! My wife and I both said we preferred it to our honeymoon suite at our wedding! Only for the food I would give this 4 or 5 star as we enjoyed…

title: Bracken court👍👍👍👍👍
review: We had a lovely time at this hotel. It has lovely food, especially the breakfast it's not to far from Dublin and has great live music would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who fancies a trip to the Emerald Isle

title: Friendly Staff
review: We really enjoyed our stay. This hotel is an excellent base for local attractions and Dublin shopping. A special mention for their very tasty homemade wheaten loaf to complement the breakfast. We will stay here again.

title: Great Staff
review: We stayed for two nights for a wedding but were also on a groupon deal.  I don't normally write reviews but had to on this occasion as the staff were great.  All the staff we meet over the 2 days were very friendly, polite and extremely helpful.  When we checked in the girl on reception was so friendly despite the madness of a wedding having their photos being taken in the foyer, it was loud and a little tight for space but she made us feel welcome and not one bit in the way (I wish I could remember her name).  The bar staff were equally as welcoming and helpful as were the cleaning staff.    The rooms were spacious, comfortable & clean, the only issue we had was that they were very hot & stuffy with no air con.  The food overall wasn't great apart from the meal we had at the…

title: Great hotel close to Dublin airport.
review: We just loved this hotel. It was very spacious which was great for us to sort out our luggage before flying out the next day. The checkout time was 12.00 so didn't have to rush out as our flight was later in the day.

title: Great staff
review: Stayed here for two nights,on a deal,with a friend. The jewel in the crown of this hotel is the staff. From all of the staff on reception, Graham and Emma in particular, to the restaurant staff, especially Narren, and the housekeeping team, all were so pleasant and helpful and made our stay most enjoyable. Our room on the fourth floor was clean, quiet and well presented. The bed was a little hard for my liking but we asked for an extra duvet to cover the mattress and the lovely housekeeping staff fetched it immediately. The fridge was a most welcome asset in the room for cool drinks. The bathroom was spotless and the shower powerful. The only gripe was that the fan in the bathroom was constantly on, however, we used earplugs at night so it didn't annoy us. The free covered and…

title: Great Hotel
review: We love his hotel. this was our 3rd visit and as always the room was clean and comfortable, Decoration is modern but with character. Staff are friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was okay but has been better in past years. It's never a good sign when your plated meal is put under the grill to warm up! This tends to make everything somewhat crispy.  Location is good for the coast, motorways and Skerries / Killalane motorcycle road races and there is secure parking which is free.  For us there is only one real problem with this hotel and that is the noise that follows the wedding functions for which this hotel is a very popular venue. On all three visits we have had seriously disturbed sleep on Saturday night caused by noise in the corridors as the wedding guests continue their party…

title: Amazing
review: I have just returned from a golfing weekend at the Bracken Court hotel and I cannot praise the hotel and staff enough, the rooms were spotless and regularly cleaned, staff were very attentive and friendly and the food in the hotel was amazing .I plan to come back soon with my family ,thanks for a great weekend.

title: One night stay but wish it could have been longer.
review: We booked one night on Friday 6th. June. We have stayed here before but not since it was re-built following fire  damage.We requested a twin room and  were amazed at the quality of the furniture and fittings. Our room had a double and a single bed along with a  comfortable sofa and a table and chairs. I don,t know if this was an upgrade but if not it was fantastic value. The bathroom had a full size bath and separate shower, not usually found in a hotel in this price bracket. Unfortunately we could only stay one night but wished it could have been longer.There are good rail and bus links for those without a car making it an ideal base to explore Dublin and its  surroundings.Close to Dublin Airport..

title: Comfortable Hotel but a pity about the food
review: We recently stayed for 3 nights B&B & 1D in conjunction with Supervalu Getaway Breaks. Our room was spacious, clean and tidy but somewhat short of the 4* quality by which the hotel is rated. Complimentary toiletries and tea/coffee making facilities were supplied to the bare minimum in fact probably for one person. The restaurant was not open from Tuesday until Friday for evening meals but the Bracken Grill Menu of sorts was offered to guests in the bar.Although the choice is limited more care could be taken with cooking and quality.Both the Pork chop joint and Sirloin steak( for which there is a 5 Euro extra charge) were not butchered ,cooked nor presented to the standard of a 4* hotel. Vegetables were unsympathetic and under cooked. Breakfasts are presented reasonably well on…

title: Superb people providing excellent service.
review: It's not something I do often as I despise staying in hotels. However the service myself and my family reviewed during our two night stay was excellent.  I admit I did have a small issue after the first night however the staff at reception listened fully, there was authentic empathy not the usual corporate passive rhetoric.   I was taken aback at how the outcome was initiated, thanks to the duty manager.  Thank you all.  Alan.

title: Anniversary surprise
review: We stayed here for two nights as an anniversary surprise for my wife and we couldn't have been happier.We upgraded to a suite which was fantastic,the food was of a high standard and the service was superb.Balbriggin is a small town with a beautiful beach if you can get the weather which we did,the train station is only 5 minute walk away and will whisk you straight into Dublin where your choices are limitless.All in all a great weekend was had and would definitely recommend this hotel if you don't mind being a bit not of Dublin.Would we go back?In a heartbeat.

title: Outstanding customer service!
review: The hotel has lovely rooms and excellent staff.  Smiling, gracious and helpful!  Breakfast was good with many choices.  While we did not have dinner there, their menu looked wonderful.  If we are ever near Dublin again, this would be first choice. Dorthe C.

title: Bracken Court Hotel 1st Rate Stay
review: We are just back from a Groupon 3 night stay in the Bracken Court Hotel Balbriggan. Without a doubt one of the friendliest and most pleasant hotel breaks we've had. Nothing bothered the staff who added to the happy experience of our stay and the food was of a very high quality. all round we would have no problem in recommending this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing and pleasant break. Thanks to all for a really enjoyable stay

title: Catered for my needs.
review: Stayed at the hotel for two nights midweek whilst visiting friends in the area. I'm fussy. The hotel is rough round the edges, not the finished article, but it doesn't claim to be. Needs some owner investment in my opinion. New carpets and more attention to maintenance. These things matter. Having said that I enjoyed my stay. No complaints in respect of staff who were excellent. A bit of fine tuning and this hotel could have potential.

title: Superior Customer Service!
review: Never before have I experienced such outstanding customer service and overall friendliness as I did at the Bracken Court Hotel in Balbriggan. This little jewel was a pleasant surprise and I would happily return there on my next visit to Ireland. We opted for a location away from the Dublin city life and were so glad we did.  This location is easily accessible by bus or train and worth the travel.  The rooms were HUGE and clean with lots of character.  The bathroom was lovely too.

title: Just brilliant...our 4 year old didn't want to leave!
review: From the moment we arrived at the hotel (with its free parking) we were made to feel very welcome indeed. We had booked a two-night package which included dinner on one evening and tickets to Tayto park for ourselves and our two young boys. The receptionist was very pleasant and booked us into the restaurant for our dinner later that evening and advised us that she would contact Tayto Park to let them know of our visit the next day. The room itself (412) was actually a two bedroom suite with separate kitchen and living room areas. This was absolutely fantastic for us as it meant that our 1 year old could sleep in his cot without being disturbed. The dinner was from a set menu with an excellent choice. The waiting staff were most helpful and family friendly. When we had to leave…

title: Decent, but...
review: The hotel is decent and reasonably priced.  Our room was a bit odd, and small (compared to what is advertised) but worked out.  Everything was clean, the bathroom adequate.  The staff was helpful, a parking garage is convenient and free.  The included breakfast had good variety and quality.  Eggs took a while, so if you're short on time don't bother.  Probably wouldn't rebook the hotel.  Not because of the hotel's quality, but because the area around the hotel appears to be struggling (Balbriggan city center) so an evening walk or daytime stroll isn't very appealing.    The restaurant in the hotel was wonderful for dinner--one of the best meals we had during our visit to Ireland.

title: Rooms need more attention
review: The showerhead shot off and hit me in the head, I couldn't shower and upon my checking out they said "Ah the room is free, we can have someone go up and fix the shower"!!!!! The ironing board with built in trouser press came off the wall!!! But the service in the hotel was very good and the food was lovely!

title: Lovely Hotel, Great Food!!
review: We stayed 2 nights on a Groupon deal, very welcoming staff. Our bedroom was a very good size with a separate dressing area. A well stocked hospitality tray and you are given a fresh jug of milk if you need extra. The en suite was nice with a very good shower although some water did escapr onto the floor. The only bad point was the cracked wash hand basin. Not much of a view just the lower roof and offices but it was nice and bright and we had the company of a friendly seagull! I found the mattress too firm but my husband loved it and slept really well. We ate in the restaurant where again the staff were absolutely lovely and the food first rate. So good we were back the next night and the set menu is very reasonably priced for four courses. The breakfast was ample, fresh and a…

title: Very Nice Hotel!!!
review: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. We stayed at the hotel as guests for a wedding and to take a tour of Dublin. The hotel is absolutely beautiful except for the streets surrounding it, contained mostly shops that have shut down. But the train station was a ten minute walk away.   The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly. Breakfast was included in our stay and was very tasty with a selection of cereals or cooked food. The hotel has a bar area and restaurant.   The hotel room was very spacious with double bed, huge bathroom with separate bath and shower.   The only issues we had with the hotel were the staff thought my wife and I had checked out on the second day of our three day stay as they disabled the electronic access cards and we couldn't get into our…

title: nice position
review: stayed here on a deal for 3 nights with friends.absolute bargain.food was lovely,breakfast too.drinks fairly cheap.rooms nice.staff nice.would recommend here to anyone.maybe a few too many kids but it is school hols and they are probably free in a parents room.

title: Lovely hotel. Will definitley be back!!
review: Booked a 3 night break at this hotel and I was not disappointed. On arrival the receptionist Lisa made us feel very welcome. Our room was spotless and very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was delicious. We had dinner on 2 nights and food was of a very high standard with a very good choice on the menu. Once again the waitress staff were very attentive and friendly especially Karla who took an interest on our trip and had good knowledge of the places of interest around Balbriggan.  We really enjoyed the Saturday night entertainment which attracts many of the locals who also were very friendly people. A great base for exploring the beautiful coastal towns from Drogeda to Dublin.

title: Great value!
review: We enjoyed our family suite with whirlpool for very little money and the dinner. Booked als early bird special for a very good price! Good combination with Newgrange! Soept in Balbriggan before giving back our car at the airport and travelled with public transport to Dublin.

title: Pleasant surprise
review: We had stayed in this hotel many years ago when it was called the Grand Hotel though it was far from Grand We were very pleasantly surprised on our recent visit Hotel staff are so friendly and food in both the Bracken Grill and Jack Doyles bar excellent Rail links to Dublin city centre are a five minute walk Hotel was bright cheery and clean

title: Our Wedding Reception
review: We just had our wedding reception in the Bracken Court Hotel on the 3/8/2013 and i have to say the staff and waiting team couldnt do enough for us , the food was outstanding and all our guests were very happy with the service and rooms ,i would say it too people if you are planning a wedding look into the Bracken court Hotel , very friendly staff and warm keep up the good work

title: Comfortable and good value
review: A very comfortable and reasonably priced Hotel tucked away in Balbriggan with warm and friendly staff. If you take advantage of the breakfast buffet you wont need to eat for the rest of the day. Also has secure underground parking

title: Phenomenal find!
review: Sinead greeted us as we arrived.  She was chock full of recommendations, and when she did not have the information we requested, she said "I'll call someone.  Give me a few minutes."  Not only did she call someone, but she also came back on a special trip into work after her shift to lend my son a friend's fishing pole, since there were no rentals available locally.  What caring and individual service!  The room we stayed in was a family room - large enough for two adults, and two very tall teenagers.  The beds and linens were excellent, the bathroom and shower clean and efficient.  Balbriggan is an excellent stopping point near Dublin.  The train gets you in and out easily, and can also get you to Skerries or Houth for dinner.  If you are driving, the highway affords easy…

title: Great value with a Groupon
review: We had a Groupon for 2 nights B&B and one four course evening meal. We paid £119 for it and I have to say it was fantastic value. The location is good and an easy drive down and a 10 minute drive to Skerries. Two minutes from the train station which was a bonus as we used the train to go to Dublin. The rooms were clean and big, lack of aircon was an issue in the current heat wave, also the noise from the Gulls but I guess it's the seaside! The staff were fantastic especially the guy who worked behind the bar, he worked like a Trojan! The breakfast was the standard hotel affair with heat trays holding the rashers etc with a separate cold continental buffet. Quality was good and plenty of it. The restaurant was the best value going but I will do a separate review.  Overall an…

title: Disappointing food
review: The hotel itself is generally satisfactory. Rooms were warm, large and clean although carpets on corridors were a bit grotty. We found all of the staff pleasant and more than helpful. Bar had a nice atmosphere. We were disappointed in the food. Rather bland and luke warm, I read a previous review which stated that the chef's outlook is confused and I have to say that this was the general impression we came away with. That said the portions were large and the chicken wings, the seafood chowder and the club sandwich were the pick of the choices. The hotel suffered from the usual wedding party chaos and pitch battle riots in the corridor in the small hours but I suppose they can't be blamed for that. Overall a so so stay.

title: Great service and hotel
review: We stayed here for one night prior to flying from Dublin airport on our honeymoon. The location as a result was ideal for us and also the fact that it is centrally located in Balbriggan town was a huge selling point to us. We checked in and the lady who served us (Lisa) was so nice, very pleasant and friendly. I would like to sincerely thank her for her kindness and hospitality that evening. We had a very comfortable room to the rear of the hotel. The room was impeccable, I really cannot find one way of faulting it. The breakfast we had the next morning was to a very high stanbdard, all fresh and nicely cooked/ prepared. The staff in this hotel are amazingly helpful. We had free Wifi and secure parking to the rear of the hotel in an enclosed car park. We will definately use this…

title: Lovely hotel
review: Stayed here with my husband on a deal which included a 4 course meal as well as 2 nights b&b. The check in went smoothly and quickly and the staff member was very helpful, (cant remember his name as we went in May and I forgot to write this up at the time! :-p ).  Our room was facing out the back of the hotel so I asked for a room at the front, which we promptly got!  It was facing out to the road and the sun was streaming in the window!  It was lovely!  The evening meal was beautiful as well and the breakfast was made to order and nice and fresh and cooked lovely.  Plenty of hot water and the bathroom and bedroom were both spotless. Only thing about the little village is that it seemed a bit derelict with a lot of businesses closed down, buildings boarded up and not many people…

title: Brilliant service!
review: We were travelling on business and decided to stay a little outside Dublin.  We were given a really friendly welcome by the reception staff and found the rooms large, clean, great beds and very comfortable. Where this hotel really stands apart from the crowd is the service by staff across the board.  From reception to barman to cleaners, breakfast chef and even the maintenance man that we bumped into in the lift they were a real credit to this hotel...when you receive such friendly service it makes you realise just how 'service starved' we are!  Great value for money also on booking via Booking.com  Lastly we ate in the restaurant, 4 courses for 20 Euros has to be the bargain of the century and the food was delicious as was breakfast the following day.  Well done to you all, you…

title: Bracken Court
review: Just back from a stay at this Hotel. We had an enjoyable time and got a great deal through Groupon. We used Hotel as a base to play golf and travel around area.  Nothing to do in Balbriggan itself. Hotel was good, though I don't think 4 star. Carpets on the hall and stairs very grubby and need replaced or deep clean. The only outside space was a roof terrace but unfortunately the door out to it was locked.  Very disappointing as the weather was lovely. Our room overlooked the main street but because of the heat in the room at night we had to leave the windows open and it was very noisy. Room spacious and clean,Staff were very courteous.

title: Lovely Hotel and fantastic staff
review: I stayed here for 2 nights with my fiancé and 2 year old daughter, we booked through group on and when we arrived were told that we had been upgraded to a luxury suite which was great..Everything from the staff to the hotel was amazing. Food was fantastic couldn't fault it at all. Beach and train station are just 5 minutes walk away. My parents also stayed and they enjoyed it too..We will definitely be making a return visit.  Thanks to all staff for making it a pleasant stay (happy and polite staff always make you stay at a hotel that bit better)

title: Great value and good food.
review: Friendly staff, good food and excellent value.The breakfast is excellent and there is a good choice for dinner. The only problem is that parts of the hotel needs refurbished. There is very little to do in Balbriggan but there is always the train into Dublin.

title: Lovely hotel
review: I stayed here for 1 night with my sister early July. The receptionist couldn't have been more friendly and welcoming when we checked in and our room was a twin which was really big and had a seating area and seperate bath and shower in a lovely tiled, clean bathroom. We ate in the restaurant in the evening and had breakfast the next morning and found all the food and staff really good. It is in a lovely location just a few minutes walk away from a beautiful beach and only half an hour bus ride to the airport and 40 minute train journey to Dublin centre. The only downside is that we went during the heatwave and the room had no air conditioning so was quite hot at night but this would in no way stop me from going again.

title: great stay
review: We went to a wedding here and have to say we really enjoyed our stay. Every thing from the staff to the hotel its self was brilliant. Only thing missing was a pool but other then that we all had a great time and would defo be back.

title: Well worth a stay
review: Stayed 12/07 to 14/07. First impressions were great with the underground parking, reception staff very welcoming and helpful. Rooms were clean and modern with free wifi all over the hotel including bedrooms. Dinner and a bottle of wine included in our Groupon deal, food of a very high standard and although we had a set menu it was extensive with a good choice to choose from. Saturday we all decided to get the train to Dublin which is only 5 min walk from the hotel 9.60 euro for a day return. Definitely will be back again

title: Teriffic Value, Great Food and Very Friendly Staff
review: My wife and I stayed here before and always said we would go back. This time we went with 6 friends  and the general consensus of opinion is we will all make a return visit. We had a four course meal deal on the Tuesday night and the food just couldn't be faulted. Nearly everyone in our party ordered the steak and we all like our steaks done differently yet we all got what we asked for with no complaints. The bed in the room was very comfortable, the power shower was great and the icing on the cake was the staff, from the courteous friendly bar staff, the waiting staff at dinner and breakfast and the 3 lovely and pleasant girls on the front desk to whom nothing was a bother all and all a very enjoyable stay.

title: Lovely hotel great for a relaxing break
review: We stayed at the Bracken Court Hotel for a weekend ..  It was a groupon deal & included 2 nights bed & breakfast & 1 dinner. Our room was a corner site overlooking the Main Street , it was a large room with two windows making it bright & very airy. On arrival there was a Bottle of wine in the room. We had dinner in the restaurant on the first night of our stay .. We had to choose from a limited menu .. But the three courses plus coffee were all delicious & served by a very pleasant waitress ..  Breakfast was delicious. We had a very pleasant stay at the Bracken Court & it is only a short drive to Skerries & Swords Pavillon shopping centre. We would certainly return to this hotel for another weekend .

title: well worth a visit
review: Have just had a very reasonable two day break in the Bracken Court through Groupon. The whole experience was wonderful. I must comment on the staff....the best I have encountered in Ireland! The reception staff, bar staff and restaurant staff were all pleasant, friendly and excellent at their job. Taking time to talk to guests and making them feel welcome goes a long way to making a visit there memorable. The food was excellent with staff willing to accommodate us in any way they could. The only downside we could say was we felt the decor could do with a facelift, but, if we had to choose,we would rather have the positives in the staff and food rather than the decor!

title: A little Gem
review: Just returned from a two day break in Bracken Court hotel. I would say I have rarely encountered such friendly, helpful and pleasant staff. From the reception staff through to the bar staff and dining room staff. Nothing was too much trouble. The food was excellent and the choice and presentation  was of a very high standard. The only issue I had was the lack of air conditioning in the bedrooms. We were fortunate to have lovely weather during our break however this made the rooms very warm at night. Having said this it would not prevent me returning. Well done Bracken Court.

title: second time staying
review: the staff are so nice food was ex lovely little harbour and beach near by 20min in to Dublin on train cheaper than the bus,its a bustling hotel rooms are nice and clean,And the bar staff are ex you can have a joke with them always a smile for every one

title: Great value and lovely hotel!
review: Stayed here on a Groupon deal  for a weekend back in April. Free underground car parking and quick check-in. Our deal was for 2 nights bed and breakfast, one evening meal and a bottle of wine - all for £109 for two, couldn't beat that for value!! Our room was on the third floor to the front of the hotel and was huge. The bathroom was also big and had both a bath and separate shower. The hotel has a nice bar and restaurant with a nice feel to the bar in particular. There was a wedding on but as it was on another floor we didn't have any problem with noise or crowd! There's not a lot to do in Balbriggan itself but we just went to relax so it suited us well. Would certainly go back especially if we got another deal like that on Groupon!!

title: Excellent hotel for a post-wedding break
review: My husband and I stayed at the Bracken Court Hotel for our honeymoon and were thrilled with our stay. We had booked our stay through a deal on GroupOn. The hotel is absolutely lovely and easy to find. The staff at reception was lovely (especially Sinead)  and, quite to our astonishment, we were upgraded to a suite! The room was lovely and spacious. We had dinner included in our deal from a set menu. Each of the courses was delicious! We were so full by the end of the meal and not disappointed.  Breakfast was very tasty. My husband likes a cooked breakfast while I like cereals, both of which they had. We stayed for 3 nights which offered us a much-needed break. Dublin was easily accessible by train and Balbriggan was a nice town to explore. I would recommend this hotel to other…

title: Birthday treat,
review: Had a Groupon two nights break with dinner, And had a lovely time at the Bracken Hotel, Staff very friendly & helpful a great change from some hotels, Dinner in Bar on Monday Limited Menu but very tasty,Breakfast good all you could ask for full fry & lots of extras,Rooms clean and tidy Shower also Good plenty of towels,Had dinner in dining room second night &much nicer setting,Try there steak, very good, Special mention for reception very helpful girls,Will be back,

title: Character and comfort
review: We stayed at this hotel in April.  The deal was to include a four course meal.  The Room was really nice - we had a corner room and two windows made it lovely and bright.   The only annoying factor was when we flushed the toilet - the noise was horrific!  I am surprised that the rooms on either side did not complain.  Friday night bar snack meal was lovely.  The 4 course meal in the Restaurant was not as good.  There was very little choice.  I took fish but from the shape of it you knew immediately that it was frozen - and full of bones.   Overall it was a good stay. The location of the hotel perfect for driving to other areas and there are some good shops.  There was music on the Saturday night - very entertaining.  Worth giving it another go!

title: Family Rooms-that have little thought for kids!
review: We booked this hotel for a family wedding. When we checked into our room we found that it was only suitable for 2 adults and 1 child when we had booked for 2 adults and 2 children, when i contacted the receptionist she said there was no alternative rooms but that we could have a camp bed sent up to the room. i found this totally unacceptable as i had booked and paid for a family room with a double bed an 2 single beds.   As the night went on there was a wedding reception on and the noise that could be heard from our room was unreal, when i was trying to settle my son into bed for the night he was very frightened by all the loud noise an shouting from the area below our room window that had a door opening into the smoking area of the function room where the wedding reception was.…

title: Nice rooms but breakfast was a bit mean
review: Dear Dearg 73,  Thank you for taking the time to write your review.  I am disappointed and embarrassed to hear about the issues you had in relation to the room allocation. I will be carrying out a full review of our reservation and reception procedures in relation to room allocations to insure that such an issue does not occur again.  I would like you to contact me directly to discuss this further, at a time of your convenience.  My email is rorykeogh@brackencourt.ie or 8413333  Kind regards,  Rory Keogh General Manager

title: Birthday Party
review: I would just like to say what a lovely time we had staying at this hotel, the staff were so nice and helpful from the time we got to the hotel until the time we left.  The rooms were beautiful and the food was really lovely.  I would highly recommend this hotel and I will definitely be coming to stay again.

title: Bracken Court Hotel - Stay Over and Birthday Party
review: I would like to express our gratitude on behalf of myself and my Wife June for the excellent service we were provided on Saturday 15th June for our son's joint birthday party Calvin 18 and Nathan 21. From the time we checked in all the staff were so friendly and helpful. We were greeted by your receptionists who was very cheerful and booked us in with no delay. All those in our party that stayed that evening were very impressed with the rooms they were spotless and were comfortable. The room for the party was set out beautifully and we were very pleased with it's appearance. I had great feedback regarding the food every one who attended thought it was lovely including ourselves. I would also like to comment on the DJ who did an excellent job the music was great with a good…

title: What a Wedding
review: My Daughter's wedding at the end of May. Food / Service / Rooms / overall helpfullness of very pleasant staff. this place is outstanding, all close Family & friends are in agreement. We wuold love to go back soon for a quiet break!

title: 2 night break
review: we could not speak highly enough about the staff at this hotel , as soon as we arrived we were made very welcome, the receptionist, Lisa, was more than helpful gave us all the information about hotel and surrounding area, made us feel very comforable,the room was large and very clean, we had dinner in hotels restaurant again the lady who served us was very plesant, and again explained the menu to us, thomas the bar man was excellent, remembered our drinks and brought them to our table each time we ordered, i must say our whole experience of the hotel was excellent, we will be back again.

title: Lovely hotel
review: Stayed for 2 nights for a wedding. Prior to arriving had emailed reservations to get an early check in and their was no problem and not even an extra charge. Food was just amazing for function, bar and breakfast. Room had everything you need. Only fault is the heat in the overall hotel. Will defo stay here again

title: fantastic stay
review: just returned from night at the bracken court hotel have to say we had a fantastic stay,from moment we entered the hotel the staff was the friendliest and most helpfull ive come across in a long time.the room was lovely .very clean .when we booked my sister just happenend to mention that it was for a birthday when we got to our room there was balloons left which i have to say was a very nice touch.food all i can say is FIRST CLASS fantastic .i love eating out and have to say this has to be the nicest food ive eaten in a vert long time all courses were fab ,have to mention the chicken wings  .and the steak ,,fab fab fab ,,,i will most definitely return here .well done to all the staff who made our stay ,,,

title: Lady Golfers Trip
review: Just returned from a fabulous 4 day golfing trip. The staff at Bracken Court Hotel were the friendliest and most helpful I have come across for a long time - nothing was too much trouble.  Lovely big comfortable rooms. Good food. Great hospitality. Would definitely return.

title: Guest at Wedding
review: Attended a Wedding reception in the Brackencourt hotel  on Saturday and had a fantastic time and stayed over. accommodation to a very high standard,  wedding receiption venue was beautiful , Meal was lovely staff  and service was excellent would not hesitate in  recommending this hotel .

title: Wedding reception
review: We held a wedding reception in the Bracken Court this May and it was fantastic. Everything from the drinks on the roof terrace to the meal ----excellent. The staff and the accommodation was 1st class. Beautiful bedrooms.We would recommend this venue to anyone planning a wedding.

title: Great stay in Balbriggan
review: Spacious family room, very comfortable. friendly, attentive reception staff. Eat all you can breakfast with good choice, good food and good service. Why does my review have to be 200 characters plus??

title: Outstanding Service
review: When my fiancé and I arrived at Balbriggan there had been a mix up with the booking.  We had booked through groupon so everything was already paid for.  As we had arrived on a busy Saturday they were all booked up and had no record of our booking.  The manager was extremely helpful and arranged for us to spend the night in the D Hotel he reassured us that Bracken Court would cover all the costs of the travel and that the groupon voucher would cover the nights stay in the other hotel.  When we arrived back at the Bracken Court for our second night they upgraded us to a suite for all the trouble.  The room was amazing with a Jacuzzi bath in the bathroom.  The dinner was fantastic as it had been the last time we had stayed.  The wine was also lovely.  The waitress had remembered us…

title: Great Hotel
review: We stayed here with a Groupon deal - 2 nights B&B and 1 evening meal with bottle of wine. The staff were excellent, very friendly and professional. Lisa the receptionist made us very welcome. The room was good if a little warm. The food in the restaurant was very good, plenty of choice for breakfast. The 4 course meal we had as part of the deal was very good. There is secure underground parking and the train station is close by. Two return tickets to Pearse Station Dublin was E19.80.

title: Lovely Hotel , Lovely Staff
review: My family and I stayed at this Hotel last weekend over the bank holiday weekend and it was absolutely brilliant , the staff were wonderful so helpful they were so professional and friendly with everything we put to them from changing rooms to ringing every taxi company around !! We also were there for a family wedding and they were again wonderful , the manager was there to greet us and check in that everything was OK. True Professionalism in this hotel ! We were so relaxed and comfortable here we were going to stay an extra night but unfortunately it was fully booked !! The receptionist Lisa was very friendly and also the security guard even the bar staff were lovely ! I would recommend this hotel very highly ! Spar shop is only a minute away and very close to the beach to…

title: Another great stay at the Bracken Court Hotel
review: This is the second year we have stayed at the BCH and again all members of staff were very polite and helpful. The rooms are well equipped and were clean, comfortable and quiet.  Great atmosphere in the bar with a good selection of beers etc.  The adjacent underground parking was a real bonus.  Excellent evening meals and at breakfast we were spoilt for choice.!! We are planning to return next year.

title: golfer's weekend
review: 20 of us  stayed here last Saturday & Sunday night on a package which cost £150pp,for this amount we got 1 round of golf each  at Portmarnock  links course and St Margarets which were great courses,we also got 1 steak dinner the 1st night and a 3 course dinner the 2nd, may i say that the  food was excellent and there were no complaints from 20 people on both nights,the rooms were very spacious and staff were great,the hotel bar also had its own entertainment each night,will be staying here again with my other half soon .

title: Always enjoyable
review: We always stay in the Bracken Court when visiting friends and family in Skerries. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and quiet. The bar is nice and the food tasty. Its great that they have the secure multi story car park and the hotel is always very reasonably priced.  The staff are friendly and I would definitely recommend it!

title: A Gem of A Hotel
review: We arrived at the Hotel around mid day and after parking in the extremely secure underground car park, were greeted by the lovely Lisa on reception, who is a credit to the hotel.  She remembered that she had emailed me earlier that morning to advise that our room was ready whenever we arrived.  It was and we had a hassle free check in.  Nothing was too much trouble for the staff at this hotel.   Our room, 310, was massive and extremely well laid out with 2 single beds, a double sofa and 2 easy chairs.  A TV and mini fridge made the room perfect.  2 hairdryers were provided and there were lots of fluffy white towels.  Blankets and extra pillows were provided too. Brekfast was hot, plentiful and very very good (a tip would be to get down early if you wish to avail of the bread…

title: weekend getaway
review: great hotel very pleasant staff,great food, great rooms, great entertainment. good location, 5 mins from train station and beach. My husband and I and two friends have spent several weekends here and we will be back again. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: super stay
review: we stayed at this lovely hotel on a groupon offer for our anniversary its was a plesant and welcoming stay from start to finish nothing was to much trouble for any of the staff , the room was spotless and clean, you are only 2 minutes from a lovely walk around the harbour a nice and relaxing stay  and just to top it off FREE yes FREE parking off road right next door to the hotel the food was superb in the hotel so we didnt eat outside  what more can i say we will be back

title: Excellent value
review: we have just returned from a 2 night break at the Bracken Court Hotel at Balbriggan and would highly recommend it to others. The staff could not be more helpful and courteous and nothing asked of them was a problem. We will definitley be going back to this hotel and I am telling my work colleagues and friends to go there also!

title: Better than I imagined.
review: Stayed at this wonderful place over Easter.I dont have a bad word to say, it's situated in an ideal place, 5 min walk from the train station and the same distance from the coast.  It was a romantic weekend getaway for my girlfriend and I, I emailed them a few days earlier and they set our room up with rose petals and balloons and upgraded us to a suite, no extra charge! The views were wonderful and the staff went out of their way to do things for you  Would stay again in a heartbeat!

title: Great value luxury suites!
review: We had a great one night stay in the Bracken Court Hotel in a beautiful and very spacious suite with jacuzzi. The room was clean and quiet and the king size bed provided much appreciated quality rest. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was nice. If you're looking for a nice getaway, go there!

title: Lovely central hotel with great staff and very good prices
review: I stayed at the Bracken Court for a few days in March 2013 and will definitely be going back.  Every single member of staff was lovely, the room (and bed) was extremely comfortable, the breakfast was great and the bar was a very nice place to have a drink at the end of the day.  Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends, family and colleagues.

title: Brilliant Hotel ...Fantastic Staff
review: My husband and I booked a weekend in November in the Bracken Court. We had a fantastic evening meal and found the hotel beautiful,  extremely clean, the staff were very friendly, and breakfast excellent...Unfortunately I took ill and was hospitalised...The hotel staff were brilliant to my husband especially Rory the hotel manager, above and beyond all expectations, they were superb...Balbriggan is a beautiful place with lovely scenery and great beaches..This hotel lives up to its 4 star rating and I would recommend it to anyone........A Mc C ..Lurgan

title: Another great stay
review: This was our 3rd visit to the hotel and yet again we had a great time. The staff from check in to check out where fantastic and very friendly and helpful. The bar has a great buzz about it with a mixture of hotel guest and locals. A pint of Guinness was €4. The rooms are large, very spacious and clean with everything you need for your stay. There is wifi all over the hotel including the rooms  The food in restaurant was lovely and very tasty. We both had steak and it was cooked to perfection. The breakfast was a bit of a let down not because of the food but by the service. We waited 20mins on a pot of tea even after asking twice for it also the idea of the chef giving you toast at the hot counter just didn't work as on both mornings we had to wait on toast. It would maybe a…

title: Exactly what I wanted
review: I stayed at the Bracken Court Hotel whilst on a recent business trip. It did everything I expected of a hotel and I would definitely visit again,  The staff at reception were welcoming and helpful, and we were pleased to learn that the WiFi was all free of charge! The room was extremely spacious, well furnished, and the bathroom was also superb - modern and clean. There was even a speaker in the bathroom ceiling so that you could listen to the radio or television whilst having a relaxing bath.  The food served in the bar is reasonably priced, and I also found everything to be relatively tasty as well. It was refreshing to find that the beer prices were not as extortionate as those of nearby Dublin, and the whole experience was topped off by a great night's sleep in a comfortable…

title: lovely break from kids!
review: Stayed here whilst attending old friends' wedding and the whole stay was delightful! Excellent sized room and very quiet. The breakfasts were just ok but fresh all the same. The wedding couple had their reception meal here and it was a scrumptious 5 course affiar. Just a shame that by dessert, I was so stuffed I had no room whatsoever to enjoy it. The whole experience was lovely - enjoyed even moreso without worrying about the kids!

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: Its a super hotel in the middle of Ballbriggan. Rooms are excellent, They are very relaxing and very inviting. Sleep quality was excellent, service  waswonderfull, food in bar was lovely & quite cheap and breakfast was just super. I love a good quality breakfast & its a good one here. Definately will be back. Staff was very friendly & helpfull.

title: Great deal in a lovely town
review: We stayed at the Bracken Court as part of a Groupon Deal.  The staff in this hotel were all excellent in helping us with any issues or queries we had.  The food in the restaurant was excellent.  Breakfast was ok, not a massive selection but was fine as we got it included in the price.  Our room was big enough but looked a bit old fashioned.  There was no silver handle on the toilet which was not something I would have expected from a 4 star hotel.  The entertainment in the bar was really good also.  The hotel was easy to find from the motorway and there was free car parking.  Overall if this hotel came up on Groupon again I would be tempted to book.

title: not 4 star hotel
review: I had a business trip in Dublin so this was the closest Hotel. it was ok but not a 4star hotel. had no heating till the evening so decided to go shopping as it was too cold to stay in the room. came back before 9pm and was starving but could get food in hotel as it was ''too late''...had to go to the nearest take away. breakfast average. I would say it is good budget 3star hotel.

title: Excellent location for a short break in North Dublin, very friendly staff.
review: We arrived on the 30th March for 5 nights the staff were very friendly and helpful. (We were on a groupon offer) we had a really fab family room it was clean and warm. (no Dvd). We had a lot with us as we have two children. It took two trips from the car park but the staff did offer to help :).  The Hotel is very handy to the m50 and the train station. We visited family in Maynooth and Lexlip which was under an hrs drive away. The highlight of our trip was Newgrange it was less than 30mins away, they have a excellent visitors centre and two sites to visit ( you are bused from the visitors centre) it was all free! The government is doing a scheme on the first wed of every mth! Nice surprise.  On check out we were offered a deal to go back £99 2 nights and one meal!! We hope to…

title: Groupon deal
review: We are just back from a 2 night stay at the Bracken Court booked through Groupon.  I don't normally review hotels on this site but we enjoyed our stay so much I wanted to recommend them to other families.  The hotel was excellent, and the staff were fantastic with our 2 kids (aged 2 & 4).  The breakfast was lovely - particularly the homemade fruit smoothies and freash warm wheaten bread.  Room was very spacious and no noise at all (room 311 altho it was a midweek stay).  Would thoroughly recommend this to other families - location is great too.

title: Very pleased with our stay
review: We went for a weekend as a couple and really enjoyed our stay. The room was very spacious clean and nice and warm. The service in the restaurant was quick (it was a Saturday evening) and the food was top quality we really enjoyed our meals. Breakfast buffet lovely. All staff very friendly

title: best hotel I have ever stayed in
review: The hotel was lovely inside and out with excellent customer service and friendly staff all very helpful in travel and activity advice. We had the 502 suite and it was spectacular, the view was great and the facilities top standard! People complaining about noise from the wind need to realise its a coastal resort on the top floor, and to be honest we were never kept awake by it. We ate at the restaurant one night and the food was lovely with big portions, in a nice atmosphere. The surrounding location has everything you need, pubs, restaurants, shops, bus stops and a 2 minute walk to the train station into the city centre. The beautiful coast and harbour is less than a 5 mimute walk as well and is worth the look! We stayed as a couple and found every request met by staff, the…

title: V disappointing weekend- defo not 4 star
review: Having booked a grouping deal we upgraded our room to a suite - room 504. If you are offered this room refuse it. We were up all night both nights due to high winds flapping the tiles on the outside of our room.   The breakfast was nothing special... Really did not like the fact they used the same tongs for all the food ( I really do not like mushrooms and my food all tasted of mushroom) thank good we didn't have to pay for it.  As for the bar food it was ok...I had a steak ciabatta and wasn't asked how I would like my steak cooked. It came out medium rare. My partner ate it. We then ate in the restaurant the second night. The steak was great having been asked how I liked it cooked however the meagre portions of side orders were disappointing. We then had to wait 15 mins to get…

title: A little gem in Balbriggan
review: I stayed in the Bracken court for two nights in March with family we had two rooms - a double room 318 and a twin 313.    The twin room was exceptionally large it would be ideal for a family, it comprised of a double & single bed, a large lounge area with sofa & arm chairs, coffee table. A home away from home and had all the usual hotel amenities that is standard.  The bathroom is also spacious with a separate bath and shower cubical. The double room was a more standard size hotel room but equally nice. Both rooms had a cosy, comfy feel to them.
