The hotel it"s self is nicely decorated it has character and a good atmosphere, the staff where very friendly and helpful.  The hotel also has a good bar & restaurant, as well as providing free parking for guests. The train station is a…

title: weekend stay
review: Stayed at the Bracken Court from the 22nd to the 24th march with my wife bought for us by our girls as a christmas gift the room was fine and the food great and yes we would this hotel again.our stay there was for total relaxation which we had thank you.

title: Dissapointing Weekend"
review: Myself and my friend just returned from a Groupon Voucher weekend at this Hotel. When we arrived we were told we were on the 4th floor and  the lift was out of service for a few hours.What a treck up the stairs with our suitcases and bags.The room was freezing cold and a large puddle of water on the window ledge where the rain was dripping in through the vent...Although the room was clean and tidy my friend managed to find three hairs on her pillow !!!!!! We went down to the bar to get a drink and the glasses were badly washed and still stained,a good shine with a cloth would have went a long way.The seating area at the window was really grubby and bits of food had been lying along time.We decided to eat in the bar that night as the weather was wet and windy.We waited at a table…

title: A great place to a few nights rest and more....
review: My Husband and I are from British Columbia,Canada and recently spent three weeks in Ireland in March of 2013, After a long journey over and arriving in Belfast we headed off to the Giants causeway and then back to Balbriggon.We stayed at the Bracken Court for a few nights and were very impressed with not only the price.which was great... but the cleanliness of the rooms and its comfort. The bathroom and shower ..just what we would expect. We found the rooms to be very quiet even with  the bar within.The staff at reception were very friendly and helpfull.as were the staff in the bar and dining area. The food was excellant. breakfast and dinners.. and priced well and the atmosphere was warm and it was a joy to see that  the entire hotel furnishing were well kept and clean.As…

title: Relaxing location on the outskirts of Dublin . . .
review: I stayed in the Bracken Court Balbriggan on the 11th of January 2013 for 2 nights.I had bought this 2 night stay as part of a Groupon package and I was not disappointed. Package consisted of 2 nights bed and breakfast and one night you  could have an evening meal in the restaurant.  We arrived late in the afternoon to a very warm and friendly receptionist.You always know how a weekend is going to turn out . . . first impressions and all that.Hotel decor was beautiful and very clean and tidy. One slight issue I commmented on at the time was that we were provided with free underground park (big plus as no where to park on street) but you had to drag cases from the underground parking through the gates you drove in to get into the hotel with them.This is only a small problem and i…

title: room 312
review: hi i have used the bracken court  before on numerous occasions and have used it as a benchmark for other hotels but i booked the executive suite room 312 for myself and my wife for mothers day 169 euros room only and it was a disaster we got absolutely no sleep with the noise of a boiler or extractor fan switching on and off all night it was like a truck engine running all night and to add insult there was no hot water could,nt connect to the broadband until 6am there was,nt even a biscuit in the room and the milk was sour we eventually checked out at about 7am made our complaint to the girl at reception who was very sympathetic and said she would ask the manager to ring us which never happened surprise surprise so if you book a room and you want sleep dont stay in room 312.

title: Surprise Party
review: I recently attended a surprise birthday party at the Bracken Court with an over night stay for my wife and a group of guests and we had an absolute ball from start to finish.  Room was spotless great shower and comfortable bed . Staff very helpful and friendly. I would strongly recommend The Bracken Court to my friends. I will definitely visit again.  Theresa  Skerries

title: learning how to relax away from work.
review: bought a voucher from travel 24 for the Bracken Hotel in Balbriggan for£102, for lou and me , 2 nghts b&b and 24 euros off evening meal.Checked out deal on net and decided to book.How to get there? We took advantage of out passes and what a great way to travel.Bus into Bangor,train from Bangor to Drogheda ,then wee train (dart) from Drogheda to Balbriggan. Able to walk from station to hotel 5 mins and what a surprise.A lovely hotel ,rooms adequate for deal ,food in hotel just sumptuous,.Dart into Dublin nxt day using passes agood day out then back to hotel for more good grub craic and beer. Train journey home was just as easy Left Balbriggan at 11.00am and arrived in Bangor at 16.15 . Agood hotel ,good food a great wee seaside town ,will be back

title: 2nd visit and won't be our last
review: The Brackencourt is like our home from home. The staff are all fantastic and you are made to feel so welcome and valued when you stay. We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner on the Friday night and the entertainment was a real bonus. Can't wait to book another stay!

title: Just Loved it
review: Just back fromValentines weekend break at The Bracken Court. What a gem it turned out to be. I must say I was told that I woudl love it as several colleagues and friends have stayed before but I always keep an open mind and wait and see. They wer so right, From the smiling welcome at reception to the last farewell was easy and enjoyable. We had a lovely room on 3rd floor double windows and bright decor. All home comforts right there for you. I loved the sound tracking from the TV was also audible through ceiling amp so I kept hearing the news and music etc as I showered and put on my make up. Nice touch. A big Thanks and praise for Thomas and the bar staff. Thomas really looked after us and he makes a mean marguarita ( yum). The resaurant was busy both nights as it was…

title: Groupon offer, very impressed
review: We stayed here for 2 nights with a Groupon deal which included a meal in the restaurant. The room was lovely, great size and very comfortable. The food in the restaurant was really excellent and the hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere. Overall we were really impressed and pleasantly surprised given how cheap the deal was.

title: Really pleasant stay
review: My wife and I bought a Groupon deal for this hotel and we were joined by my daughter and her husband for my 60th birthday. The Bracken Lodge looks huge in the small town of Ballbriggan and even though it is situated in a relatively narrow main street, it manages to have a large free underground car park. The front entrance on to the street looks a bit pubby and the foyer is quite old in appearance. I must admit we were slightly worried at first impressions, however we were greeted by a delightful young lady who took care of our booking and directed us to our rooms. We had to use the stairs as the lift was temporarily out of order, but no big deal. I noticed that as with so many hotels at weekends, there was a large wedding group arriving, which can be offputting but didn't,…

title: A comfy feeling
review: In a town just a few miles from Dublin although the road signs were no help, they used something that was not on our map "Fingal", just to lead us astray, nevertheless we found out that we were indeed in the Dublin area and got to our hotel, which had underground parking always a help. Everyone was nice and our room was cosy and warm, just right. The food was good and our stay was good enough that if we are in the area again we will stay. It was also nice that they told us how to get to Dublin and we hope the next time we are in the area the signs are of more help and not with names that are not recorded on maps.

title: Lovely Hotel!
review: Booked 2 nights in Bracken Court Hotel in January 2013 - In town for business.  Great value for money with breakfast included. Bedroom well appointed and free wi fi, warm and comfortable. Doyles bar pleasant with good food and ample portions well priced. Excellent breakfast cooked to order - Hotel staff helpful and friendly at all times with nothing a bother. Would stay again - all mod cons in room - delightful stay!  Gerry from Derry!

title: Great Wedding venue
review: Had our wedding here in December, it really went well.We had the ceremony in one of the suites and the staff did a great job of setting it out, really looked professional.The reception was held in another larger suite upstairs and again staff had it all set up beautifully.The hotel wedding co-ordinator was always on hand to help and you could see put a lot of effort in to make the day go smoothly.The food was really good and portions were generous, not many guests could finish their meals! Reception and bar staff very friendly and will try their best to accomodate you.  The only complaints we have had were that some of the guests coats disappeared from their hotel rooms but again staff did try their best to help.  Overall it was a great experience having our wedding at this…

title: Midweek Stay
review: Stayed on New Year's Day night. The room(bath ensuite) was a nice surprise and very clean. The staff and service were very good, possibly a bit too relaxed for some but not for us. Breakfast delivered to our room was hot and there was plenty in it.

title: Great Wedding experience
review: I recently attanded a good friend on mine's wedding at the Bracken Court Hotel. The exterior of the hotel is stunning and the service to match. Althought the interior is a little dated, the high level of attention to detail more than made up for it. The room where we attended the wedding was intimate and nicely decorated. The food was very nice and the drink was not overly priced. Our bedroom was perfecrly adequate, despite being a long distance from reception. The lift could use a little attention/servicing, it stopped on us and we were inside for a good 5 mins before getting out. Also, the breakfast was disappointing at the end of a very noce stay. That being said, if I am in the Balbriggan area again, I will be back.

title: Things are Still Broken at the Bracken Court Hotel
review: I negatively reviewed this hotel some time ago but recently had a business meeting there once again, at the behest of a client. At least this time, I wouldn't bear the brunt of embarrassment at choosing the Bracken Court as a venue.  We arrived at the Bracken and entered the bar. Once again the service was not prompt however, we tolerated it. We then took our drinks outside to the smoking area which was not heated and most uncomfortable owing to a gale force wind that howled through the passage way from the main street in the town. Not at all pleasant. Yes there were heaters but obviously these were not switched on likely to save on the cost of making customers comfortable. We had spent quite a bit of money in the Bracken that day and at least deserved some comfort.  The one…

title: my wedding
review: I had our wedding in the bracken court on satuday , We are still on a high .  The hotel made our day amazing food was massive my guests are still talking about the standards of the food and service . Rooms omg fab   big huge thanks to helga , patrick , and jean and all the staff   AMAZING HOTEL xx

title: Disappointed
review: Hotel was as dead as a door nail.  Bad location and nothing to do.  Wifi did not work and I had important emails to send.  Restraunt menu was bad not enough selection lights in the room were also too full I wouldn't rate this hotel as a four star not up to my standards

title: Shocked
review: Stayed here hotel beautiful food was amazing was buying a house in the area.so we stayed for a couple of nights to get a feel for the area really execited,but unfortunally a had an really bad asthma attack and was rushed to hospital stayed there for a week.so only got to stay for one nite.unfortunally when i called them to ask if they would give me another nite as a gud will gesture they told me the it wasnt there fault i took and asthma attack i couldnt believe what i was hearing very dissapoined.as this would have been a local of mine.

title: Would recommend this hotel to anyone!
review: Just back from a little break in bracken court, had a fab time our room was lovely, staff were great! We ate in the restaurant and have to say the food was brilliant my king prawn pil pil was the nicest starter I've had in ages! Stayed in the bar for drinks were going to go else where but the band playing were that good ( Pacino brothers) we decided to stay. Overall our experience was 1st class!

title: wedding
review: we had our wedding in the Bracken Court Hotel on Halloween.  i haven't a single complaint to make.  we bought a wedding package on groupon which was amazing value and in truth the only reason we chose the hotel.    the hotel treated us brilliantly.  they were so helpful and friendly with everything.  they were accommodating with a number of unusual requests that we had.    Our guests were all raving about the food not just the quality but the quantity.  not one person was still hungry after the meal.  i am not a lover of wedding food but this was probably the best i have ever had.  at the end of the night there were so many sandwiches left over in the buffet as everyone was too full.  everyone loved the breakfast too.  our room was beautiful, really enjoyed our stay.  we were…

title: FANTASTIC....Loved this hotel
review: My partner and I live in Australia. We decided to get married in Ireland. After reviewing many different hotels we settled on The Bracken Court Hotel, mainly due to location and secondly to price. We had guesses travelling from overseas also and they only had to pay 30euros to get from the airport to the hotel in peak hour travel which I think is quite good for Ireland, there are off course buses that travel also.  The girls that booked the rooms for our guess were top class, so professional and kept us up to date every few days. The wedding planner (Jean) made our planning stress free, very helpful and a credit to the Hotel. The operations manager on the day - Patrick was fantastic, he really was the man on the ground that kept everything together and stress free.  We had…

title: Wedding Venue
review: We held our wedding here on the 1 November this year.. I couldnt thank all the staff enough from the minute we arrived until we left they could not have done enough.. all of our guest completed the food, staff & rooms.   The hotel & both the venue rooms looked amazing & so much more than we could have imagined. A special thank you to the girls on reception, & our wedding co-ordinator Helga who helped us on the run up to the big day.. but especially Eddie who was brilliant & guided us through every step of the day..  I could nt recommend this hotel enough for a short stay evening meal or a wedding   We cant wait to go back!

title: Wedding - great
review: I was here for a wedding on 17th November and I was very impressed by this hotel. Really nice rooms and the function room for the wedding was great. I really liked the layout of the hotel and I think all the guests I have spoken to at this wedding were very pleased with what they got. The wedding meal was great also and one of the best I've had at a wedding.  I know my friends that got married had a great time and the staff we all found to be excellent. Great night and thanks to hotel and staff helping to make it as enjoyable as it was.

title: 1st Timers
review: Booked through Groupon for a 2 night stay.  Was a bit apprehensive seeing that it was through Groupon, our stay was great from the moment we arrived till we left.  We got a lovely room at the front of the hotel was was nicely decorated.  Food was lovely, although breakfast cut-off time gives no extra time for people who oversleep.  Car-parking provided free of charge which is a bonus.  Train station nearby to go to Dublin.  Entertainment on the Saturday was not too our liking but didn't spoil our stay.  Have bought another offer through Groupon which we hope to use before Christmas.

title: Great hotel, very nice rooms
review: I liked staying here, the staff are really friendly. The food in the restaurant is very good and a good local choice of fish and meat. The rooms are very spacious. There is underground parking and very convenient in the town centre

title: Amazing Staff
review: Myself and partner were visiting from overseas. We were gifted a room here for a recent birthday as being from Balbriggan I never had an opportunity to stay here. I was so impressed with the hotel. The staff were all very warm and welcoming with a stand out on the reception team, such a nice girl. The Executive Suite was amazing. Very comfortable and spacious. Spa bath included! We were so impressed we stayed another night. The second room was also very spacious and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we are looking forward to our next visit home for a friends wedding at the Bracken Court Hotel.

title: nice place
review: just back from this hotel in small seaside town approximately 20 miles north of dublin. stayed for 2 nights and had a relaxing break. room was nice but wifi was unstable in room ( couldnt get my samsung smartphone connected but laptop had better success ). the wifi was better in hotels public areas with the smartphone. bathroom nice but very poor quality of toilet rolls for 4 star hotel. hotel was nice and clean and staff in general very good. had a meal in the dining room which was good. breakfast was brought by order on one morning ( friday ) and by way of buffet on the second morning ( saturday ). both were good.  simple hassle free check in and check out procedure. went to dublin for the day on train which took about 40 minutes and cost about 16 euros return for 2 of us. and…

title: Great place to chill out
review: Arrived on Groupon deal. don,t expect to book in and get your room before 3pm. on the plus side you don't need to book out until midday. Car Parking underground is free just give your ticket to reception on checkout. Room was very warm (perhaps too warm) clean and bathroom/shower spacious and clean. Breakfast was very good with usual choices. jack Doyles Bar is cosy and spacious. Staff very very helpful, friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Balgriggan has several pubs and usual hot food premises. The train station is 5 min walk from Hotel and  family ticket for 10 euros will get you to Dublin City Centre in about 40 minutes. I would have no hesitation in returning to the Bracken Court hotel time and time again.

title: not impressed
review: I stayed at the Bracken Court hotel for 1 night on 12/10/12 The hotel itself was clean and the rooms were nicely furnished. When we checked in and out at reception it was very chaotic and we were given 3 rooms. We only booked two. The room we had was on the second floor but was directly above the front door.This must be where everyone smoked. The hotel also has a late night club  All night long you could here people shouting, argueing and screeming outside. There were also people argueing in the corridors, running about all night. doors banging. I had about an hours sleep. Breakfast was supposed to start at 8am, We went at this time as we were travelling to another part of Ireland for a wedding that day and had a lot to do. We were given a tble and could help ourselves to juice,…

title: Weekend Break
review: Dear cdeedee4,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Bracken Court Hotel.  We are glad that you found the hotel to be clean and thank you for your comment regarding the furnishings in the rooms.  We are sorry that it was so busy when you checked in and out.  We had a number of weddings over the course of the weekend and were fully booked.  While we try to be as prepared as possible, it can sometimes seem a little hectic to our guests.  We are aware of this and are trying to ensure a smoother check-in by increasing the staffing levels at busy times.  There is no night club within the hotel but if your room was above the main door then this might account for the noise you heard.  We are sorry if this inconvenienced you and are disappointed you did not get a good nights sleep.  Breakfast usually starts at 7.30am and we will certainly investigate why the hot food was not ready when you arrived for breakfast.  We are very disappointed by your comments as this is not the norm within the hotel and we take great pride in both the quality and presentation of the food we serve.  If you would like to discuss this further, please feel free to contact me directly and I would be delighted to respond.  My direct email is nicola@moriartygroup.ie.  I look forward to hearing from you soon,   Kind Regards,   Nicola Cunningham Bracken Court Hotel

title: halloween treat
review: We''ll be back to the 'Brack' ... just back from second weekend their since July and love this Hotel... Staff are its biggest asset, each and everyone of them deserve credit...so helpful, nothing too much bother... food delicious in both Bracken Grill and the Doyles  Bar too, and very well priced, and for a 'Hotel'  the drinks are cheaper than most bars I've been in. Rooms very clean, warm and beds so comfy, free underground parking in Hotel for guests.  Lovely Harbour,  Pier and small Beach at back of Hotel and only minutes drive  to the Beautiful Ardgillan Castle and Demesne - was stunning in the October Autumn colours -  Gorgeous Skerries Beach and town only minutes away too, visit Skerries Mills when there.  Enjoyed the lovely Swords Shopping Centre and short drive into…

title: 20th October - Wedding
review: We have just had a 2 night stay in the Bracken  Court.  You can have top of the range accommodation, food etc but if you haven't the right staff  this devalues everything else. This can't be said for the staff at the Bracken Court.  In all our years of staying in hotels the Bracken Court team deserve gold medals!  They were warm, friendly, helpful and professional. Nothing was too much bother.  Even when busy they made you feel as if they had all the time in the world to look after you. This plus the food was delicious. Try the steaks!  So good we had them 2 nights in a row!  Lovely spacious rooms.

title: Lovely hotel, convenient for Dublin and surrounding area
review: Stayed at The Bracken Court Hotel for 3 nights 10-12 Sept to celebrate a birthday and our recent engagement. The hotel is located north of Dublin but easily accessible by car. First impressions of our hotel was very positive and stayed that way until the last night. The room was large, v clean with a modern bathroom. With one notable exception, staff were very friendly and helpful, everybody from front of house, bar staff, waitresses to housekeeping. We had a complimentary evening meal there on the 1st night which was really impressive (delicious food and well presented) and we were waited on by a lovely friendly waitress who spent time talking to us and recommended places to visit in local area. We enjoyed our first nights meal so much that we decided to eat in the hotel on the…

title: wedding
review: We had our Wedding ceremony and reception here and i have to say it was fantastic! The food was fabulous and i couldn't believe they came around with seconds for everyone with the meat! The staff were so helpful. Anything from no butter on the evening sandwiches for the bride to ordering in kopparberg for our guests were done. We also stayed there the night before as my Mam was sixty and they were absolutely brilliant! I have to say a big thank you to two people in particular. Jean and Eddie Jean for two reasons, she really looked after every detail that i asked she went above and beyond her job and it meant alot that she came to see me before the ceremony. she also recommended Romy for our ceremony. She gave our family precious memories they will treasure forever! We have 3…

title: Family break
review: Just back from weekend break with family. Lovely hotel, staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms very spacious and very modern and clean. Food outstanding and very good value, good entertainment at weekends . Although not many shops in balbriggan , near enough to drive to other places near for shopping. Would go back we all enjoyed the stay. Only thing I can say about hotel is on the friday there was a wedding on upstairs and my family were staying in room 314 and 315 and the smoking courtyard was right outside their hall window and the noise travelled right up. Think this could be situated elsewhere away from bedrooms.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Stayed here recently with my boyfriend booked it last Minute on line it was 109.00 room only but I rang and got it for 99.00, there is a car park which was great, hotel is lovely clean staff really friendly, room was lovely seperate bath and shower. We didn't eat in the hotel went to Thai Gourmet 2 Minute walk away it was fab, we went to extreme.ie. the next day!

title: weekend break , don't hesitate to go
review: visited this hotel on a weekend break in september 2012 with wife. Underground car park , entrance beside hotel, take your ticket to reception and they stamp payment on card. Enjoyed every minute of our stay. Arrival at 13:00 had to wait on room  to 14:15 untill our room was ready though we were advised check in was 14:00. Reception staff were excellent , apologetic, not their fault as we had arrived early. Had a trip around town , a small town, and a drink in the hotel bar and then room was ready. Room was excellent, clean and well serviced, no complaints. There were two weddings in hotel, one friday and one saturday but this didn't affect guests in any way. Live music both nights, and very enjoyable. Meals were superb and well presented self service breakfast. Rail station…

title: Great value - Great Stay
review: There's not a lot to write home about in Balbriggan however The Brackencourt Hotel will make you return time and time again. We really enjoyed our stay and as soon as we stepped through the door we felt very welcomed and at home. The hotel is spotless throughout and our room on the 4th floor was very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious with separate shower and bath and the bed was extremely comfortable. The meal on Saturday night was delicious and there was great ambience in the restaurant. The free underground parking is a bonus and the ease of getting into the Dublin on the train is also a plus. Many thanks to all the staff for making our stay so great and especially to Sinead on reception for her great hospitality and her lovely warm personality. We can't wait to return!

title: most helpful and polite staff
review: we got married here on the 1st of august 2012, the hotel is lovely and we had an amazing day, all the staff from the managers to the waiters could'nt do enough for us, we have stayed here a  few times even before our wedding and the same thing, we felt very welcome and well looked after, i look forward to going back on first our anniversary, i totally recomment it for a short break or your big day, they will not disapoint

title: Great Hotel
review: Just back from this hotel went  for a 2 night break. Hotel was great, staff were amazing and the food was fantasic. The rooms are spotless clean and are a good size. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a few nights away at a great price.

title: Lovely break in an amazing hotel
review: Myself and my husband stayed here Monday to Thursday.  Everything about the hotel was excellent. Free secure car park.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  We had booked standard double but got a family room, it was amazing, very spacious, flat screen TV, a great power shower, clean and comfortable.  When the hotel realised we were actually celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary while we were there, when we arrived back in our room after a day sight seeing, we had a lovely surprise of a complimentary bottle of wine and a note to say Congratulations and to contact reception if we needed anything.  It was a lovely surprise. Our meal in the restaurant that evening was beautiful, Lidia greeted us with Congratulations and was so helpful and attentive the entire evening.  We took…

title: A very friendly hotel with excellent staff.
review: Having arrived at the hotel we were very pleased that they had free secure parking. Reception staff were excellent infact all the staff had smiles and all knew what "customer satisfaction" stood for - a real benefit for the hotel. We had a bar snack the first night which was good, but the dinner the next night was suberb and with Lidia our waitress the service was faultless. The breakfast I'm afraid was a bit of a cattle market but again the staff were tops.

title: Just one criticism of hotel
review: Myself and my wife went for a two night break through Groupon at the end of September.  The hotel is centrally located in the town with secure free parking provided.  The staff were all pleasant and helpful and check-in was efficient, although we had to leave our bags and go for a walk as the room wasn't available till 3pm.  The rooms are very clean with the usual facilities including a flat screen TV.  The bathroom was spotless and had both a power shower and a bath that you can fill in about 30 seconds!!  We dined in the hotel both nights  - the first night in the bar area from a 'snack' menu and the second evening in the dining room.  Both meals were excellent both in taste and value.  The music provided in the lounge area on the saturday evening was somewhat 'dodgy' but…

title: Lovely friendly Hotel with fantastic service all round
review: Stayed for 3 days a great place to chill out,walk on the beach or travel to Dublin on the train or bus.This hotel is very comfortable and all the staff are excellent - special mention to Lisa on reception,Thomas on the Bar and Lidia in the restaurant all very accommodating and nothing is too much trouble. Food was excellent and plentiful. Rooms were very clean and spacious.Check out the roof view and the Guinness is perfect.Highly recommend this hotel.

title: WOW
review: I had just got engaged the in the morning and my fiance and I booked into the Brackencourt.  When Sinead at reception heard this without hesitation she upgraded us to the Bridal Suite.  The room was amazing and we were sent up free drinks and baloons to make our stay more special.  It was an amazing experience and one I would definitely recommend.  Thank you Sinead - Its experiences like this that last a life time!!! Thank you!!  Martina and Peter (newly engaged:)

title: Wonderful service and lovely place
review: The staff in this hotel were so nice and helpful nothing was a problem for them.  The rooms we were allocated were much larger than we anticapated and were beautiful.  We had our son with us and they gave us a suite so he had a separate bedroom which was great. We also had dinner in the hotel resaurant which was first class and on another night in the bar which was equally as good.

title: Amazing staff and hotel, brilliant for a wedding or a weekend
review: I recently had my wedding at the Bracken Court and I cannot speak highly enough of the staff and the hotel. The venue is amazing for a start. All of the rooms I went in to, be they suite or standard, were well appointed and luxurious and all guests commented on how nice they were.  The reception rooms on offer were both a great size and very user friendly from a guest’s perspective. There is plenty of space for guests to dance, mingle or stay seated at their tables. We were lucky enough to have a very sunny day for our reception so the staff set up the roof top terrace for us to use which was amazing. Following on from the wedding the residents bar is a lovely area to continue.  The food on offer is also second to none. We had a selection of canapés initially then a three course…

title: Nice hotel great food
review: Attended a Wedding here recently... friendly staffs.  It is a nice hotel located right in the middle of town with underground parking available FOC.  Dinner was excellent breakfask good.  The rooms are nice we only stayed one night B&B, I suspect we had been given a smoking room... on booking nearly a year ago we were not informed... nor were we asked when we confirmed our booking some months ago I don't smoke neither do any of my family and as such never thought to ask what type of room(s) are availably... maybe you should be informed?...just a minor moan overall a plesant stay.

title: friendly.welcoming.great service.spotless clean
review: attended a family wedding .staff were extremely helpful and efficient.check in was very busy but very prompt.rooms were spotless and bright and airy.decor  was bright and modern.food was beautiful..ceaser salad to die for.would stay here again.and highly recommend it.

title: Wedding
review: We stayed here for a friends wedding - room was very large & spotlessly clean!  Staff extremely friendly - we had booked online but they gave us the wedding rate when leaving - didn't have breakfast but the food at the wedding was lovely!  Highly recommended!

title: FANTASTIC hotel. Highly recommend
review: This hotel is absolutely fabulous. Stayed here this weekend and the hotel is stunning. Food was out of this world (would highly recommend the soup :)  Staff are brilliant and accommodating beyond belief! Rooms were excellent.   Honestly couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough.   My husband and I will definitely be back again and again!!!

title: lovely hotel and staff are great.
review: All i can say is how amazing the food was this time. We have been here a few times and the food has gotten so much better this is because the hotel has a new chef called Noel and he has the touch when it comes to the art of food.  Hotel and resturant well worth a visit. Thank you so much to the staff for making our night fantastic

title: Not a **** location
review: This is a nice hotel with excellent staff but I would cast a doubt on the 4*  I did not feel the food selection was up to 4* and the location did not come up to expectations. First night ate in hotel "beef stirfry"......not much beef.   Maybe we got it on a bad night as everything else was satisfactory.

title: Wedding
review: Food was fabulous at the wedding but the breakfast delivered to the room wasn't great...room was lovely and staff were very friendly ....lovely hotel for a wedding our cousin had a civil ceremony and it was beautiful and much more relaxed then a church weddin

title: Great hotel, worth a visit
review: Three of us enjoyed a 2 night break in this hotel in a family room in August 2012.  Room much bigger than expected, clean, tidy and well serviced.  Dinner first night was good although partner ordered medium steak.  A massive slab of meat arrived which he was enjoying until he came to the large bit in the middle that was rare, at that stage it was knife and fork on the plate, put him right off the rest of the meal.  When asked by the waitress we provided this feedback who apologised, but we heard nothing further about it during the duration of our stay.  We ate elsewhere the second night.  The hotel was busy both nights as they seemed to have a lot of wedding bookings.  Quite a lot of guests staying and that brought with it a lot of small children running about unsupervised but…

title: Bar food gorgeous!
review: I ate in the bar of the hotel last night with a friend and we both thoroughly enjoyed our food. My friend ate the curry and I had a chicken burger which was gluten free ! Yippee !   Lovely staff and great price too!   Definitely a place to head back to

title: Great hotel, food and staff
review: Spend one night here last weekend enjoyed it from the check in, good value easy going professional staff and the quality and value on the food was great. Room size was good and our friends also enjoyed their stay.

title: great value, really nice food,quiet rooms
review: Had short break in this hotel August 2012, the rooms are very spacious and spotless our room looked out of the back of the hotel (i had requested a quiet room) and this is what i got  we had dinner in the hotel both nights and the food was really good, the restaurant was very busy  breakfast was served in the dinning room also the choice was huge everything was hot the service was execellent nothing was too much trouble  the reception staff were a great help with information  there is parking attached to the hotel  there is also a roof terrace which i feel is not used to it's full potential, no seating just standing tables

title: Nice not to be missed - written by a very hard to please couple, weekend  stay 24-25 August 2012
review: Stayed on a Grupon deal in August this year , was totally enjoyable and fun experience , the staff are very friendly even if they are in my opinion over worked, always attentive and never once were they rude or ignored you .  This was a very pleasant experience to some of the Hotels we have stayed in , Bar staff are also very nice, head barman was very attentive and the bar girl who served use was also very nice and help full , I cannot remember her name sorry  ( She was the one who had come back for Australia last year) they even helped us and advised us about the tall ships festival in Dublin the next day and helped us to find train times and what train to get , we had a great day in Dublin thanks to the advice of the bar staff.only took us 1 hour to get to Dublin from our…

title: Bracken Court Hotel and rail pass to Dublin
review: We travelled midweek with early inward flight  and late homeward flight  to get the most out of our short break to  Ireland   There is no raillink to Dublin airport   but the 101 bus from just outside, took us to Balbriggan in half an hour   and dropped us close to the Bracken Court Hotel     Lisa, the very pleasant receptionist, found us an available non smoking room ready  on the 3rd floor and we were happy to find we were able to check in though still before 11am     The room was large,  with King size bed  spotlessly clean and the furnishings and decor attractive and classy    There was  daily housekeeping, free wi-fi  , lovely white towels and  good pillows    A fitted ironing board/trouser press and iron was very useful        Great value for the Eurobookers price which…

title: Great value stay through Groupon
review: My wife and i stayed in this hotel for the weekend at the end of August and could not fault it. The rooms were very large and well appointed, facilities good (including free wi-fi) and the food in the restraunt 2nd to none. Staff were friendly and helpful and there is free underground car parking. There is not a lot to do in the wee town itself but the hotel had live entertainment on both nights we stayed which was quite good. All in all a great stay and would certainly return!!

title: Smoking!
review: The Hotel was great value,great location for exploring the lovely Fingal coastal region of Dublin. nice little town with a central location on the corner of the main street. Large well lit room with 2 windows and great views up the hill.  Breakfast was fab, cooked to perfection, best suculent mushrooms ever and served by Fergal who was excellent at his job, multi tasking around the Hotel and was very friendly and helpful.  We had asked for a disabled room near reception, however were not told that it reaked of smoke and that  all the rooms on the second floor were smoking! The staff were quite aloof to this and although we were offered another room it was very far away up a hill at the back or else another smoking room smelling of smoke. I opened the windows myself and after a…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Excellent   Arrived on sat 8th sep for 2 nights. Everything was excellent from arrival to departure.Check in was quick and Sinead was very friendly and informative. Room was spacious and very clean. Bar stafff were excellent and I must say it has been a long time since I have seen barmen actually wash and polish the glasses with such care! The food was absolutely gorgeous!! Please try the king prawns - delicious! Resaurant staff work very hard and are all lovely. They can't do enough for guests. I would highly recommend this hotel and would certainly return.

title: Great Hotel
review: Just attended a wedding over the weekend at the Bracken Court and had a great time. Bar food and wedding meal were delicious (recommend the Chicken Wings).....staff really friendly and couldnt have been any more helpful. Room extremely clean, modern and spacious. Would recommend the hotel for wedding/weekend away or just to eat in.

title: try the tomato and chilli bread
review: had a business meeting which ran late friday so decided to get a bite to eat in the restaurant. chicken wings starter excellent, burger more than delicious, but i'll save the best compliment for the tomato and chilli bread. found out the chefs name from the waitress and i will be in contact with dave for this recipe... well worth a visit, but make sure to have an empty belly as the food is sooooo filling (in the best way)

title: Nice Place
review: Stayed here for a wedding. Check in was fast and friendly like all the staff. Rooms are nice and big , clean, I had lunch in the resturant the hotel food was top class. The prices of the food and drink are very reasonable, the down side was it was a hot summers night and the hotel has no A/C in the rooms. But other then that I would stay here again. The hotle is on the main street so cloes to everythhing.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Lovely clean hotel. Rooms very clean and spacious. Friendly and helpful staff.Resturaunt lovely serving great food. Breakfast lovely too. Good entertainment in a lively bar. Good value for money. Would definetly return

title: Lovely Hotel in a lovely town
review: Just returned from a lovely weekend in the Bracken Court Hotel. The Room was fantastic, very spacious & clean. The Food in the Restaurant was fabulous, so much so we returned the 2nd night to try out the bar menu, every bit as good. All the staff were very friendly, helpful & cheerful. We also got the train into Dublin on our 2nd day, a mere 40 min trip, the station is within walking distance of the Hotel. Would have no hesitation recommending this Hotel to anyone. We really enjoyed our stay.

title: fantastic
review: i had fab time at hotel the food was wonderful even though they were rushed of their feet.rooms were lovely and spotless,,the staff were so nice.There was  ,great beaches not far away.watched the seals in the harbor Went back to hotel at nite food was Delicious hubby hated fish and chips in side newspaper but it was so good

title: Wow!
review: Travelled to the Bracken Court with my wife and two children and have nothing but positives to speak of. Excellent room, excellent food and very friendly staff mean that while this was our first visit to the Bracken Court it won't be our last. Ideally situated for Dublin day trips, with the train station only a few hundred yards away. Top Class, cannot wait to make a return trip!

title: fantastic hotel
review: I had my wedding ceremony and reception in this hotel on 14th Aug and i have to say it was fantastic. The service was second to none and my guests are still ringing me to tell me how fab the hotel was and how gorgeous the food was. I can not say enough how special the staff made my day and i would recommend this hotel to anyone looking around for a wedding venue or even just to stay for a few days, you wont be dissapointed. The rooms are spacious the food is fab and the staff are excellent.

title: Fantastic stay, great staff, great food and beautiful room
review: We have just literally returned from the bracken court. We arrived on Saurday 18th August, we were met by a lovely girl on reception who was so helpful all weekend. We were given room 504 on the 5th floor a floor which had a large party type balcony overlooking the city. We went for dinner in the new steak and seafood grill and have to say the food was perfect, all made better by a lovely blonde waitress nothing was too much trouble. The steak was fantastic quaffed down by a lovely new Zealand Sauvignon. After a few hours in the very lively bar which ha a great atmosphere a local singer was blasting out all the classics. We then retired to our room which had a fantastically comfortable bed 42 inch tv, 2 sweater and single seat lounger jacuzzi and very large double shower. Sunday…

title: Renovations August Bank Holiday Weekend
review: 8 of us booked the August  UK bank holiday weekend using a Groupon deal. We booked the day we got our Groupon deal and our booking was accepted by the hotel.  2 weeks before the bank holiday we received an email to say that our 4 rooms were no longer available because the hotel was undergoing  renovations!  Surprisingly there was no mention of the renovations on the website and when I checked there were 4 rooms available on the Sunday night. Groupon have refunded our money but the Bracken Court has lost this and any future business.

title: lovely stay!!
review: Booked through travel 24,Thanks for accommodating the extra kids!!! Good sized rooms & exceptionally clean.Easy access to Dublin as i usually head north,have to say excellent value for money, will return again. The foods fab in the hotel & I`m hard pleased so I`m told :),the staff were A+++,a great big thank you to all especially Lisa...

title: Wonderful stay!!
review: Amazing, wonderful stay at Bracken Court Hotel. A wonderful welcome, spacious , clean and bright rooms. Delicious food in the restaurant.  A lovely reception area to relax and have a coffee or a drink.  The bar is cosy and welcoming and the staff throughout the stay very friendly. Cant wait to go back.  Cathy and Paul

title: Excellent
review: Hi rob & John here . We got married on 22 June and had a  fantastic time . The staff couldn't do enough especially Helga and Patrick . it is a beautiful hotel very clean and very central. The food was fantastic . It's great to see a hotel full in these times. They are obviously doing something very right.

title: A great deal!
review: Just returned from this hotel, having been on a Travel24 deal. Pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel, excellent food and a real homely atmosphere. The ribs in brandy were the best starter i've had in a long time! Balbriggan is a pleasant town, suffering the effects of the economic crisis like everywhere else unfortunately. The staff in the hotel were excellent, especially Nasen, who went out of his way to make our dinner on the first night really memorable. All in all, a great hotel where service comes with a smile!

title: great weekend
review: i bought a groupon voucher for the bracken court hotel in balbriggan, we arrived on the sunday afternoon and went into the restaurtant for lunch which was great  and only about 10 euros the food was fab. that night we has a 3 course meal which again was great. the pub across the road had live music and dancing we stayed  until late everyone was so friendly. the next day we had a lovely breakfast then headed to dublin on the train. had a very enjoyable day in the temple bar area going from pub to pub following the live music which was great. train back and another lovely meal at the bracken court hotel. we upgraded to a suite which was really lovely and well worth the extra euros. have another weekend booked end of october cant wait, well done bracken court and of course we have…

title: THE STAFF MAKE THIS HOTEL
review: Stayed here over weekend 3 -5 august on a special Groupon offer. Lovely hotel, ideally located in Balbriggan, underground carpark, which is a great help. The accomodation was lovely, large room and marble bathroom. The food, breakfast was a buffet style with plenty of choice, all well prepared, certainly set you up for the days touring. Evening meal was a 4 course one, excellent, good choice and plenty of it on the plate, all we could do to finish it. One of the best meals I have had in a long while. But what makes this hotel stand out is the staff, never have I come across such pleasant members, always willing to put themselves out that little bit more to ensure your stay is made enjoyable. I have to mention Sinead and Shauna on reception, marvellous girls, also Lydia in the…

title: Very nice!
review: We needed a wheelchair accessible room - it was very good.  Adequate room for wheelchair on both sides of bed.  Bathroom was a wet room, it was a great size & well adapted.   Doorways within hotel were OK but weren't overly wide.  When trying to go to the toilets from the bar it was nearly impossible because there were tables & chairs blocking the way, so when the bar was busy these tables & chairs were obviously in use.  My most straigtforward way of getting to public toilet to go outside the bar door & in the main door of the hotel  - although this was not a big deal, it certainly was not ideal!!  Service provided by all staff in reception, bar & restaurant was excellent. Entertainment on both nights was great. Food in restaurant was fantastic - would highly recommend.

title: Fabulous hotel
review: Stayed here for the weekend.  Beautiful hotel.  Extremely comfortable, great staff, fantastic delicious food.  Will definitely stay again and will definitely recommend to others.  The location is also brilliant.   Rooms were really spacious and spotlessly clean with quality furnishings. Only one small drawback - there was no fridge in our room and the fridges in the other rooms did not work.

title: Going the extra mile.
review: I passed comment in June when I booked the deal that the receptionist was lovely, telling me info on the local amenities then. When we arrived I met him, Graham. He went the extra mile from start to finish. I could not fault anything about the kind and friendly reception we received by him and and all the staff at the hotel. I have never in my life stayed in a hotel where I the staff have been so friendly and down to earth.   We stayed for 2 nights bed and breakfast and got an evening meal. Which again I can not fault. It was delicious. Compliments to the chef.   Over all are experience was really enjoyable I would like to say an extra special thanks to Graham, only Disappointment was that you were off the day we checked out and we didn't get to thank u personally. Hopefully you…

title: GREAT VALUE
review: Cracking hotel with great service.. With a special mention going to the young man Graham who works at reception. He could not have any more helpful from the moment we booked the hotel and throughout our stay.  Food was absolutely gorgeous. We had a bit of pub grub at the hotel bar on the Friday evening after arrival which hit the spot perfectly, I recommend the burger and the chicken wings starter. Our deal included an evening meal which we had on the Saturday. We were treated to an amazing three course meal. Balbriggan itself is a nice wee Irish town with handy access into Dublin city center via train. We are already arranging a return visit before christmas to do a bit if shopping in Dublin.  Thanks very much...  From Matthew, Carly, Tony and Mandy

title: Very enjoyable 2 night stay
review: My husband and I are just back from a 2 night break at the Bracken Court. The staff were all very helpful, food delicious (we had one evening meal in the hotel & breakfast on both mornings) and the bedroom very spacious and clean. The free underground car parking was also very handy. Whilst this hotel is not that close to Dublin city centre, it's easily accessible by car (or I'm sure by public transport). We also enjoyed visiting the nearby beach (luckily the weather was sunny) and Ardgillan Castle which is a little hidden gem. We would definitely stay in the hotel again & would fully recommend to friends and family.

title: Very Nice Hotel
review: My family and I went for a meal today in the hotel, we live locally but don't visit it much, we all had food from the cavery in the restaurant. I have to say the food was delightful and the service was excellent. On the way out we were greeted by a lovely friendly receptionist, i think her name was Sinead she was very pleasant and was asking how are meal was and if she could do anything for us, clearly she a very important asset for the company. Will definitely visit the hotel a lot more due to good food, great service and a wonderful atmosphere.

title: Family friendly, fun-filled package deal
review: Just back from a very enjoyable few days at the Bracken Court Hotel. The hotel itself is very central, right in the middle of the town. You will find the beach, a cinema, Morelli's (delicious) Ice cream parlour and Pj's play centre all just a very short stroll away.  We had a really good value package deal, which included entrance for the kids to PJ's play centre and family access to Funtasia Water Park (which is just AMAZING) included in the hotel price. Funtasia is only about 20 mins drive from the hotel, and a very direct route (get there early to avoid the crowds).  The receptionist Graham was really helpful at the time of booking. He recommended room 315 to us, as it is a suite with separate sleeping areas as opposed to just a large family room. That really made a…

title: great hotel & staff
review: my partner and i stayed in for a few days in july we were very impressed its a lovely hotel very clean and rooms were very comfordable great nights sleep even with a wedding on the staff were great very helpful and the food was great chowder and ribs very tasty .we will be back again there is not much in the town but we got the train into dublin which was only 10 euro return for the two of us the receptionist had printed out the timetable for us enjoyed this stay very much.

title: Travel24-deals - 'Bracken Court offer' Awsome! we'll be back :)
review: My Partner & I recentley took up an offer from Travel24-deals.co.uk for our first trip to Dublin staying for two nights 16th -18th July 2012 at the hotel. On arriving from Liverpool, the staff where friendly, proffesional & could'nt do enough. The room was spotless, spacious & the bed was heavenly. The highlight though of the entire holiday was dining at the hotel's Bracken Grill Steak & Seafood Restaraunt. With both Breakfast & evening meals cooked fresh in front of guests, the food was world class & better than some of the Michelin Five Star restaraunts we have dined at, including service from the staff. From Steak to Fish dishes, sweets that are luxurious, a particular favourite was the hotels 'pork belly ribs' cooked in a unique marinade. I would have took a picture to…

title: Great Stay
review: I stayed here for four nights with friends and we all had a lovely time.  The rooms are large and spacious with everything that you will need.  We found all the staff to be very friendly and accommodating.      There is a nice bar and restaurant serving a tasty breakfast in the morning and meals during the day and evening.  We found the steaks particularly nice although as some other reviews have said meals can take a while to come out.     If I return to this part of Ireland again (I hope I do) I will be using this hotel again.   It’s worth noting that the train station is only a few minutes’ walk away from the hotel (no train noise can be heard at the hotel)  with trains to Dublin running from 6.30am (approx) in the morning and returning as late as 11.30pm from Dublin stations…

title: I'll be back
review: Hotel spotless not been in one as well kept in a while. Food just superb, Chef provided even when not on menu. Food was heavenly and so well presented. Reception and all other staff really pleasant and helpful. Will be back

title: stay w/e 13th july
review: nice hotel and staff very good, could;nt fault them. evening meal very disappointing , first plate returned scampy burnt, was replaced with battered fish unfortunatly cooked in same oil so was also tasting burnt. m.h.

title: Nice Hotel
review: My husband and I have just returned from staying 2 nights BB+EM in this hotel, the food is good although the we did wait a long time on our meals, we also had 20 wait on our table even though it was booked, the breakfast was good plently to choose from.   The room was really nice we were on the 3rd floor very big and comfortable it was cleaned each day fresh towels were given each day and I have to say these were lovely and white plus soft, the shower was not great in our room but I think the head of the shower needed cleaned to allow the water to flow, we had a mini fridge which was great to keep the wine and water in.  Parking the car was great to as it was under ground and free which was a bonus not much to do in the town but handy for Dublin, if you are coming down at a…

title: Good Hotel
review: Stayed for two nights last week.  Our room was not ready when we arrived at 3pm but we were offered another room within minutes and it was probably better than the one we were originally allocated.  Lots of space with an area with a table and easy chairs, really good beds and a big bathroom.  Definitely one of the best rooms I have stayed in an Irish hotel.  We dined in the bar on the first evening however there was definitely a staff shortage and two staff had to cope with a crowded bar and restaurant, and they did their best but there were delays.  We could see families having to wait a long time for their food.  When ours arrived it was just about satisfactory, we were hungry so we ate it but could not say we would recommend the food. Breakfast next day was standard buffet…

title: Great hotel with excellent service!
review: We got a great deal which led us to this hotel! We really enjoyed it - there was free parking and the staff were always very friendly and polite. We ate in the hotel as a meal was included in our offer and the food and service were excellent. The rooms are clean and spacious and the bed was really comfy.

title: Fantastic & comfortable
review: This hotel is spotless. The rooms are a good size. The food is excellent although the service is a bit slow. The location is great it is very close to the shops and the beautiful beach.  I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

title: brilliant hotel
review: My husband and I stayed in the hotel for our anniversary we got an excellent deal and we also got complimentary upgrade to a suite which was amazing. The receptionist Sinead was a really lovely and helpful woman. We had dinner in the hotel both nights as the food was amazing, everything about the hotel was excellent and I would definitely go back

title: Superb hospitality
review: After staying in Bracken Court Hotel- I'm can honestly admit- I haven't been so impressed in a long time. Hotel is in the heart of the village, restaurant serves delicious food & atmosphere is trully relaxing. However what makes it stand out is excellent customer care, service we have received from reception staff was outstanding- trully memorable. You might not get the nice weather, but if you stay here- you are in good hands, that's for sure.

title: Good night
review: My stay in this hotel was good.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.   The food was okay and I had an enjoyable night celebrating my friends wedding.

title: Great Hotel for a wedding
review: I was the best man at a wedding here recently and I've nothing but praise for the staff in this hotel. I wanted to use some video in my speech and these guys really did everything they could to make it happen and it worked really well. The food was very good and the staff waited on us hand and foot. Great job Bracken Court. Keep up the good work.

title: Excellent staff great hotel for wedding
review: I would like to give the staff a very big thank you for all there help and superior service through mydaughter wedding ,  We dealt mostly with Jean  before the wedding day a lovely lady always very welcoming and professional Thanks for everything Jean, I also want to mention sinead on reception very friendly  and helpful to all our guests , Thanks sinead ,  On arrival to the bracken court  the front of house staff  bar staff were great made everyone feel very welcome , The function room was set out beautifully , Food was great from starters through to evening food served at 11 in the evening . The bedrooms were spacious and spotlessly clean , the breakfast was great too , A very well run hotel and I would like to say thank you all for making Claire and Thomas wedding day special

title: Nice hotel but nothing more
review: My wife and I attended a wedding at the Bracken Court hotel recently and we also stayed the night. The hotel is nice, clean and reasonable. The Rooms are spacious, clean and well equipped in the main. The breakfast was tastey and the wedding meal was very enjoyable if nothing too special. I felt that this was a nice hotel if you're staying in this part of Dublin. The only downsides to the stay was the general air of confusion in trying to arrange rooms for the large number of guests checking in for the wedding and that a lot of rooms hadn't been cleaned and turned over by 2pm - 3pm meaning a few guests were left waiting to check in at what should be a reasonable check in time. I'd recommend this hotel overall but don't expect anything too fancy.

title: superb food, attentive staff, excellent value
review: Good well run hotel, clean, attentive staff,superb food. Stayed 2 nights on a groupon offer and couldnt have been better.  Large room well kitted out.  Very friendy attentive staff, 2 weddings whilst we were there but didnt interfer with things. Hotel is quite close to the harbour and a small beach., excellent for touring the area eg the skerries, Ardgilian house etc.  Absolutely no qualms about recomending this as a nice spot particularly good value if you get it on a groupon offer.  Steak dinner was superb, mood lighting in the restaurant  a nice touch.  Breakfast full irish or good continential option.

title: Great
review: Was here for 1night at family wedding . service was  great from the moment we arrived. front of house very helpful and quick as there was many check ins. We had a family room which was great and plenty of room . The wedding breakfast was superb and service was very organised and the staff were fantastic when dealing with the children which was great.... Over all great day had by all.  Thanks guys keep up the good work

title: Attended Wedding in Bracken Court June 2012
review: Wedding and overnight stay were faultless. Room was extremely spacious and spotlessly clean. Staff were fantastic and could not help enough. The day was faultless. Function room was beautiful and well laid out.  Food was amazing. Alot of set menus for weddings leave something to be desired but all courses for this wedding were absolutly georgeous (main reason for review)  Would recommend.

title: Great value
review: 2 couples stayed June 2012 on a Groupon 2-night deal at an exceptionally good price with a certain amount of trepidation. We arrived on Sunday too early for check-in and were very worried to see a number of suspiciously hungover-looking guests lounging in reception. Turned out to be the remains of a couple of wedding parties from Friday/Saturday. We immediately feared there could be a lot of overnight noise or rowdyism but in fact there were absolutely no problems and the hotel was really quiet. As other reviewers found, the staff were helpful and friendly, but I did get a slight impression of disorganisation due perhaps to staff shortage, particularly at breakfast. This was typical hotel buffet a bit short of the high standard that we've come to expect in Irish hotels but still…

title: Fantastic
review: Went on a groupon deal not really knowing what to expect.  Arrived around 12.30 pm on Saturday and were able to check in right away. Reception staff were really nice and pleasant.  Room was bright and airy, the only downside was that our room was at the front and it was a bit noisy but there was not a lot could be done about that.  We had our meal on the first night and it was one of the best dining experiences ever.  I had the pork belly ribs and my husband had the seafood chowder to start, both were delicious.  We both opted for the sirloin steak (5 euro supplement) and it was well worth it, the steak was perfect as were the deserts.  Staff were wonderful, warm and friendly.  Will definitely go back for another visit.

title: Superb
review: From the minute you walkin the door the exceed ur expectations staff service cleanliness everything should be 5 star plus ************ will be back Grace & John

title: Excellent good value hotel
review: Just about to leave the Bracken Court after a short 2 night stay. The hotel was excellent value for money and we had a really lovely time there. We ate in the restaurant on the Friday night and the meal was second to none. I had the pork belly ribs to start with and my wife had te fish chowder both of which were excellent - really tasty. I then had chicken wrapped in Parma ham which was truly delicious. Rooms are spacious and the free wifi was fast. All in all a great place to stay!!

title: sunday checkin night mare..
review: went on a groupon deal . arrived at 3 oclock n was told room not ready was told 2wait 20 min,s and one hr lateri asked again n was told 10 more min,s got my keys at 4.15 went 2 room n it was wrong room twin rather than double had 2 go n get it changed so now this time i get room n then it stinks of smoke!!!! so just give up... rooms big n clean bathrooms nice with great shower food was class n very nice all staff very gd. only prob was carpet on stairs from rooms 2 recipiton was rotton dirty n staircase thick with dust n on tue am when we left it had never been cleaned!!! overall 7/10..

title: our stay at bracken court hotel
review: It is very easy in this day and age to criticise but we do not often take the time to say thank you which is what I am doing now whilst giving plaudit to the entyre staff at the hotel.On our arrival I was hartly greeted by a young lady called Sinaid,this young lady was so helpful on our arrival and during our entire stay.The hotel rooms were of a very high standard among the best I have stayed in around the world,warm,clean and very comfortable offering every need of the traveler. Now the food was of the higest standard and served by the most pleasent of staff making sure we were totaly satisfied at every meal.It is not always easy dealing with the public so would pass on to all the staff at Bracken Court my comments and sincere thanks for a job well done. I would recommend the…

title: Great staff
review: The staff at this hotel were second to none.  It was 4.00pm before we got checked in as they were extremely busy.  It didn't bother us as a couple and they stored our bags but I doubt such a late check in would suit a family.  The rooms were spacious, quiet and clean but the bed was way to firm for my liking.  Train and beach a short walk away. 40 min into Dublin on the train ( Connally station )  Very nice bar with live music on the two nights we satyed. Restaurant food very nice and again with excellent service.  The pork belly is delish and can also be got as a bar snack.   Would stay again no probs.

title: Our wedding Day
review: We recently had my wedding reception in the Bracken Court Hotel, Balbriggan and had such a wonderful experience.  The hotel is outstanding, the food was fabulous, hugh portions with extra helpings offered, served exceptionally hot.    We had dealings with Eddie, Jean, Patrick and Helga and they all were 5* professionals.  My guests have commented that the hotel was exceptional and would be returning for week-end stays, anniversarys etc. The kids had a great time as there was a laid back approach to children being a bit over excited, which was a hugh advantage.  If you want a fab wedding day or just a mini break, this is the place to go.  Thank you for a wonderful day to all the staff at the Bracken Court Hotel  Catherine & Christian Donovan, Donaghmede.

title: wedding
review: myself and my new husband have just celebrated our wedding reception with family and friends in the Bracken Court hotel and i have to say it was the best day of my life, the food was amazing, the staff were fantastic, thier was nothing that they wouldnt do. I would recommend the bracken court to any one who is thinking of getting married and looking for a nice friendly hotel to hold their reception.

title: Love this hotel!
review: Stay here quite a bit for commuting. Rooms are spacious and always clean, definitely has a small bit of old school charm about it, but still remains modern.  Food is nice and plentiful, staff are great, always ready to help. Great value for money too.

title: Nice Hotel with equally nice staff
review: My partner and I have just enjoyed a very pleasant stay at the Bracken Court Hotel. Right from the outset the young lady on reception was welcoming and this turned out to be a common theme throughout. All the staff were friendly and helpful. We ate in the restaurant on the first night and the food (and service) was excellent so we also dined the hotel bar on the second night. The room was spacious and clean with everything required. There were weddings at the hotel on both days so it meant that the one lift was busy at times however it was not enough to affect our overall satisfaction. The good points far outweighed any slight inconvenience. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Top nosh, for little dosh
review: We are just back from the Bracken Court and have to say we were very impressed. The reception area and bar area are very well presented. The room we were in (319) was spacious, plenty of storage space, tea and coffee, tv what more could you want apart from clean which indeed it was.  Towels, shower gel, soap, shampoo and body lotion supplied in bathroom.  On thursday night we were booked in for a meal in the restaurant and we were delighted with the menu. I had the carrot and ginger soup and my partner had the pork belly ribs (which he has raved about ever since). We both had steak for our main course and as a steak lover I have to say that this was the best steak I have ever tasted and well presented. We had dinner the second night in the bar and the platter for 2 is a must and…

title: Wonderful hotel just outside Dublin
review: Myself and my new Husband had our wedding reception here on 4th May and we couldn't of been happier with the service and professional manner of all the staff at The Bracken Court to ourselves and all our guests. Any time we've been to the hotel the food has been delicious and hotel rooms spotless, can't wait to go back.

title: very good hotel
review: stayed 3rd june for 2nts .lovely staff made our stay very enjoyable. lisa on reception was a delight to talk to very   pleasant . food was of very high standard,the hotel manager stood over every meal  that left for your table .i cant wait to return thanks to everyone for lovely time

title: Really great hotel
review: My husband and I stayed here during the June 2012 bank holiday. From the moment we arrived we were treated exceptionally well. Receptionist, at check in, was lovely. Very helpful. The room was quite spacious which was a nice surprise. Room and bathroom all very clean. We had dinner in the bar on our first night and it was really delicious. I had the seafood chowder and my husband had the burger. No complaints from either of us. Clean plates afterwards. Staff were really friendly and efficient. This makes a change from other hotels we have stayed in. So refreshing to see staff with smiles on their faces. The following morning we had to be up early. Breakfast is served from 7:30 but as we were earlier than that we were allowed into the restaurant to have cereal, tea, coffee and…

title: Top Class
review: My wife and I and two kids (9 and 1) just spent the weekend at this fabulous hotel. The room was spacious and spotless with excellent facilities. We were spoilt for choice with wifi access. The food and service in the restaurant was first class. The management have to be commended for the staff employed there. Went on a day trip to Ardgillan Castle, 10 mins away.  Dublin also easy access by train or Road.  Town also had a Summerfest on the weekend we stayed added bonus for the kids. Friendly staff, friendly people of the town. We were winners all round. We will be back.

title: thank you
review: my wife and i stayed in the bracken court for a couple of days , we were fortunate enough to get the honeymoon suite which was great!.. we have stayed in loads of hotels at home and abroad ,recently we went to the states and stayed in several hotels ..i am very fussy about the hotels i stay in and am hard to please but i can honestly say that we have never had better service anywhere in the world than we got the past couple of days especially in the resturant ,every detail was noticed but not invaisive ..thank you to everybody for your hospitality..

title: Staff courtesy is second to none
review: I just spent the weekend at this fabulous hotel. Right from the start we knew by the welcome from the receptionist that we were going to be in for a treat. The room was spacious and spotless with excellent facilities. We were spoilt for choice with wifi access. The food and service in the restaurant was first class. The management have to be commended for the staff employed there. The reception staff,restaurant staff and the housekeeping staff were extremely friendly and you felt they were genuinely friendly and courteous and not because they were supposed to. The icing on the cake was that we were able to experience Balbriggan Summerfest. Friendly staff, friendly people of the town. We were winners all round. We will be back.

title: little gem
review: i stayed in the braken court hotel last weekend and i have to  say iv never wrote a review before but i felt i had to this time,the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly,the room was lovely and quiet inspite of a wedding in the hotel,and the food was first class.id stay next weekend to! thanks for a great stay,   ANGELA

title: Faultless!
review: Stayed here with my boyfriend after receiving a very good deal on groupon.  The hotel is gorgeous, staff are so friendly (the best service I've ever received, especially from the reception staff and restaurant, although I wasn't in the bar but I'm sure they were great too!) and the food was gorgeous too.  Sandy beach right beside the hotel and the train very close by where you can go on a 40min trip down to Dublin.  Would definitely recommend it and would definitely return.

title: Very clean and family friendly
review: Arrived today and still here , very friendly reception , room very big , clean and spacious , am here on a 2 night deal from groupon which includes 2 nights accommodation breakfasts,  and 1 evening meal and bottle of wine.... Which was in the room to great us .... After a walk around the town we opted to eat in the bar , which we where half we did because the food was well prepared and tasted beautiful.... Currently sat in our room drinking said wine and putting or little one to bed ..... Would recommend this hotel to anyone

title: Great hotel well worth a stay !
review: Fab place rooms , hotel itself food and staff couldn recommend enough !

title: Brilliant
review: What a nice hotel! Docorted beautifully, every member of staff I have been in contact with have been so helpful and polite, breakfasts delish, dinner amazing, bar prices reasonable! 10/10!!

title: Not as Good as Exepected
review: My husband and I decided to have dinner at the Bracken Court Hotel’s new steakhouse and seafood restaurant this evening.  We live in Balbriggan and the restaurant has been made over around 4 times since we moved to the town.  The new eatery is described as providing “fresh and seasonal ingredients transformed by talented chefs”; almost impossible is this task as the restaurant was closed with no explanation why!  We were swiftly referred to Jack Doyle’s bar where we would be taken care of by way of a bar menu.  We opted to try this as the bar was nicely quiet and we didn’t want to drive anywhere further to eat.  The menu is plain but offered notable staples such as chicken wings, beef burgers, steak and a curry at very reasonable prices.  We were also made aware of two specials,…

title: Great Hotel
review: Was here for a wedding function a few weeks ago and was impressed with every aspect of the hotel ,Very welcoming reception team and great food ,The rooms are really nicely decorated and the buffet food we had was delicious ,Would reccomend this hotel

title: Wedding reception
review: My son and his Bride held their wedding reception here on the 11th May 2012. As well as the reception room, family members also occupied 10 rooms for the night. The whole package from our arrival at the Hotel until our departure the next day was superb. I could not find one fault. The Hotel staff and Management could not do enough for us. They were always on hand and were very pleasant and highly efficient. The food for the wedding was exceptional and not only were the portion sizes sufficient but they offered extra portions if anyone could manage them. The rooms were large, clean and well laid out and the beds were very comfortable. The reception staff were efficient with the checking in and when a problem arose (my brother had booked a family room but was allocated a twin…

title: Weekend Break 4th -6th May2012
review: Just returned from a wonderful weekend at the Bracken Court Hotel, Lisa on reception made us most welcome, as did all the staff and a special mention to Sabrina in the restaurant who gave us excellent service and great food. This is a lovely Hotel and we would definately recomend it and hope to make a return visit. Angeline & Roy

title: Irish hospitality at its best at Bracken Court-(Mgt and Ger, Cork)
review: Dear Angeline & Roy,   Thank you for your lovely review and for taking the time to tell us about your visit.  We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to welcoming you back again soon.  Kind Regards,   Nicola Cunningham Bracken Court Hotel

title: Great value, lovely staff!
review: We stayed here with a grabone offer, nights stay, bottle of wine on arrival and cooked breakfast for £55! A great deal, staff were so friendly, rooms were a really good size, in a lovely area! Hotel bar was great, with a good atmosphere and live music. Only complaint was with the food, very average, but good value! Would stay again!

title: Wedding Day
review: Dear Button6,   Thank you for your kind review of the Bracken Court Hotel.  We are delighted you enjoyed your visit and found it to be good value for money!  We hope you have an opportunity to visit us again in the future and look forward to welcoming you back again soon.  Kind Regards,   Nicola Cunningham Bracken Court Hotel

title: Wedding Day
review: Our wedding was a wonderful day thanks to the Bracken Court Hotel. Everything was perfect from arrival, the room layout, good food, pleasant and attentive staff and the accommodation.  Our guests were also pleasantly pleased with their accommodation.  The staff all worked hard together to make our day perfect and one to remember.  In fact my husband and I are returning for a weekend visit in June 2012 and we are very much looking forward to our stay.

title: Efficient and Friendly
