review: Dear Brenda N,   Congratulations to you and your new husband! And Thank You for choosing the Bracken Court Hotel as the venue for your special day.  We are thrilled that you and your husband found everything to be perfect and that your guests enjoyed their visit too.  We look forward to welcoming you back again in June.  Kind Regards,   Nicola Cunningham Bracken Court Hotel

title: Nice hotel
review: Attended wedding reception at the Bracken. From arrival to leaving the experience was very good. The staff attentive and friendly. The room was large clean and was overlooking the street, but unaffected by the noise.

title: Fantastic hotel
review: We were here over the weekend of the 23th till the 26th,for my nephews wedding,first thing you see is a wonderful bright clean hotel,the staff all weekend were fantastic and extremely helpful,the rooms will blow you away,there soo big and all the guests were commenting on this,the food was great and the function room was perfect for a wedding,we will most definitely come here again,it's a gem of a hotel,

title: Wedding
review: Dear Paddy 1966,   Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Bracken Court Hotel with us.  We are delighted you enjoyed your stay and found our rooms to be spacious and comfortable.  We are also thrilled that you and your family enjoyed the wedding.  We hope to have an opportunity to welcome you back to the Bracken Court Hotel again in the future.  Kind Regards,   Nicola Cunningham Bracken Court Hotel

title: Ireland Trips
review: Stayed here for 1 night for a wedding function. Both the food and the function room for the wedding was fabulous.The staff were great, very helpful and efficent. The bedroom was clean and spacious. I would highly recommend this hotel for weddings.

title: Very very pleasantly surprised
review: Dear Denise K,   Thank you for your kind review. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us and found your room to be clean and spacious. We are also thrilled that you enjoyed the Wedding and found the food and staff to be so good.  We look forward to welcoming you back to the Bracken Court Hotel again in the future.  Kind Regards,   Nicola Cunningham Bracken Court Hotel

title: Excellent Hotel, Amazing Staff
review: As my father is from the village every year we travel to Balbriggan from Wales. We stay a the hotel every year and it is by far the best. The rooms are very spacious and clean. The last 2 times we have gone we have had a suite at the same price of a normal room. The reception area is well built and is very modern. Its nice in the night to sit and have a drink their. There is a good restraunt offering excellent food. The average meal is about 10 euros. Drinks are a little expensive. The Lavender Restruant is on site and offers great evening meals as well. Breakfast was good and always enough to fill you up. The staff are very friendly and nothing is to much for them. Sometimes in the week they book muscians or acts to come in and entertain you. The only downside is that young…

title: Beautiful hotel, bad management!
review: Stayed here for one night recently. Hotel is beautiful, room lovely, spacious. clean, homely. Breakfast great. Staff in general polite and professional. My only gripe was with the manager! We stayed Sunday night, we arrived late evening and decided to wander up the street to get something to eat and have a look around. We arrived back at the hotel at 12.20am (Not outrageously late), to find the whole place locked up and we locked out! So, what to do? We rang the number on the sign above.....and rang...and rang....and rang..and knocked...and rang the doorbell...rang, knocked, rang...no reply! It was raining, we were freezing cold, tired and wet...we were outside 25 minutes and were losing hope, at this stage my partner was heading for the car and I was scurrying accross the road…

title: love this hotel
review: have stayed here 3 times and had a great time, staff are bril, love everything about this hotel, lounge, and restaurant are lovely. got great deal with groupon  and other sites.2 guyswere great singers that were on last time we were there/

title: Enjoyable stay
review: We stayed in this hotel on a Saturday night in mid February. 2 couples. All of us really had a fantastic time. Bar food is so reasonable and great quality that we'd go back just for the food. Entertainment in the bar at the weekends is great. Good buzz about the place.  Rooms were huge and hotel was lovely and warm. Will definitely go back.

title: Appearance may be deceiving - Not really 4 star
review: It seems this hotel has an outer appearance as 4star hotel - but the reality is that they are under-staffed. The breakfast is served in their restaurant - it has posh seats, kindda mixed up with what most resembles a canteen, where 1 guy is serving cook to order breakfast struggling to catch up - where you have the eggs cooked in front of you - but for instance the pudding, were cooked hours ago, and hard like rubber. Writing the above, there has still been no roomservice - as we are waiting for clean towels, when its now around 4pm,and we actually requested them hours ago from reception. I had to say appart from the above - the rooms are actualy very nice and quiet. But for a 4star hotel - it seems like service is not quite of that standard.

title: Great Hotel
review: Stayed here at the begining of February. The rooms are lovely and the staff are so welcoming, they cannot so enough for you.  We got a great deal on groupon for €49 for 2 B&B plus a bottle of wine. 2 course meal in restaurant €17.95 each or €21.95 for 3 course each.  Food lovely and there was a great singer in the baron that Saturday night.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: I stayed in this hotel with my husband and two children aged 6 & 2. We booked through the hotel's own website and chose their funtasia package. This was a 2 night stay, with dinner for us all on one evening and included an excellent ticket to the nearby Funtasia Waterpark. The price was fantastic and the hotel and its staff could not have been better.  We ate in the restaurant, the food was good and the kids were kept amused with colouring in pages and balloons. Our room was excellent, lovely and clean, it was really a suite which had a separate bedroom for the kids whilst still all being in the same room. There was also a sofa bed available and a fridge which would be handy if you needed to store milk etc for babies.  We enjoyed a buffet breakfast each morning which I couldn't…

title: Beautiful hotel & friendly staff
review: I stayed in this hotel with my husband & 3 children on 21st January.  All the staff are so pleasant and friendly, from reception to bar staff to staff in the restaurant.  We were given the largest family room which had a separate 2 bed room for the children.  The rooms are spacious, beautifully decorated and spotless clean with plenty of extra pillows, blankets etc.  We had eaten in the restaurant previously and the food was delicious but this time we had bar food which was equally as nice.  Great value too!  They also offer a huge selection of items for breakfast which would not disappoint anyone.  The kids were given pages and colours which are a god send to keep the kids quiet while trying to enjoy a meal.   I will definitely return to this hotel and would highly recommend to…

title: hidden gem
review: Just back from a brillaint stay in the bracken court,top quality ,the cleanliness of the rooms were a credit to your housekeeping staff.the entertainment in the bar was great,the food was delighfull and warn.the staff were more than helpfull,a real delight to stay in.well done,keep up the great work and thanks for a great weekend.

title: Good all rounder
review: Centrally located for the town, with free secure parking, ideal location for touring the coast as Skerries only 10 mins away and railway station within walking distance.  Very clean, well appointed large room, with good shower.  Warm welcome from Lisa and rest of staff were very pleasant throughout our stay.  Had a nice bar meal, which was more than adequate for what we paid, and cooked breakfast was waitress service, nicely cooked - good idea to be offered option of a small breakfast.  More than happy with the deal we had.

title: Not a 4 star but good value for the deal we got
review: In my opinion this is not a four star hotel, however we paid 89e for two nights bed and breakfast with a  bottle of wine on arrival which is good value in anyones book.  When we arrived at the hotel we went into the bar to get some food, they had a carvary on but we didnt fancy this so asked at the bar for the bar food menu. We were told that they were only doing carvary until 3pm and the bar food would start then, we waited around for about 45 mins and went back to the bar at about 3.15pm and asked about the bar food, a different barman was now on and said they would not be starting bar food until 4pm, when we complained and said we were told 3pm he said he could probably try get someone to make us a sandwhich, he didnt offer us a menu of say what kind of sanwhiches they had…

title: Great prices, location
review: Centrally located, free underground parking excellent.  Rooms are fairly standard, some wear and tear, but very comfortable. Super fast, free wifi, all over hotel, no crappy log ins or passwords required.  Restaurant wasn't open, had bar food, lovely steak. Service was excellent and friendly in the bar.  Highly recommended.

title: Four star?
review: Positives: Hotel was clean, free car parking, bed was comfy. Negatives: Meal was very average cant describe it as nice, breakfast extremely poor- slow staff and short in numbers. Rooms were very out of date - i cant see how this is 4 star - more like average 3.  Hairdryer was old school like you get in basic hotels abroad. Decor - old fashioned. This was part of a groupon offer - good deal served the purpose as we didnt spend any time in hotel bar sleeping.  If you want luxury look elsewhere. Location: handy for dublin by train near train station

title: Excellent hotel
review: We have just returned from a very enjoyable weekend break, a Grabone deal, excellent hotel and great deal from Grabone. The hotel was top class, beautiful spacious room with all facilities anyone would need. The staff were very courteous and nothing was a problem to them, the bar staff especially Thomas were very pleasant serving good food and drink. A great place to stay if you want to visit Dublin as the train station is only a five minute walk away . Will definitely be returning to this excellent hotel.Free car parking a great bonus.

title: Alot of room for your money
review: Dear Retiredteacher825,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us.  We are delighted that you enjoyed yourself during your visit and found our staff to be helpful and pleasant.    Hopefully, we will have an opportunity to welcome you back in the near future.   Kind Regards,   Nicola Cunningham Front Office Manager

title: Clean and comfortable
review: Stayed here with a groupon deal one night for 2 B&B with a bottle of wine! Hotel reception is small but pleasant and staff welcoming and friendly. We were given a twin room on the 3rd floor, the room itself was like a suite with tea & coffee facilities, a flat screen tv, a sofa, two armchairs and coffee table, bathroom was also pretty big with bath and seperate shower with two hand basins. Hotel bar is big but with a cosy feel. Breakfast was fab choice of cereals, fruits, juices and bread followed by a choice a mini or full hot breaksfast served with toast and tea/coffee. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, although the town itself isn't great the hotel makes up for it!! If I was to mention a downfall it would b that there is no direct entrace to the capark…

title: Friendly and helpful staff, nice rooms.
review: Stayed for 3 nights at the end of October on a great value deal including dinner one night. Its been a long time since I have even been to Balbriggan! but have to say I really enjoyed my stay. The hotel is well located with UNDERGROUND CAR PARKING which we missed on are frist pass. The hotel will stamp the card so you can come and go as you please. The hotel itself is fine, the staff our Excellent, really friendly and went out of their way to help me anytime I required assistance. The WIFI wasn't working in the rooms but was in the lobby so no problems there. The bar was lively and comfortable, though there is a some live trad music across the road. The restaurant was fine, we had an evening meal included in our package and the food was nice. OH word of advice to adjust the…

title: Rooms OK and the staff are helpful
review: Dear Neverafree,   Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us.  We are delighted that you enjoyed your time in Balbriggan and enjoyed your visit to the Bracken Court Hotel.     Thank you also for your kind comments regarding our staff, it's always lovely to hear that you were well looked after.  Regarding the Wifi, you should have had access from your room so thank you for letting us know that this was not the case.  I will ensure that this is repaired as soon as possible.   We hope to have an opportunity to welcome you back in the future,   Kind Regards,   Nicola Cunningham Front Office Manager

title: Wedding venue
review: I stayed in this hotel for two nights the room was a little small but comfortable. I had a meal in the hotel restaurant and the food was fine. I ordered room service breakfast one morning and found this to be good. The staff were helpful and friendly. If you have a car you need to park in a pay and display car park which is across the busy road in front of the hotel, you get a notice from the hotel reception to place on your dashboard to indicate that you are staying in the hotel. The car park appears a bit dodgy and I was concerned that my car could be damaged during the night but it was fine.

title: The Broken Bracken
review: Dear Paulsreview,   Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us.  We are delighted that you enjoyed your visit and found your room to be comfortable.   We are also glad that you found our staff to be good and also that you enjoyed your breakfast.  Regarding the Car-parking, there is actually an underground Car Park attached to the hotel that is very secure and monitored by CCTV.  This service is complimentary to all guests of the hotel.  Should you ever be visiting the Bracken Court in the future, please let us know in advance so we can direct you to this car-parking facility.   Hopefully we will have an opportunity to welcome you back to Balbriggan in the future.  Kind Regards,   Nicola Cunningham Front Office Manager

title: lovely hotel
review: Nice hotel, nice bar, nice comapny but the food could hae come out faster we where waiting an hour after thebride and groom

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Had a lovely stay at the hotel. Room was spotless, Food was lovely, had dinner and breakfast. Bar has music on at the weekends,  Staff seemed lovely, always happy to help..   Would stay again.

title: Perfect
review: Stayed here last March for a wedding....free parking provided....center of town.....fabulous room....great staff....what more can I say

title: Wish I could have stayed longer
review: I stayed in the Bracken Court hotel while attending my friends wedding. Staff were some of the best I have seen nothing was too much for them. Check in was a breeze. The room was outstanding, we were given an apartment with two large bedrooms, kitchen, sitting room, shower room and bathroom. It was just a pity I was only staying one night as I would have stayed longer. Dinner the day of the wedding was fab there was plenty of clean plates when everyone had finished. We had breakfast the next morning and again it was fab. The only fault that I have about the hotel is the lift, it seemed to take forever to get too each floor, it was so slow and made strange noises which sounded like it was on its was out. Apart for that I have no other complaints. Keep up the good work all at the…

title: Very nice hotel, great restaurant
review: We stayed here as part of a Groupon deal. Sometimes I find we get slightly poorer service when that's the case, but not here. Fabulous staff (particularly the waiting staff) and I really recommend the steak and chips in the restaurant! Great choice if you have call to stay in Balbriggan.

title: Superb quality for the price
review: The room we were given was probably the largest of any of the hotels in which we've stayed and was very well furnished - large wardrobe, dressing table, easy chairs, coffee table, sofa, and comfortable beds, all of good quality. Really stunning value for the price we paid.  Check-in and out were efficient, pleasant and friendly.  We both commented on how tasty our cooked breakfasts were, and how fresh the food seemed to be - none of the breakfast items had been left lying on the service counter for any length of time as we've seen in some other hotel restaurants. The Bracken Court's breakfast is certainly one of the better ones we've enjoyed.  We did have one problem during our stay though - loud noise from a function that was held in the hotel. The noise stopped at 2am. I've…

title: Lovely hotel/ lovely staff
review: Stayed in the Bracken Court on a special deal. From the moment we entered the hotel we were made to feel welcome. The bedroom was lovely although the bathroom was a bit cramped. As we stayed on a sunday night the restaurant was not open and we ate in the bar. The menu was the restaurant menu and the food was very well served and delicious. Again the bar staff were very friendly. The breakfast the next morning was comprised of buffet for juices, cereals and fruit and freshly cooked hot food. We both ordered bacon and poached eggs. Here I really have to compliament the chef as the poached eggs were superb and  the best that i have had in any hotel I have stayed in. All in all we had a lovely stay and would definitely recommend this hotel. There are many other hotels around the…

title: Superb Hotel for Family break
review: Stayed here for a family break with 2 kids under 5. We stayed in a family room with separate bedrooms - very comfortable and clean. Staff were very helpful. Bar food was very good and very reasonably priced. Free car parking & Wi-Fi also. I would highly recommend this hotel for a family stay.

title: Great hotel
review: Stayed here for a few nights back in May, got a free upgrade to suite. staff so friendly and helpful. Food was fantastic and great atomosphere in bar. Heading back this weekend and cant wait.

title: Satisfied and comfortable....
review: Really enjoyed our stay in this hotel but if you stay on the top floor the room is quite warm. Because of the heat we opened the window. This was ok until around dawn when the seagulls created a racket, they were very noisy and made it difficult to sleep. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was very nice.

title: We cannot praise this hotel enough
review: My wife ,daughter & myself booked 3 nights for my daughters fifth birthday. On arrival we found the reception staff very friendly and efficient.we were given a room on the second floor and got settled in however we didn't sleep too well as this room is a smoking room which we were not aware of when booking. The next morning my wife explained this to the girl on reception and she told us to go out and enjoy our day and that she wuold sort something out. When we came back she gave us our new room key and when we opened the door we could not believe it. It was a luxury suite and the staff had it decorated with sweets and balloons for our daughter. We will never forget the experience of this hotel and every aspect of it was outstanding from the staff to the food. Thank you so much

title: exellent hotel
review: we have stayed in the bracken court at least six different occasions last one in early august 2011 and we guage other hotels on the bracken court standards and none have come close to the standards and quality not to mention value for money we will definitely stay there again and thank you again to all the staff especially lisa who i usually book with.

title: 'Satisfied'
review: This hotel is definitely a 'gem'.  Lovely rooms, as requested ours was quiet, overlooking courtyard, comfy beds and nice large bathrooms. Receptionist was most welcoming and very very efficient.   We enjoyed our evening meal in bar, lots of help and attention from the staff.  Food very nice (although my curry was a little 'oily' think maybe from the mushroom fried to accompany it) but enjoyed just the same.  prices very reasonable. would definitely stay again and recommend for North Co Dublin, great place to stay, large car park next door and no charge for hotel guests as Hotel validates your ticket, nice gesture and much appreciated I am sure by all guests.  Well done Bracken court.! A & G Ireland

title: We will return!
review: We just spent three days in this hotel. I cannot praise them high enough. Our youngest was sick (too much junk food ) on the second night and they couldn't have been more sympathetic and helpful. Room was spacious, especially for a family, clean and well presented with good quality furniture and fittings. We most definitely will return! P.S. wtr other comments about the public bar, you're in a working fishing village, those people are the mainstay of that hotel during the winter months. They're rough'n'ready granted. But if you want to be immersed in Irish Culture listen up! If you want a sterilised chain hotel experience, go somewhere else at a lower star rating. The Bracken is on our list of favourites, and the recommendation for the 'Thai Gourmet' was spot on! Thank you…

title: Wonderful hotel, free secure car park, very friendly staff
review: Stayed at the Bracken Court for 2 nights.  I was upgraded to a 300euro room and paid only 50.  I booked via Booking.com.  The room was fabulous, huge, comfortable bed, huge, spotlessly clean modern bathroom with a bath as well as a shower.  The staff were friendly and welcoming.  The attached pub had an excellent singer in on the Friday night and I felt very comfortable asking a local couple if I could join their table.  They were very friendly.  Having read the reviews about the "dodgy" local clientelle I can assure anyone that no-one looked remotely dodgy when I was there and I am a single woman travelling on my own.  I sat in the bar both nights and ordered dinner and felt extremely comfortable.  I have travelled frequently and extensively throughout Europe and the Uk over…

title: Really enjoyed an overnight break away at this hotel
review: Booked a last-minute (less than 24 hours in advance) overnight getaway as a result of internet advertising. What a good choice it was - this is a bright, airy hotel, right in the heart of Balbriggan.  The full length of the village is decorated with hanging baskets right now and it looks great. We got a very pleasant, spacious double room right at the front of the hotel, with a wrought iron balcony that was absolutely dripping with flowers. We could almost have been on the continent with the sunshine and the scent of flowers that was wafting in the window.  There was a decent sized bathroom, complete with hairdryer and there was a second hairdryer in the dresser drawer in the bedrdoom. The deal was €79 B&B for two people - extremely good value for a Friday night, when hotels…

title: Unmitigated Disaster
review: We stayed here on the " Wine & Dine Deal" for one night! The price was appealing at 69 euro each! Our room was adequate - small, clean and very old fashioned. There was only one bed side lamp and it did not work. Lack of large towels in bathroom also. The bed was uncomfortable and the walls very thin, we could hear the people next door very clearly.   Our deal included a meal for two.  Upon entering the restaurant we were pleasantly surprised. The surroundings are elegant and stylish and the staff were both friendly and helpful. After reading the menu I was excited to taste the food! However to say we were disappointed is an understatement. To start we had a vegetable soup that was bland and I believe must have been burnt to the pot! We also had a Moroccan style chicken dish…

title: average
review: We got this hotel at a great rate of €69 with breakfast and a 4 course meal each so vlaue was great!  However we were waiting a while for someone to take our order and for the food to be taken to table. So that annoyed us a bit!  The room was clean, big enough but the boyfriend thought the decor was a bit " old fashioned" as there was a lot of wooden items in room, eg, chairs, desks, bedside lockers, wardobes. We were going to the bar after dinner to listen to the live band and have few drinks however we soon changed our minds when we saw the clintele or the locals should I say.  They were dressed in tracksuit bottoms with socks over them, baseball caps etc not very clean or decent looking so it was quite off putting to say the least so we retired to our room to watch tv! For a…

title: Nice Hotel
review: Stayed over on Saturday night on a boards deals voucher.  Only thing I was annoyed about was the room smelled of cigarettes when we arrived.  Rest of the hotel was great, staff very helpful and friendly.  Hotel was very clean and for the price we paid id recommend it.  Just ask for a non smoking room.

title: Awlful service
review: Went here for bar food recently however we were shocked at the lack of staff working. One person was working and his duties included pulling pints, taking orders, serving food and clearing up. No dedicated waiter staff working. It took ages for us to draw the attention of the sole staff member working. Bar food menu is very average. We ended up leaving this place as it took so long to order our food. The place wasn't even that busy to be honest. Won't go back.

title: Only ok
review: Booked this on a Bed deal so got it for a very good price which makes me hesitant to say anything negative.....but only fair to be honest. Arrived at about 6 pm so well after check in time, receptionist was lovely but extremely busy. Got checked in, went to our room to find it hadn't been made up since the last guests had left. Back to reception, given a bigger room but unfortunatley there was a really strong smell of smoke in the room so we decided to wait for a clean room. Once that was sorted everything was great. The restaurant food and service were of a high standard. There was a great spread at breakfast,even though we were quite late arriving for it.Not sure I'd return after the room mix up but wouldn't rule it out completely.

title: Well Worth the Money
review: Great hospitality, and worth the money to stay here!  Situated just outsided Dublin on the R132 going towards Belfast.  Front reception was rather helpful, and couldn't do more for you.  Provided great service, both within the hotel, and within the Tourist area.   Rooms were clean, and beds were so comfortable.  I felt like I was sleeping on a cushion.    Cheaper to stay during the week, and if you don't take the breakfast.

title: Lovely rooms shame about the food service
review: a 75 minute delay in supplying bar food is not acceptable in today's market.. The staff on the ground wre rushed off their feet but management is either unable or unwilling to provide an acceptable staffing level.

title: Hmmm... I don't know!
review: Mix feeling for me. The first receptionist was borderline rude. She won't even look at our face.  I think her face may crack if she smile! We went out for lunch and came back, as new receptionist was on duty and she  was so friendly and lovely. It immediately put us a more positive spin. The room was nice, big and clean. My hubby pre-ordered chocholate to be delivered to the room. In the afternoon, we got a couple of knocks on the door and 4 pieces of choc delivered on a saucer. We paid for a box of choc! Anyway, breakfast was ok, dinner was ok. We did use the lobby to lounge which is lovely. There was live music in the bar until about 1 am in the morning. The town was run-down and nothing really to do... so we drove to the next town in Skerries...it's quite romantic setting on…

title: Nice hotel but
review: Stayed for one nite and reception was very busy and the receptionist was run off her feet ,room was big and clean but tv was very small and a good distance from bed ,had a meal in restaurant and it was very dissapointing,bland and tasteless,i,d stay in hotel again but wouldn,t go near restaurant again

title: Wonderful choice for a first night in Ireland
review: We picked the Bracken Court Hotel based upon its location to Dublin and its Internet photo. We had flown all night and didn't want to go too far for the first day. We found it easily and check in was quick and no trouble. Our room was at the end of a hallway and we had to pull our suitcases up two small flights of stairs, but the room was wounderful. It overlooked the town square and we woke up the next morning to sunny skies and the sounds of a market being set up. After breakfast we stopped by and picked up homemade jam and scones and set off on a two week trip around Ireland. It was the best way to start a terrific holiday.

title: Lovely hotel for getaway
review: Stayed here for 1 night on a groupon type deal, really enjoyed the hotel, & food. would stay again if suited.

title: Customer Service that other hotels could use as a bench mark
review: We could not fault this hotel, the staff from the receptionist to the manager were genuinely warm and friendly. We stayed in both a room and a suite on our both visits. The restaurant food was devine and the bar food was excellent value for money, and very tasty. The cocktails weren't too bad either!!  On our first visit we were with a group and everyone enjoyed the atmosphere and food, then we decided to stay another night as it is only 20 minutes from the airport in which we found the hotel as enjoyable as our first visit.  whether its a weekend break or a night away the hotel is idealy situated for a walk on the beach or a spot of shopping!!!

title: Great value, no complaints
review: I booked the Bracken Court Hotel as part of a special offer deal. We stayed for 1 night bed, breakfast and dinner. The room was large and comfortable and the bathroom was fab!  We had a 4 course dinner which we chose from the set menu. Great choice, lovely atmosphere in the restaurant, staff were polite and efficient and most importantly the food was just gorgeous. We had a couple of drinks in the bar, nice atmosphere, good staff. I'm not sure if there was a function on the night we stayed or there is a nightclub nearby but there was some music playing but we could only very slightly hear it. Breakfast was lovely the next morning. Great selection and plenty of everything.  Overall, no complaints from us!

title: Great Hotel and Amazing Food
review: Stayed in the Bracken Court Hotel and upgraded to a penthouse suite with jacuzzi which was fantastic! The room was really well decorated, very spacious and the bed was so comfy! I couldn't fault any aspect of our stay. The staff were pleasant, the location was great - just a 2 minute walk to the beach, and the Laveer restaurant had the best food I've ever tasted! I already want to go back for the food alone! It had free WiFi too which was great. I'll definitely be back!

title: Nice weekend night away , thought room would of been more luxiourous as promised.
review: Had a nice night away in hotel as a treat for mothers day. Enjoyed meal and music in the bar after. thought room would of been a bit more special ! Meal was basic nothing special .

title: Wonderful place and people
review: We stayed for a week over St Patrick's day. This was our first time in Ireland. We couldn't have choosen a better hotel even for more money. The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms were modern and had a bath and shower. About 30 min from city centre with free parking. there is a train station a block away. The food at the hotel was wonderful.Would stay there again!!!! Thank you guys for making our vacation the best it could be.

title: excellent hotel especially the staff
review: I have recently stayed at this wonderful hotel in Balbriggan.  It was just perfect.  It was easy to find. The Receptionists were so helpful and friendly.  Thomas in bar was very professional and friendly.  The food was very tasty indeed.  The room was cosy and the bed was so comfortable. Only thing I didnt like was that the bedroom  got very warm in night.   Free secure car park at side of hotel. Nice  Beach nearby. Our stay was very relaxing and chilled out.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Very nice hotel & staff
review: stayed on Saturday night... we kept looking at other people, are they Boardsies?   nice welcome from the receptionists had a pint & a gorgeous curry for €10 (offer when matches are played) Very nice 4 course meal Room was very spacious & clean - very comfortable bed Were given tickets to the live band, free gratis Late Breakfast until 11am, freshly prepared - very nice Late checkout Free carparking  Village itself is not very nice, but if you want a quiet getaway.

title: Lovely Hotel with friendly staff
review: My boyfriend and I stayed here Friday to Monday, having got a great deal through Thomas Cook, and as we both work in Hotels, we know what to expect with regard to cleanliness and service. But we couldn't fault either.  The staff couldn't be more helpful, Lisa on Reception asked for our room to be cleaned earlier as we arrived very early, and was very helpful with us asking directions to the train station and buses etc. and Thomas in the bar kept our drinks flowing nicely.  The bedroom and bathroom were huge and we were only in a Standard room, the shower was amazing and the bed was so comfortable!!! The Hotel had a function on in the evening while we were there as well as live music in the bar and we didn't hear a thing from our room!  The food was lovely, I just wish we were…

title: Great Hotel & Staff
review: Stayed here on 5th March with my husband and another couple of friends on a special offer from boardsdeals.ie. The hotel was very clean and nicely decorated, rooms were very big clean and well maintained. The bed was also very comfortable. The staff were really helpful and the food in the restaurant for dinner was really good, breakfast was lovely too. It was nice that the friendly locals also used the bar, I would certainly recommend it.

title: A pleasant stop
review: Stayed at Bracken Court for a short mid week break. Very clean,  good sized room and very helpful staff. It was also good to find that the locals used the hotel bar and they were a great help in advising where to go and what to see. It was nice to be able to stay so close to Dublin but to enjoy the small town atmosphere of this delightful  small coastal town. One minor criticism was that we had to take our dinner in the bar, maybe the restaurant does not operate during mid week winter periods. Eating in the bar did take a little away from the occasion, that said the food was fine if not gourmet quality. While in the area take a drive to Howth, try the harbour restaurants and also feed the seals that congregate near the fish shops, a real treat on all fronts.

title: Great Deal
review: Stayed here as part of the pigsback voucher promotions. We upgraded to a suite for €30pp extra & it was worth it. The room was wonderful. So quite never heard a sound. It was so comfortabe too & huge. The bathroom was massive. We had dinner in the restaurant that night, it was lovely. Didn't have to check out till 2pm the following morning which was lovely. Had breakfast delivered to the room that was lovely too. Would definately recommend this hotel & will be back too.

title: Amazing,Beautiful,Friendly.10/10
review: We stayed here in May '10 as we chose this hotel to host Our Wedding.The manager John was a great help along with all the staff involved. Beautifully newly decorated - fab function rooms,great food & bedrooms beautiful.2 honeymoon suites to choose from,both beautiful.    All of our guests complimented us for choosing this hotel & they all loved their rooms. Free car park for residents. Website doesn't do hotel many favour's as alot of the photo's used are still the old decor(refurbished after a fire in 2008) & new decor very up to date,elegant & modern.

title: Just Right...
review: This hotel is one of the best hotels I have stayed in in some time. Everything was great and it was exactly what we were looking for, somewhere to relax and enjoy food and a few drinks and a break away from everything else. The reception team were fantastic and looked after us throughout our stay and all the staff were friendly and couldnt do more, they made our stay truely enjoyable. We ate in the bar and it was great, some good music in the background and the food was Just Right... I loved the hotel and will most definately be back again.

title: Great Hotel just outside of Dublin
review: We were having trouble finding rooms and Dublin and a waitress recommended the Bracken Court Hotel.   We were very pleased with the room.   It has that old European flair.   The nice thing is the station for the train into Dublin was just down the street.    It was a about $8 euro for a round trip and was well worth not having to drive in Dublin.   The town of Balibraggin is small and there is very little to do there but hotel was great and the breakfast was good.   Would definetly recomend.

title: Great hotel, great deal, lovely spot
review: We arrived into Dublin airport without a place to stay and decided that we didn't want to go into the city.  Using the accommodation service at the airport we found a good deal (aprox. 60 euros for a twin room) at the Bracken Court Hotel and decided to give it a try.  It was a short bus trip from outside the airport and the driver couldn't have been more helpful in getting us there.  The hotel is surprisingly big and sophisticated-looking for the small coastal town that it is in - our room and bathroom were huge and very quiet, clean and comfortable.  The front desk staff  (Lisa, in particular) were extremely helpful in recommending places to eat, visit, etc.  The town itself has a beach, a couple of cafes and pubs and we went on a beautiful walk along the coast (wear decent…

title: Excellent
review: This hotel was Brilliant. We stayed here because family who live in Balbriggan recommended it. It also has a good bar and a restaurant that is used often by locals as well as guests.  We stayed here at the beginning of our trip and the last night of our trip because it has easy access to Dublin Airport, which is handy if you have hired a car. I have read another review that the toilets were dirty but that problem must of been sorted, overall it was a spotless hotel. Hotel has good parking. They didn't even tell us they had upgraded us to a massive room at the back of the hotel because of roadworks at the front, which they had not even started yet, I went to reception because I thought they had made a mistake!! They started the roadworks in the morning and we didn't hear a thing.

title: Awful
review: Stayed one weekend but couldn't wait to leave-tiny crowded reception, rude and intimidating security staff and a bar full of rowdy locals. The bedroom and bathroom were dirty, noise from hotel bar and outside was unbelievable and food was luke warm and substandard. Expensive and unpleasant hotel in a poor location.

title: Lovely Hotel & Staff - Toilets need maintaining very dirty
review: I recently stayed at Bracken Court found it very pleasing nice staf fab rooms but what let it down was the toilets adjacent the bar do not apper to be maintained are were very grubby  Its a pity that something so small would let the place down so maybe if anyone is reading this you mite tend a cleaber thatw ay a little more often especially when Bar is busy

title: A gem of a hotel
review: Arriving from Dublin Port at 1 am is not the best start to a weekend, especially when one has to attend a funeral the next day.  The gentleman who greeted us in reception was absolutely charming and could not do enough for us.  Our room was huge, beautifully clean, the bathroom enormous and spotless. The bed was so comfortable that we awoke refreshed the next morning and were able to do justice to the delicious Irish breakfast on offer. Sadly, we did not sample the restaurant for any other meals, but suffice it to say that this was an exceptional hotel in every way and extremely good value. The weather was sunny and warm and we felt as if we had been on a very relaxing holiday.  A meal at the Stoop Your Head in Skerries completed a satisfying weekend.

title: Wonderful
review: What a gem. We stayed for one night while visiting family. had a huge room with everything you could need. A fantastic bathroom and even iron and ironing board. the breakfast was exceptional with a huge irish breakfast. my only disappointment was that we couldn,t stay longer.

title: Great Hotel, let down by Location!
review: Bracken Court Hotel is lovely. The rooms were clean and well looked-after. The service was excellent, the staff were attentive and helpful. There are great features in the hotel such as Wi-Fi and a Hotel Bar and Restaurant. Unfortunatley, the Hotel was let down by the town in which it is situated. The town of Balbriggan is a little bit rough with very little to do. However, there is a a train station in the town providing a good service into Dublin.

title: Enjoyable stay
review: Our stay here was a gift from friends and it also included a complimentary two-course dinner and breakfast, so I can't really comment on the prices.   We stayed in a lovely double room which was very spacious and had an amazing shower, as well as all the usual mod cons. The food served in both the bar and restaurant was tasty, and the staff in both were really friendly and helpful. As there was a big rugby game on they opened up one of the banquet rooms to show it on the big screen. Complimentary hot snacks were also provided at half time which soaked up the cider nicely!  Balbriggan itself is a sleepy coastal town and there didn't seem to be much to do there. We did have a little explore and went down to the beach but it was fairly desolate. To be fair we did only stay one…

title: Very Friendly
review: The staff at the hotel were increadably kind and accommodating, they even gave me a charger for my laptop when my own failed to work. The wireless at the hotel was surprisingly fast and there is no hassle with passwords to log on.The people seemed to really love their jobs and the hotel.

title: Friendly Hotel in Balbriggan
review: I spent a relaxing holiday at the Bracken Court Hotel last May.    My room was very large and comfortable.  Had the Full Irish Breakfast, it  set me up for the day.  Several times I'd a filling Carvery lunch for a reasonable price.  I enjoyed a drink in the bar and had the most delicious burger and potato wedges.  I walked along the beach and enjoyed the views.  I went to the fantastic cinema in the town to see  Divinci Code and Night at the Musuem 2.  I had a delicious spaghetti dinner at an Italian restaurant tucked away at the top of the hill called Castellina Chianti.  Balbriggan's nearby to take day trips to Ardgillian Castle, Malahide Castle, Slane Castle and Newgrange.  The historic town of Drogheda is a bus ride away. It has a beautiful large shopping centre there. It;s…

title: Friendly
review: Good hotel. Very friendly & helpful staff, particularly on the front desk. Parking in the adjacent garage, which also seems to be shared with the town council, so may be full during weekdays. Good location in the middle of the town. 20 mins to airport, another 15 to Dublin City centre.

title: never again
review: Arrived at the hotel at approximately 4.30pm. We arrived in the middle of a wedding function. Reception too small and we had to force our way in with our bags. Reception very friendly but thats were it ends. Room was lonice but on further inspection it housekeeping standards were not upto standard. Headboard dusty, shelf inside wardrobe dusty and toilet bowl not cleaned properly. Guest handbook filthy as though it was never cleaned. Pulled back sheets just to check.   Went into bar which was like a cattle market, a lot of loud and drunk patrons and at 5.30pm. Ordered a drink and tried to find a seat. After 1hr we the witnessed a brawl which gave us our cue to leave. We went back to our room and decided whether or not we would leave.   We decided to stay but went elsewere for our…

title: Great Hotel
review: Fabulous hotel with friendly staff, great food and amazing rooms.  We travelled with a 4 year old and 14 month old.  Staff were very accomodating and family room was huge.  Lots of space to run round in.  Balbriggan itself was a little disappointing, but enjoyed our stay none the less.

title: Friendly town, pity about the euro!
review: Stayed at the Bracken Court Sept.13 2008. Visited with three friends to watch the Killalane Motorbike Races.  The hotel was just in the throes of re-opening following refurbishment (I believe it was said that there had been a fire?)  Naively we all thought that the prices would be similar to Belfast where we had visited only six months earlier - we may as well have been on a different continent!   We had wandered around town looking at menus in other establishments and soon realised things were not going to be cheap - We opted to eat a bar-snack at the hotel in the evening - this was actually quite good value and the food was fabulous.  Breakfast was taken in the restaurant and was serve-yourself (ideal for four strapping lads!)  The rooms were large and very clean with period…

title: Valentines weekend
review: Stayed here with my fiance during Valentine's weekend.  The hotel is beautifully decorated with exceptionally friendly check-in staff.  The room was massive, very clean and had a beautiful bathroom.  The only drawback was we had booked a meal in the main restaurant but on the evening of the meal were then sent to the bar to eat our meal.  Breakfast service is a little slow as very short staffed in restaurant it appeared.

title: Comfortable and friendly hotel
review: We have just returned from a weekend in Ireland to watch the Skerries road racing and stayed for  2 nights at the Bracken Court and thoroughly enjoyed our time there.We got a great deal on the hotel website(125 euros for the 2 nights). The room was very clean,well furnished and comfortable with one of the most powerful showers we've ever used. Breakfast buffet was varied and plentiful and the staff in all areas of the house were courteous,very friendly and efficient.There is secure free parking with useful pillars to chain any motor bike to. Balbriggan High Street may not be glamorous but it is a working port and is ideally located to explore the surrounding areas and yes we would return to this hotel.

title: Great Hotel - Very Deceptive - Great Rooms
review: WOW - I can't believe that this hotel is in Balbriggan, was visiting a relative nearby, stayed in the Bracken Suite, firstly I couldn't find my room and was beginning to think that reception had played a trick on me sending me to look for a room number that didn't exist, boy was I wrong.  There were two double doors opening into a fantastic suite with fireplace, dressing room, huge bathroom, sitting area, minibar and coffee etc. A four poster bed dominated the room , the furniture was very chic and overall I was gobsmacked that I hadn't heard of such a great hotel before.  There was a wedding show on and it looked great location for a wedding.  As a Dubliner I was very impressed, by it's value and services.  Couldn't recommend it highly enough.  It was a great stay and a fab…

title: Great hotel - excellent bargain
review: Having read the last two reviews the night before our trip to Balbriggan, I was terrified of what our stay would be like at the Bracken Court.  To be honest, we all must be talking about a different hotel because our experience was wonderful.  First up, the hotel is in Balbriggan - so do your homework about the location before you book it.  The hotel itself is really nice, exactly like the photos on trip advisor.  Bedroom was spacious and bright ,and the bathroom immaculate.  Our only complaint was that we couldn't connect to the free wi-fi for some reason (but that wasn't the hotels fault.)  A free car park is right under the hotel, so its fairly secure.  Breakfast was included, and consisted of a very good hot buffet.  The service was also excellent, and we found the reception…

title: Beware.
review: Variously described as 'A hidden gem in the fishing village of Balbriggan' and 'in the vibrant fishing village of Balbriggan', this hotel is in the centre of a medium sized town with a population of more than 15,000. A five minute walk does take you to the old harbour - filled with rotting hulks and piles of supermarket trolleys. The rest of the town is truly awful. the official tourist guide can only find a tiny stone bridge in the town and the medical centre to comment on, so draw your own conclusions. To describe itself as such is a serious mis-reprepresentation, which in the UK would undoubtedly be dealt with as a breach of Trading Standards. On the plus side, the staff are very helpful, the rooms are large and the overall quality is good. There is no air-conditioning, which…

title: Not worth of it 4 *
review: I booked our room through a hotels webpage. All would've been OK, but the last night of our stay(we stayed there 4 nights) the hotel organized a local party. All night we couldnt get asleep because of all the drunked people standing outside our window( we had the window into the courtyard where people were smoking and chating way too loud).  I`m not a difficult person to deal with and i can tolerate a lot but i was shocked by ignorance from the staff, giving damn in other guests staying in their hotel.We complained twice that night and again when checking out in the morning. The reseptionist promissed to contact us ,but we havent hear anything since we have left the hotel building. Also no respond from the menager after sending an email few weeks ago. A poor guest service to be…

title: Very nice accommodations and great, friendly, helpful staff.
review: After flying into Dublin from Chicago, we stayed at the Bracken Court for two nights and planned to stay there a third night, two weeks later, before flying home. The room was very clean, quiet and comfortable, and included a great Irish breakfast. The staff went out of their way to be of service. And they were very understanding when we had to cancel a reservation due to a death in the family.

title: A 3* hotel that is actually pretty nice
review: We stayed as a family of 5 at the Bracken Court Hotel in Balbriggan for a family wedding.  We had a really nice time, the hotel did a fine job with the wedding and the meal.  The food was very good.  We stayed in a family room and it was huge - 1 double bed, 2  single beds and a pull-out sofa bed that could accomodate another 2 individuals.  The bathroom was quite large as well with good shower pressure.  Furniture was a bit outdated, as well as the tube TV, but the room was quite clean.  Beds were decently comfortable.  Breakfast was included with the rate of our room (119 euros, a special rate for the wedding, I believe) and was quite nice - full breakfast with sausage, eggs, bacon, beans, tomato, mushrooms, black/white pudding - also offered were a variety of cereals,…

title: Braggin' on Balbriggan
review: Great experience overall in Balbriggan. Great Service. Ultra Friendly Staff. Excellent Restaurant. They got our rooms mixed at the beginning but apologized and gave an upgrade on the room. We paid a little and got a lot. The room and bed were very comfortable. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. We paid 80 euros for a 200 euro room. Fantastic.

title: Great stay
review: Huge, clean rooms.  Excellent food at on site restaurant.  Good service.  Good family hotel.
